James bit his lip. He wanted to reassure Max that all would be fine, but nothing seemed to be fine at this moment. Besides, lying to kids was a no-no. But he felt he had to, for this kid's sake.

"We're gonna win the Tests," James proclaimed surely. "And I'll travel down to Earth with you."

"What?" Max's eyes widened.

James laughed at his surprise. "Yep," he promised. "We're gonna search every city aisle for your sister. And I swear we'll find her!"

"You can't!" Max blurted. "Then how about your family...?"

"I'll visit them afterwards."

James had to be insane to promise all this - especially to some kid. Honestly, he was even postponing his visit to his family by doing so! To believe he did! After all, the only reason why he endured all that training and decided to fight some flying Demons - was to earn a trip to Earth to see his family!

And now, he'd forgoed his chance like it was nobody's business.

But somehow, though sounding cliche, James did feel happy. Just a teeny weeny bit. But enough.
11131221112.title: Max from Pandora?

choices: When he wakes up, something is different
11133.content:
Soon the two start to float down and arrive at a fancy looking building, landing in a plush plaza. A lavish mansion seemingly made of golden clouds.

“Wow. this is… amazing.”

“Thank you~” Myrrh comments. “It is my home. Well, the home of the queen but it is my home as well.” Myrrh closes her wings and starts walking inside, walking past two guards. They offer a nod to the princess and as James goes to enter they block his path, brandishing their spears. Myrrh looks behind her and gasps.

“Only those with permission may pass. Earth Born…” The tall male guard booms down to James. James felt intimidated when he heard Myrrh from behind them.

“Cease Gentlemen… he is with me. He has my permission to enter.” The two guards glare down at him, unmoving. Just as Myrrh is about to speak again, they move, granting James access inside. Myrrh smiles but sighs, beckoning James to follow. James does and eyes the guards as he walks in.

“Thanks. I thought for sure they were going to kick my ass.”

“They would have done much more than that. They are the best in all Misteria. They would have beat you within a speck of your life.” James is taken aback by that and rubs his head.

“Gee… thanks for telling.” He says halfheartedly.

“I told you, there is plenty of discrimination here. Be careful… Even the guards can get lax at Earthborn care…” Soon the two Misterians wander the halls and enter upon a lavish bedroom with a great bed. The walls were a hearty pinkish gold and were 4 meters high. A glass looking wall that seemingly overlooked another plaza with a pool. A full walk-in closet and bathroom were enclosed in their own respective walls. “This is my room,” Myrrh says. “For now, you’ll rest. It… must have been hard to wake up and be a Misterian and… be thrown around like that. I’ll leave you be and let you compose yourself. I’ll be back soon then we can start your lessons on how to fly. If there is anything you need, I will be just outside in the living space.” James nods and Myrrh leaves. James sighs as the doors close. He walks over to the bed and sits down and rubs his face. Now that he had time to think it truly was alarming just how much had changed in such a short time. One minute he was alive and next, he was part of a mythical race of beings that could fly! He would have to face some test to just be able to give his family some closure. James lays back and sighs. This was going to be a challenge. Certainly. He closes his eyes and falls asleep

111331.title: When he wakes up, something is different

choices: James tests out power a bit
1113311.content:
James wakes up from his nap, he feels something is different. He just had a dream where he was talking with his girlfriend, but his body felt different.

He sighs and rubs his face but feels something is off… James gets up and walks to the bathroom and finds a tub and shower. He shrugs and decides to wash himself up. He turns on the strange shower and gets the water running. As soon as he steps in he feels his body relax as if the water was melting away all his worries. He figures its just another perk of a Misterian lifestyle. A little while after he steps out and finds a towel to dry himself. As he does he thinks of his girlfriend and sighs. He really missed her and his family. All of it was taken in less than an instant in something he figured would be a good idea. Soon James wipes his face and looks in the mirror. … oh no.

“AAAAAAH!”

Myrrh hears James yell then rushes into her room.

“James?! Are you okay? What’s wrong?” She sees the steam from the restroom and enters to find a half-naked James… with a female face!

“I-I’m a girl! I-I thought I was a guy a second ago! I thought you said I was fine.” Myrrh gets a bit worried as well but she sees James’ face snap back into his original shape. She lifts her head in acknowledgment.

“James, you’re fine. It’s one of the side effects of the ritual. Look back in the mirror.”

“Huh?” Confused, James looks back and sees his face. He gasps and strokes his face, “I’m back!” He laughs and smiles, turning back to Myrrh who is now blushing. He looks down and realizes he’s half-naked from the waist up.

“I-I’ll let you… finish cleaning yourself. I can explain it later.” Myrrh backs out of the room and closes the door behind her. James blushes and sighs looking down at his body, his skin red and warm from embarrassment. Soon he gets his clothes and puts them on. He goes to the door and opens it to see Myrrh looking into the mansion’s hall.

“Uh … hey, sorry about that. F-figured I’d take a shower and-”

“You’re fine. You’ve been through a lot. I just… didn’t expect you to be a shifter.” Myrrh cuts him off and enters her room, lightly pushing past James. “Come inside and close the door. It’s easier with fewer distractions.” James is confused but nods, closing the door and following Myrrh to the center of the room. She sits on her bed and sighs.

“You have a shifting ability, most Misterians have it, fewer find a good use for it other than causing mischief.” She grumbles slightly but composes herself. “It’s very similar to the disguises we use on our quests and tests on earth. Allow me to demonstrate.” Myrrh closes her eyes then James sees her body changing before him. Myrrh’s pale composure turns a light bronze with pale beauty marks around her eyes and on her left shoulder, their shapes spotty and organic. Her hair lightens into a deep shade of blonde, more akin to gold. She wears a long red wavy dress “This was one of my disguises. When those… things cornered me I reverted to my natural form.” Myrrh puts a hand on her hip and plays with her hair which was done up in a short ponytail, which showed off her unique ball earrings. “ Misterians can only change their appearance of things on Earth and in preparation for tests and quests, but as I said a most can change their appearance here on a whim. It can lead to some issues if you’re not careful.” Myrrh crosses her legs and sighs “Well since we’re here we might as well test it out. Shapeshifting requires concentration. You have to be thinking of a certain… thing…”

“A certain thi- wait wait wait, you want me to change my face?”

“No, I want you to change your body,” Myrrh says sternly.

“My body?! But I just got it!”

“Your body is like … like your clay. You can change it however you want. You will always revert into the form you truly desire” James is stunned but looks over himself. He starts thinking, attempting to concentrate on a form he wants to try. The image in his mind came to him. Pale complexion with short strawberry auburn hair. He focused harder and harder until the image became clear in his mind and felt more comfortable. “Yes.. exactly like that.” James could feel his body changing, his chest expanding, his sides shrinking, and his hips widening. James slowly opens his eyes and looks down and finds himself in the body he imagined. He smiled and went back into the bathroom and saw that he looked exactly the same as the image in his head.

“Wow! This is awesome!”

“Awesome? I know not that exclamation. If you mean it is awe-inspiring I suppose it would be for an Earthborn…” James looks to Myrrh and rolls his eyes. He looks at her and feels a tingle in his body. While the rest of his body had changed, it certainly didn’t change what was in his pants. James blushes and looks back to the mirror, he certainly did admire Myrrh’s new body… a lot. He then remembers Myrrh’s earrings. He wondered if they could be added to his new body too. He tries again not closing his eyes this time, wanting to see the earrings come about. Indeed as the image comes to his head he sees the earrings form! Medium-sized hooped earrings grow from nothing and hook onto his ears. James blushes but smiles at his new body and creation, enjoying his new feminine features. He concentrates and focuses on his face again, making his chin longer and more narrow and his jaw more smooth and soft while making his eyelashes longer.

“See, you’re already getting the hang of it~” Myrrh teases. “You can change everything about yourself as a shifter. Your clothes for example.” James looks at Myrrh and sees that her dress sinks into her body then changes into an all-white two-piece swimsuit that supports her now large chest. James blushes more and leans into the sink to hide his arousal. “Now you try~” James looks back at Myrrh and then back to the mirror. James shrugs and thinks of one of mimicking Myrrh. As he concentrates he sees his shirt and jeans merging into his frame then sees a black one-piece swimsuit emerging from within. He laughs and smiles as he stands in his new swimsuit-clad body. Myrrh smirks and chuckles and stands up and reverts her form. “Well now that that’s sorted, we can discuss other business, head out to the living space and we can discuss how you will do your test. James’ blush disappears as he remembers what he’s supposed to be doing. He nods and he feels his form snap back into his Misterian form. He groans as the feeling felt like his entire body was smacked by a rubber band. Myrrh sees this and sighs. “Oh yes, be careful changing back too quickly, you could hurt yourself if you don’t know what you’re doing.”

“Gee, thanks for warning me.” Myrrh rolls her eyes and blushes.

“Silence. I will wait for you outside.” With that Myrrh leaves and closes the door behind her. James sighs and looks back in the mirror. His family and friends… he had to think about his family and friends.

Who do they visit?
111331121.title: Myrrh walks in

choices: James joins Myrrh on her errands
1113311213.content:
A short jaunt through the city later the pair arrived at a curious looking house. It was the middle of the day, yet all the curtains were still closed. Unfazed by this, Myrrh simply walked in. James wondered if Misterians had a use for locks and keys. They might proclaim to be all morally superior to humans, but this still just seemed rude to him.

"Cathy! You home?" She yelled, and from a distant room a response came.

"Myrrh, it's been so long. I'm in the back."

With a spring in her step the princess walked towards the voice. James followed her, unaware of what he was about to wander into. The large, circular room was outfitted into a lavish art studio. Easels with paintings in various states of completion stood next to the wall and in the center, sat atop a pile of pillows, was the artist.

He nearly popped his eyes out of his skull when he saw her. Myrrh had clearly failed to mention that this artist was no Misterian like herself. She was a medusa. Her legs were replaced with scaly, serpentine coils and her hair was snakes, writhing and hissing at the intruder. He remembered little about ancient mythology, but he knew that meeting her gaze would spell his doom.

"James, meet Catheryn. She knows more about shapeshifting than anyone I've met. Cathy, this is James, he's an Earth-born and my friend and we need your help preparing him for his Test."

The medusa reached out a hand. "Jamesss... good to meet you. Any of Myrrh's friends are welcome here. Don't be afraid, my gaze is harmlesss to Misterians. Even Earth-born like you ssshould not fear."

He hesitantly shook hands with the monster, shuddering a little as her snake-hair stared him down. He wasn't a fan of snakes at the best of times, and this creature really didn't ease him into accepting them now.

"It's not just us Misterians up here. Tons of creatures you humans believe are mere myth live with us. And Catheryn is one of the greatest shapeshifters among them."

The medusa smiled at her friend, but she could see the human was still very clearly unnerved by her. She took a deep breath and began to reshape herself before him. Both to put him at ease and to demonstrate what she could do. Her long, serpentine tail began to shrink, the scales shifting to a blueish hue. The rough surface of her coils turned smooth, closer to a fish than a snake. James' jaw fell open when the twisting serpents fell down as locks of red hair, draped along a pair of shapely shoulders. A revealing bra covered a large set of breasts. When she was done, Catheryn had turned into a mermaid, beckoning him closer.

"There... now you're not the only fish out of water." She joked, putting a smile on James' face. "Once you realize how few limits there are on shape-shifting you'll be able to create pure art with it."

"Wow..." The man replied, awestruck by the display. Not just the act of transformation, but also the beautiful woman she had turned into. His enamored gaze had not gone unnoticed.

"I don't need to be a medusa to leave men rock-hard." She said with a laugh, prompting a chuckle from Myrrh as well. James was too distracted to pay attention, staring lovingly at the mermaid. "Now, shall we work on your training, or did you have something else in mind?"

"There's a few errands I need to run first." Myrrh piped up. "How about you two get started and I'll meet up with you in a few hours."
1113311213.title: Catheryn, a medusa

choices: Tyra gets a tour of Skyaira.
112.content:
"How did I become a girl!?" asked James, her voice panic filled. "What happened to me!?"

"Be at peace... Tyra." said Myrrh, calmly. "As I explained, there is a certain randomness involved when we use our magic to rebirth a human into a Misterian."

"Why couldn't she have just healed me, left me human?" asked James, frightened. "How am i going to explain this to my family, my friends...." he paused. "What did you call me?"

Myrrh winced. "I know this is all a bit of a shock to you." she said. "Had we done nothing, you would have died and neither I or my mother know how a human body works, this was your best chance to live." she then sighed. "As for your previous family and friends, you are Tyra now, James is... (gulp) ...dead."

"You mean... I can't go back?" asked James, now Tyra. her lips quivered. "What have you done to me?"

"I am sorry, Tyra." said Myrrh. "I could not just stand idle by as you slowly passed away, in my arms..."

Tyra sighed, a turbulence of emotions running through her head. "So what now?" she asked. "I don't know how to be a... Misterian, let alone a woman."

"I can help you, adjust." offered Myrrh, stepping closer. "The rebirth process made you my biological sister as you were rebuilt, reborn, from a piece of my mother's essence."

"Okay... sis." said Tyra, tears falling. "How can you help me cope with losing everyone I knew, everyone I loved...."

Myrrh answered by pulling her new sister into a warm hug and began to cry hysterically as Tyra then suddenly saw her old self, through Myrrh's eyes, sacrifice himself to save her and felt her sorrow as he was shot and fell to the ground before she lifted his head into her arms. A chorus of wailing tears filled the room as the two sisters shared a moment of mourning and loss....
112.title: A young winged woman.

1122.content:
After Tyra and Myrrh had both dried their tears, they slowly broke the embrace and gently touched foreheads, looking at each other with a sisterly-like love. Tyra was still shaken by that had just happened. She had experienced some type of psychic link with Myrrh, allowing her experience the fear of being attacked by three possessed men, seeing a man trying to help her, only to be mortally wounded by a gun shot.

"Do you understand now, Tyra?" asked Myrrh, softly. "It's best to allow your family and friends to believe that James Walker is dead, at least for now. They will grieve your passing but deep down..."

"...deep down, they'll know I'm still alive." said James. "They just won't know how."

Myrrh nodded. "You will eventually be able to tell your family the truth, when you learn to control your magic." she said. "This is so you will be able to..."

"...ensure they keep the truth hidden from the rest of the world." you finished. "I understand now, but... what now?"

Myrrh smiled. "It's time to see your new home." she said.

With that, she spread her wings then, with her fingers, counted down from three. Not knowing what to expect, Tyra spread her own wings then gave a surprised scream as the floor beneath her vanished and they both fell, the floor reappearing above them. "You're crazy!" you screamed. "We'll be splattered all over the ground!"

Myrrh laughed, her wings turning a shade of white and yellow. "Use your wings, sis." she said. "Come on, give it a try."

Tyra flapped her arms, desperate, causing Myrrh to laugh. Unknown to Tyra, her wings were turning a shade of indigo, as she had seen Myrrh's wings change when 'James' first met her.

"I never had wings before!" protested Tyra, crying. "Help me!"

Myrrh, realizing that Tyra was having trouble, quickly dove close enough to touch Tyra's head, giving her the knowledge and she immediately slowed her decent and flew back up with Myrrh following.

"I could have died... again!" said Tyra, annoyed, not knowing her wings were turning a color of black.

Myrrh blushed. "Sorry... sis." she said, her wings changing a shade of pink. "I would have caught you if you had failed, this is how we teach our children to fly, much like birds teach their young."

Baffled by the color changes, Tyra calmed down slightly. "I guess that makes sense." she said. "What's with the color changes, do they reflect your... err... our mood?"

Myrrh smiled, her wings returning to a white color. "Yes, that's exactly what they do." she said. "Good deduction, Tyra. White is happiness, black is anger, Indigo is fear, pink is embarrassment..."

"Okay, I get it." said Tyra, floating above the ground. she turned and let out a low gasp as she saw where she had come, a large piece of land, floating above the clouds! "Woah..."

http://www.fossli-hotel.com/Fossli.jpg

"That small building there, that's were we were?" she asked.

Myrrh nodded. "That is the hospital, separate from the mainland." she said. "Come, fly higher with me and see it all."

Eager, Tyra flew higher and gazed in wonder as she set eyes upon the main continent before her. It looked like an islands in the ocean yet, they were thousands of feet above the Earth. "This is unreal." she whispered.

Myrrh smiled. "Tyra, my sister..." she said, "Welcome to Skyaira, your new home."

http://arjanshahani.files.wordpress.com/...

Although Tyra was completely blown away by what she has seen thus far, she heard what Myrrh called her and threw her a confused look. Catching on, Myrrh smiled. "My mom used a piece of her essence, or life force, to rebuild you, remember?" she asked. "That makes you her daughter, my sister. If I had donated a piece of my essence, you would have likely become much younger, and my daughter."

"It's all a bit confusing." said Tyra, wincing.

Myrrh nodded. "As I said, its complicated." she replied. "Basically, you were magically reborn through a different mother, hence you became a different person, a Misterian."

Tyra nodded, not wanting to get too deep into everything just yet and allowed Myrrh to continue the tour. She led her new sister further inland until she pointed down. "That's the common areas." she said. "Its where we shop, trade, mingle, work, and so on. It's still early so, no one is out yet."

http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2456/3684...

"Why are there no roofs?" asked Tyra, confused.

"So we can all simply 'fly in'... of course." replied Myrrh with a giggle.

Tyra giggled back, thought nervously, her wings turning slightly pink. "Um... yeah, of course."

Continuing to fly inland, Tyra noticed that there was a lot of trees with little signs of 'civilization'. Again, picking up her thoughts, Myrrh giggled. "We are a telepathic race, Tyra." she explained. "We don't pry into other's minds but we can hear each other's questions and concerns."

"So why don't I see any major city down there?" asked Tyra.

"We Misterians like to share our world with nature." replied Myrrh. "We don't fight it as humans do."

http://farm4.static.flickr.com/3497/3311...

Finally, Myrrh took my hand and gestured me to stop and land on a wide but even path before pointing ahead. "That is the main palace." she said. "It may look ancient on the outside but it is quite modern and comfortable within." she smiled. "We keep it looking that way to honor our ancestors."

http://www.bible.ca/tracks/tracks-cambod...

"It's incredible!" said Tyra, her eyes wide with wonder.

"It's home." said Myrrh. "Our mother is queen Minerva, the ruler of Skyaira. Would you like to meet her?"

What does Tyra say?
1122.title: Tyra gets a tour of Skyaira.

11221.content:
"I guess I should meet your, err, our mom." said Tyra. "I'm her daughter now, right?"

Myrrh nodded, her wings turning a slight shade of pink. "She is queen Minerva, the one who saved your life." she replied, her wings turning a slight shade of indigo and pink. "Bear in mind, I doubt she'll be in a pleasant mood."


"I remember from the mind link." said Tyra, nodding. "You're afraid she'll have some harsh words for you?"

Myrrh nodded, tears forming. "I'm 485 years old yet I still can't hold my own against just three possessed men." she said, allowing her had to fall. "I'll never become a Valkyrie if I can't manage at least that."

Remembering her birth father's words, when she was James, Tyra placed a gentle hand on Myrrh's shoulder. "Not everyone is cut out to be a soldier... sis." she said. "Perhaps your calling is elsewhere."

"Perhaps." agreed Myrrh. "I've never held a job, being a princess, so I don't really know."

"Despite the link, I really don't know much about your world." said Tyra. "Maybe you can be a doctor or something."

Myrrh smiled. "The link is temporary." she said. "It's used to settle disputes between ourselves and help those who are having difficulties with their lives. Which means, yes, you still need to learn how to fly."

Tyra sighed then turned to see a floating island in the distance. "What is that?" she asked.

http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2413/1674...

Myrrh looked and giggled. "Oh, that, its the smallest island of Skyaira." she said. "no one really knows what to do with it yet so, right now, its a park." she gestured me to follow. "Shall we?"

Tyra followed Myrrh into the long open entrance of the palace and shivered as she saw a number of lifelike statues standing on the sides of the hall. On one side were women in strange armor, their wings folded down with a almost gray color to them while, on the other side, were men in similar armor At least she thought they were men as they had shorter hair yet they had the same bus as the women.

"They are the Valkyrie and Archangels." whispered Myrrh. "They are not permitted to move or speak unless they are relieved by another guard or they must act to protect the palace."

Tyra nodded, understanding then continued to follow her sister into the palace. The interior was far more modern looking with smooth stone walls that, to her surprise, changed to show an image of her saving Myrrh. Confused by this, she turned to her sister who blushed. "the walls here react to each visitor, showing their personality and past deeds so the guards further in can see their true intentions." she explained. "The walls here portrayed you as a human hero." she pointed at the walls as they changed to a scene with Tyra and Myrrh holding hands. "Now, it shows you are one of the royal family, which is why you are not being questioned."

"This place is amazing." breathed Tyra. "I could get to like it here."

Myrrh smiled. "There is a lot for you to learn, my little sister." she said. "I'll show you it all.. after my punishment."

"Punishment?" asked Tyra, shocked.

Myrrh nodded. "I went to the surface to gather a rare herb that does not grow here in Skyaira." she said. "That's when I was approached by the possessed men." she sighed. "You call this rare herb marijuana."

Tyra struggled not to giggle as she knew from her previous life that marijuana had healing properties, when used in small amounts but she never suspected it would be used by Misterians.
11221.title: Yes.

112211.content:
At the end of a long, beautifully decorated hallway, Tyra and Myrrh reached a set of massive stone doors. These were made of stone and decorated with multi colored stones that seemed to randomly change color. As Tyra and Myrrh approached, they saw the image of a frightened little Misterian girl standing next to a nervous Misterian teenager. "What!?" asked Tyra, surprised by what she saw. "Who are they?"

"Us." blushing, Myrrh replied. "The doors show a reflection of how the person feels as they approach the chambers of our queen, our mother, Minerva."

"That's a little disturbing." unnerved, Tyra said. she made a face, seeing the reflection change from a teenager to a small, annoyed girl. "Hey!"

A womanly giggle was heard and the doors opened with a low rumble to reveal a tall slender woman who was a near mirror image of Myrrh and Tyra. She wore an elegant crown on her head and a long flowing dress with a long royal looking robe over it, she was quite beautiful. "Welcome, my daughters." she said with a rueful smile. "Please, enter so we may speak in private surroundings."

Myrrh nodded, though she seemed to feel like the child in the image. Tyra felt like an annoyed child, being talked to like one by her new mother. Upon entering Minerva's chambers, she waved her hand, causing the doors to close, shutting out the sounds from the hall and beyond. Now in the privacy of the silent room, Minerva first addressed Tyra.

"A human who is possessed by a demon becomes twice as strong." explaining, she said. "You would have defeated three of them with only your strength and skills if the one had not possessed a hand gun." she then smiled. "That was an impressive sight to behold."

"You-you saw that?" asked Tyra, feeling nervous.

Minerva nodded. "You see, although I trust Myrrh, she is my only daughter." she told Tyra. "I was about to intervene when you jumped in from nowhere and took on the possessed men alone. "You seemed to have been winning until..."

"I know." said Tyra, shedding a tear. "I got shot and woke up here."

Minerva nodded. "We were in your debt for saving my daughter's life, saving your life, making you my second daughter, was all I could to to repay that debt." sadly, she said. "Believe me when I tell you that Myrrh got the lecture of a lifetime while you slept."

"So what now... mom?" asked Tyra.

Minerva smiled. "No, Myrrh must repay her debt to you by helping you cope with and adjust to your new life as princess Tyra of Skyaira." she replied. "Myrrh is older so she is next in line for the throne, if she fails to prove herself worthy, the crown will be passed onto you."

Both Myrrh and Tyra winced. "Great." they both thought, sarcastically.

"We have years to worry about that though." motioning to some love seat type chairs. "I want to hear about your former life, Tyra. What your family is like, who your friends were, and so on."

"Why?" asked Tyra, confused.

Again Minerva smiled. "All that you were is also in who you are now." she explained. "Your past experiences as a human will only enhance your new life here. James is not dead, he just... changed."
112211.title: Meeting Minerva.

1122111.content:
"Well, I was originally known as James Walker, an ordinary 21-year old living in Los Angeles, California." taking a breath, Tyra began. "Since birth, I had always dreamed of flying one day, which inspired me to learn to be a pilot." he smiled, thinking of the irony of his new situation. "To help me to achieve this, I was attending college with my friends."

"Taking classes so to learn to pilot an aircraft." said Minerva, smiling. "It seems fate has granted your wish in a way you could never have expected."

"You could say that." her wings turning pink, Tyra said. "It was summer break, a sort of vacation from school after completing my sophomore year of college." she winced. "However, on the way home, I heard a loud metal clang, like trash cans being thrown around and looked to see a young woman being attacked by three men who seemed to have been drunk or... possessed."

"You then charged in to my rescue and made short work of two of the possessed men." said Myrrh, lightly touching your shoulder. "I am forever in your debt."

"Some help I proved to be." said Tyra, sadly. "I got shot."

"As I had said, if the man had not a hand gun, you would have defeated three demons single handed." said Minerva, gently, smiling. "Besting one demon is impressive for a human, defeating two is more so." she giggled. "You have nothing to be ashamed of... Tyra."

"This chance meeting changed your life as an act of heroism on your part brought you out of one life and into ours, living among Misterians, what you would call a race of angels." said Myrrh. "Now, in a new form, you will adapt to this new life, while freely embracing the freedom of flight."

Tyra smiled sadly, knowing Myrrh was trying to help. "I have two younger siblings, Nicole and Trevor." she said, trying not to cry. "Nicole has the same dream of flight as I do, forming a strong bond between us. Trevor is more down to Earth, so to speak, but he too likes watching the skies." she giggled. "I have an older sister, Ellen. She's a bit protective of me, though I'm the one usually standing up for her. My mom and dad run the Robotics Corporation, they build robots used for deep sea exploration, fire fighting, and other places too dangerous for humans to enter."

"Very interesting." said Minerva. "Then you have a knowledge of machines."

"I know more than the average Joe." said Tyra, blushing slightly. "Only, I'm not what you would call an expert."

Minerva nodded. "Any close friends?" she asked.

"I have two best friends." replied Tyra, nodding. "Nate and Erin Wilson. I think Erin had a bit of a crush on me." your voice sudden;y became lower as her tone changed. "I guess she won't have the chance to confess now."

Minerva then gave her a warm hug to help. "You are not the first to endure this transition." she said, gently. "It is always hard to let go of one life and start another, it will take time and the pain will not go away but it will get better."

Tyra then hugged Minerva back gently as she wrapped her wings around her new daughter. "It's all right, Tyra." she whispered. "You may be able to begin looking towards moving on sooner rather than later."

"Thanks" said Tyra as she let go from Minerva, feeling a bit better now.

Minerva smiled. "This is a lot to take in." she said. She then turned to a chiming noise deeper within her chambers. "It was a pleasure to talk to you, Tyra. Please allow Myrrh to show you the wonders of our world."

With that said, she escorted us to the door and motioned the doors to open. As Minerva's chamber doors closed behind us, Tyra turned to Myrrh, confused. "What was that all about?" she asked.

Myrrh smiled. "She is the queen, sis." she replied. "She has other duties besides talking to her daughters." she paused, thinking then asked, "Where would you like to go first? The market or your new chambers?

Which does Tyra choose?

113.content:
"What the.....!!!!" screamed James as he saw his new reflection in the mirror. Or should we say "she" saw "her" new reflection. James didn't see a young 21-year old man in the mirror. Instead, what he saw was a petite young girl who looked around 10 years old. His/her hair was dark like Myrrh's, looking almost like a dark violet or something close to that. It was also now down to just past her shoulder blades in straight long locks. Her build was small and delicate with fair skin. Her face was youthful and cute for her age, if not a bit similar to Myrrh herself. She also saw that she was wearing an orange skirt with similar colored panties (or whatever they're called) underneath. On her back, pure white wings pertruded from her body, shimmering in the light.

However, one fact stood out to her: She was topless!

"Ahhh!" yelled James as she crossed her arms in front of her to try and cover her half-naked body. She must not be experiencing puberty yet as she was completely flat with no signs of adulthood on the horizon so to speak. Surprisingly to her, Myrrh softly giggled and came over to James, gently uncrossing her arms and exposing her chest again.

"Relax Tyra. It's fine" she said softly.

"T-Tyra?" asked James with confusion. Myrrh looked James straight in the eye.

"Your new name that I came up with. You're not human anymore and you're a girl now. You needed a new name" explained Myrrh. "Tyra" nodded in reply.

"So, why Tyra?" she asked.

"It means "Thor's daughter". Thor was the god of thunder and protector of innocent women, just like you did for me" explained Myrrh, a thankful smile on her face. Seeing her made Tyra smile as well.

"So, the randomness issue is why I'm 10 years old and a girl now?" asked Tyra. A nod from Myrrh answered her question. Then, she noticed how different their wings were. Tyra's were solid and bird-like, unlike the energy wings Myrrh possessed. However, Myrrh must have red her mind considering what she said next.

"You're wondering why your wings are different?" she asked, getting a surprised look from Tyra. "We are telepathic, so I can read your mind. Relax though, I won't do it often" she further explained, seeing the worried look on Tyra's face.

"So, no privacy?" asked Tyra with a smirk. This brought forth a little giggling from both girls.

"Maybe. Anyway, the reason why your wings are different is because you're a child. Misterians possess bird-like wings at birth and keep them through their teenage years. For males, theirs continue to become more muscular as they age. For girls, they start to glow unpon reaching puberty, which you haven't reached yet. Once you reach 17 years old, we have a Coming-of-Age ceremony where a females' wings beome energy from their bodies" explained Myrrh.

"Wow, that's quite a development" Tyra said simply, getting a nod from Myrhh.

"Anyway, I'm sure you don't want to be topless any longer so let's get you properly fitted so we can meet mother" said Myrrh, a little worry in her voice.

"Who's mother?" asked Tyra. Myrrh looked away from Tyra's face.

"My mother and your grandmother: Queen Minerva"
113.title: A winged girl (about 10)

1131.content:
"W-Wait! My grandmother?!" yelled a surprised Tyra. Myrrh had included her in this but for what reason? Myrrh looked at Tyra.

"Well, when mother saved your life, it reshaped you into a member of our family. Basically, you became my daughter" explained Myrrh. This confused Tyra even more.

"Your daughter?!! How can that be?! You're not any older than I originally was!" Tyra responded in slight frustration. To her surprise, Myrrh started giggling. "What's so funny?" she asked.

"How old do you think I am?" asked Myrrh with a smile, as if this was a game. Tyra almost thought it was a trick question.

"Well, I imagine around 20 years or so, a little younger than I was before" she answered. However, this got Myrrh giggling even more. "Ok, what's the joke?!" yelled Tyra, angry at her 'mother' for teasing her.

"To the human eye, I may look around 20 years old. I'm actually 485 years old" said Myrrh. To say Tyra was shocked would be the understatement of the century.

"W-What?! How can that be?" asked Tyra, begging for an explanation.

"We Misterians live between 2500 and 3000 years. For a while, we age normally like humans. However, once we reach young adulthood, we stop showing almost all signs of visable aging for a long time. We start showing a little more age once we hit 1000 years" explained Myrrh. Tyra slowly nodded in understanding.

"So, when I reach my 20's, I'll stop aging as well?" she asked. Myrrh smiled.

"Yes young lady. Enjoy it for the next millenium" said Myrrh with another giggle. This actually got Tyra laughing as well.

"So, is there a 'daddy' too?" asked Tyra. Myrrh shook her head.

"Nope, I do have a mate yet" she responded.

"Mate?" asked Tyra.

"Misterians don't marry like humans do. We mate for life, similar to animals in your world. We have a mating season which I will explain to you later. That's the only time when we can mate or become pregnant" explained Myrrh.

"So, you're 485 years old but don't have a mate?" asked Tyra. Myrrh nodded.

"I don't think I'm ready to be in a commited relationship now. I'm happy right now and I haven't met the 'one' for me yet. I'm not even 500 yet so I'm not in a rush. You may find yourself in that situation sometime. You have all the time in the world to mate. Just enjoy life as it comes. That's how Misterians think" said Myrrh.

"One step at a time huh? I like how that sounds" said Tyra.

"Well, case and point, I'll have to take care of you know. I know it will be hard but, like it or not, I'm your mother from now on. So, you better get used to it" said Myrrh, trying to act like a mother would. Too bad the look on her face gave away from the fact that she was acting.

Tyra however was unsure. It was too much in too little time. Time would be needed to adjust.
1131.title: Another Explanation

11311.content:
"Well, enough about that. I'd say it's time to get you into proper wardobe. You're certainly not going to see mom topless" said Myrrh. Tyra took one look and remembered that all she was wearing was an orange skirt.

"Speaking of which, why am I wearing only a skirt?" she asked.

"It's sleepwear for you" said Myrrh. Seeing the confused look on Tyra's face, she continued. "When we sleep, we wear only skirts for freedom of the legs. We both wear the same underwear underneath of course. Don't worry though, as only mates and families can see each other topless" said Myrrh.

"You use the word "same underwear" pretty broadly" said Tyra.

"Of course. Both males and females wear the same underwear" explained Myrrh. Tyra was shocked yet again.

"Ok, how is that physcially possible?" asked Tyra. Myrrh knew where Tyra was coming from and answered.

"In a sense, both females and males posess a vagina as you call them. However, men keep their manhoods in them. They only come out when they are sexually aroused. You know what I'm talking about so that's why I tell you this" explained Myrrh.

"Wow, the lines between male and female seem a little more blurred here" said Tyra.

"Of course. In our society, men and woman are all balanced and equal. We have no, as you call it, sexism here. Men do things here that may be considered unnatural to humans" explained Myrrh. Tyra now knew that there tons of things she had yet to learn in this world. "Well anyway, I've brought clothes for you that should fit. Let's get the skirt off" said Myrrh as she helped Tyra remove the skirt, leaving just the panties.Myrrh almost enjoyed herself at seeing Tyra's face invent a new shade of red.

"Can we PLEASE get some clothes on me now?" asked Tyra, a little impatiently.

"All right all right. In our world, both boys and girls your age wear these tops" she said, gesturing to the top of her pile. It looked like a small green toga dress that would probably act similar to a t-shirt. First off, Myrrh helped her put on a training bra. She explained that it was to help girls get used to it as breasts could be heavy. Boys wear one for the same reasons.

"Let's put this one on next" said Myrrh as she helped Tyra put on the toga top. It hugged nicely around Tyra's torso and didn't interfere with her wings. Myrrh then clasped it around Tyra's left shoulder.

"For girls, it clasps aorund their left shoulder. It's the right shoulder for boys" explained Myrrh, which got a nod from Tyra. Next, there was what looked like a skort, a pair of shorts combined with a skirt. It was also a little feathered like Myrrh's. It was also dark blue in color.

"These are next" explained Myrrh. She didn't really have to help here as Tyra could figure this part out easily. The shorts part of it felt good for Tyra and the skirt feeling was something to get used too.

"Lastly, there are these" said Myrrh as she brought out a pair of brown sandals similar to her own. Tyra sat down and watched as Myrrh showed her how to strap the sandals around her feet and calves.

"Ouch!" said Tyra after Myrrh accidentily pulled too hard.

"Sorry, my bad" said Myrrh as she loosened up until Tyra was comfortable. She then used the larger velcro strap to wrap around her ankles.

"All right, got those done. Let me fix your hair as well. I bet your annoyed with it falling in your face" said Myrrh, apparently very observent as that was exactly what Tyra believed. Myrrh pulled out a small green-blue hairband and pulled back Tyra's shoulder-length hair, leaving her bangs to fall on her face. She pulled the hair back into a ponytail that started on the top corner of the back of her head..

"There, it is done. Take a look" said Myrrh, pointing to the mirror again. When Tyra got there, she couldn't recognize herself. There, standing in the mirror, was a pretty angel girl with her new clothing. The new ponytail made her look even more like a child and her white wings were something to behold.

"Unreal" was all Tyra could say at her new look.

It was only the beginning.
11311.title: An Angel's Wardrobe

113111.content:
"You know, there's something else I find odd" said Tyra. She was looking in the mirror and noticed something off with her face. Her eyes were different. Well, one was anyway. She normally had blue eyes. Now, her left eye was green.

"What's that?" asked Myrrh.

"What's up with my eyes? My left eye is green now" said Tyra. Myrrh smiled as she figured Tyra would notice eventually.

"I'm glad you noticed. It symbolizes that you were once a human who changed as thanks for the bravery you showed. Those who selflessly sacrifice themselves, such as you, are granted the power to become Misterians. The difference in your eyes shows that you have earned the right to be amongst our race" explained Myrrh.

"Wow. Interesting" said Tyra, surprised at this development. Then, she asked again, "It's funny. You would think that I'd be hysterical at this transformation and yet I've been rather calm".

"Another side effect of the magic. It helps to calm the nerves so you can think rationally" said Myrrh.

"Sounds very helpful. So, where to now?" asked Tyra.

"The Sky Castle. It's where the royal family lives. We have to go talk with mother. Oh, she is going to be sooooo mad when she sees me!" Myrrh almost yelled. Tyra was getting kind of worried about what kind of person Queen Minerva was.

"Well, let's go" said Myrrh as she gently grabbed Tyra's hand and went towards the door. It almost looked like a stone slab and was tan colored. Myrrh touched the door and it slowly vaporized into thin air.

"Woah" said Tyra as she witnessed the event. Myrrh smiled as she did.

"That's how doors work. It'll reform after we leave through it. I'll show you how we make sure we keep our privacy later. Not just anyone can open doors, just like in your world" said Myrrh as she explained to Tyra. It made sense to her so she made no further comment on it.

"Come on" said Myrrh as she escorted Tyra outside of the room where she was resting. Outside led to a small paved sidewalk over a grassy area. A small hill blocked the view. Tyra suddenly became excited. She assumed that over that hill was the Misterian homeland. Without another moment, she let go of Myrrh's hand and ran up the small hill.

What she saw was beyond her wildest dreams.

http://digital-art-gallery.com/oid/0/640...

Apparently, this 'hospital' so to speak was on a small isolated island to the west of the mainland. The mainland was glorious beyond natural belief. The Misterian world was a large floating continent with numerous smaller floating islands surrounding it. The mainland seemed to be the equivient of a big city from the human world. It had many houses that were made from stone and covered with straw roofs that looked very sturdy. The meeting area and busier areas od the city looked to be roofless structures to allow Misterians to just fly in. Tyra could make out the busy life there, as if it was nothing different from living in Los Angeles.

Homes:
http://photos.worldisround.com/photos/28...

Public Area:
http://cache2.artprintimages.com/p/LRG/3...

Alongside them was a bugger complex that seemed to house many children. Tyra assumed that it was a school. There was also a coliseum that seemed to house sports events. Tyra seemed to notice that, despite the incan and mayan influences here and there, it was mostly a cover as many things seemed to mostly resemble modern homes from where she used to live.

On top of the mainland was a giant temple-like structure that Tyra assumed was the Sky Castle. On the oustide, it looked beyond old. However, Tyra assumed that it looked much more grand on the inside. Aside from the mainland, the other floating islands seemed to mostly just house homes and neighborhoods. They were all of varying size. Beyond the land, clouds surrounded the area, adding a sense of fantasy to the magical world. The sun beamed over the land, not feeling that hot at all to Tyra.

Sky Castle:
http://www.wallcoo.net/human/Cambodia/im...

The grand majesty that was the Misterian home almost literally took Tyra's breath away.

"A-Amazing" said the young girl in awe of what was to be her new home. Myrrh came up to her with a smile on on her face.

"Welcome to Skyaira, my little girl. Our home"
113111.title: A Whole New Home

1131111.content:
As Tyra smiled and at the grand majesty of Skyaira, Myrrh looked at her with a small smirk. She had a playful side that bordered on immaturity, although she was as kind and compassionate as anyone else.

"Well, what are you waiting for?!" yelled Myrrh as she gave Tyra a 'gentle push' in the right direction. Unfortunately for Tyra, Myrrh had the 'gentle push' of a drill sargeant. Tyra fell right over the edge of the small floating island.

"Ahhhhhhh!" yelled Tyra as she started falling. The wind tried to catch on her wings, which seemed to slow her down a bit. However, she flipped over and over as her altitude began to drop.

"What are you doing? You want to crash?" said Myrrh as she caught up to Tyra. Looking at Myrrh, she was positioned like she was laying back in a chair. This nonchalant attitude of hers both scared and infuriated Tyra.

"What are you doing?!! Shouldn't you, I don't know, teach me the basis?!!" yelled Tyra out of desperation for her life. She didn't want to die a second time.

"I believe in learning on the job" smirked Myrrh as she looked at her hand. "You might want to start flapping before you end up like a bug on the windshield of a plane" she continued.

'Sadist' Tyra thought in anger. Wasn't she supposed to be her mother now? You know, like, protect her and properly show her hwo to do things. Whatever the case, Tyra was scared as she was beginning to fall out of the protective barrier of the floating continent.

'I'm going to die again' thought the young girl in fear as her white wings turned a bright lavender in color. Not that she noticed as she placed her hands over her eyes. Believing that she was going to die again, she closed her covered eyes as her tears began to fall. Her fall was inevitable.....

Or so it was as she suddenly felt a hand grabbing her left hand. Slowly opening one eye, she saw Myrrh holding her up, just before she got to the barrier.

"Well, I guess you'll have more time to practice" said Myrrh, apparently with not much concern.

"Time?! Are you ok with making me feel like I was going to die again?!" yelled Tyra, her wings suddenly brightening to a red color. That was something Myrrh noticed and she felt a little guilty.

"I'm sorry. I just thought that the experience would help you learn faster. You weren't in any real danger. I wouldn't have let you fall beyond the barrier" explained Myrrh.

Tyra sighed as she was being uplifted by Myrrh. Myrrh was an interesting character to say the least. Being her daughter would be an adventure in itself.

With the distractions over for now, it was time to head to the Sky Castle.
1131111.title: Flight Orientation

11311111.content:
Myrrh helped Tyra fly over to where the Sky Castle was.

"So, other than that little show earlier, what do you think of flying?" asked Myrrh.

"It's fun, although I'm not really flying right now. You're mostly just helping me glide" said Tyra. Despite her words, she truely was enjoying this. It paled in comparison to how she would eventually feel when she could really fly but that would be for another day. Anyway, the Sky Castle loomed above them, perched on the top of the city.

"Wow, it's huge!" said Tyra in amazement. Myrrh smiled at her words.

"Well of course it is. Castles are normally huge" said Myrrh with a hint of sarcasm. Tyra rolled her eyes and allowed Myrrh to hold her hand as she escorted them both into the castle. Inside was quite a sight to Tyra. In some ways, it resembled England beause there were guards stationed there. There were males and females and they weren't moving or talking at all.

"The females are Valkyries and the males are Archangels" explained Myrrh in a small voice. Tyra nodded to confirm she got the whisper. It was almost creepy walking past the guards as they were barely anything more than statues from the way they acted. After walking past the guards, Tyra marveled at the grand majesty of the castle. Myrrh explained as they went along.

"The main hall here is decorated with finely finished colored stone, kind of like stained glass. They say it can show a person's past, hopes, and fears" explained Myrrh. Tyra gasped at such a relic in this castle. As they continued on, they also saw crystal-shaped lights, or what appeared to be anyway.

"Those lights react to someone's presence. They go out when that presence leaves" explained Myrrh again. Tyra nodded in confirmation of the info. Tyra continued to look at the rather modrn looking appearance of the castle. Despite it's older-than-dirt look on the outside, it was birght, shiny, and more modern on the inside. Tyra imagined that it was to pay homage to their ancestors or something.

"Ah, here we are" said Myrrh as they came to pair of peach-colored doors. It had a glyph on it that Myrrh slowly touched with her hand. It glowed and the doors opened. Tyra immediately saw Myrrh's wings turn a bright purple when she did. She still didn't know what it meant but she knew that Myrrh was incredibly nervous right now.

The two angels walked inside to the throne room, the doors closing behind them with a loud noise. Tyra looked forward and got her first glimpse of Queen Minerve. As she thought, she looked like an older version of Myrrh. She had long dark hair with an older face than Myrrh. She also had a laurel crown on her head as she was the queen. She wore what seemed to be a white dress with some regal touches here and there.

However, what caught Tyra's eyes was that Minerva's wings were a bright red, with some spots of black.

'This can't be good' she thought.
11311111.title: The Castle in the Sky

113111111.content:
Once they were both in Queen Minerva's presence, the older woman observed the both of them. Tyra felt as if she was seeing into her mind or soul right now. That's the feeling you get around the queen. Tyra noticed that her features seemed to soften a little bit as she glanced at her. However, they seemed to get much angrier again once she looked at Myrrh.

The poor girl looked terrified right now, as she if she expected her own mother to sentence her to death or something. Minerva's wings stayed a bright red as she finally spoke.

"Now, I believe you both know why you're here." she started, getting a nod from the both of them. She then turned to Myrrh, "Well Myrrh, your stubborness has always been a problem. Now, it's cost a human the life, family, and friends he had on Earth. How can you justify yourself?" she said in a calm voice. However, even the guards could sense the hidden anger in her voice. It was clear that Minerva wasn't just mad at Myrrh for her actions: she was furious!

"I-I'm sorry m-mother!!" stuttered Myrrh, barely keeping her composure at all. "I-I just t-thought that I-I could handle i-it!" she continued, trying to defend herself. Minerva's expression did not soften in the least.

"You thought you could? How many times do I have to tell you that you shouldn't take chances like that?" said Minerva, emphasizing the 'thought' part. "You could have simply called for back up if it was too hard. Then perhaps this girl would still have her life" said Minerva, gesturing to Tyra. Tyra didn't know what to say. This seemed to be between just Minerva and Myrrh for now.

Myrrh was holding her head down in shame. She couldn't even bear to look her mother in the eye, something Minerva noticed and her features hardened more. "Myrrh, look at me" she said. It wasn't a request; it was a command. However, Myrrh was still too scared to do it. "Look at me now!" said Minerva with more force, the first outburst she had during the whole conversation. Myrrh's head shot up, tears leaking out of her eyes and falling down her face. Tyra couldn't help but feel sorry for her 'mother'. Sure, she got her into this mess but it's not like Myrrh intended for her to get shot.

Mnerva sighed in frustration. "Honestly Myrrh, when are you going to grow up a little? You're 485 years old now. You should know better. You should be much more mature, especially since you're a princess and my only child. Instead, you insist on being your usual proud and stubborn self" said Minerva. Myrrh felt another pang of guilt as her mother continued the beat down. "You're supposed to be able to take the throne of Skyaira in the future once I step down. Yet, no one can take you seriously because of your immaturity. You're a kind and compassionate girl but you allow your more undesirable qualities to be the ones the people see" Minerva continued.

Myrrh's will was so weak right now. More tears were falling from her face as she struggled to keep herself from breaking out in tears. Minerva was powerful like that. It was one of the many qualities she possessed as queen. Tyra was beginning to think that this was going too far. Like it or not, Myrrh was now her mother. She didn't want to take her mother getting chastised like a child.

"Ok, you know, don't you think you've gone far enough" said Tyra, getting the attention of the queen and Myrrh. "Sure, she got me into this mess but she's my mother now. She's not a bad person and she doesn't deserve to be talked down to like that!" Tyra almost yelled. Myrrh was stunned silent in both fear and gratitude for Tyra's word. However, Tyra was beginning to think she stepped out of bounds.

"Um, sorry" said Tyra, hoping that the queen wasn't mad at both of them now. However, to their amazement, Minerva actually gave a small smile.

"You are a very forgiving person. First off, I commend you for your selfless bravery for helping my daughter. I can see that, thanks to the essense I used, you are now my granddaughter?" asked Minerva. Tyra nodded in reply. She then turned to Myrrh again and her features hardened once again.

"Now Myrrh, as for your punishment, I imagine being forced to take are of your new daughter will satisfy for now. You will raise Tyra here to be a proper Misterian. If this incident ever happenes again or if I find out that you haven't properly taught her as a mother should, your punishment will be even more severe. I can't protect you Myrrh. It's time you finally learned responsibility" said Minerva.

"Y-Yes mother" said Myrrh, a little more calm but her tears had stopped. Her eyes were still moist though.

"Good, I hope you will learn something from this. As for Tyra, I believe we should get you into school for tomorrow. You should start learning what we teach here" she went on to say.

Both girls nodded at her words.

"Good. Then you are both dismissed for now. Show the newest member of our royal family to her new room" commanded Minerva. Myrrh and Tyra both nodded and turned to leave.
113111111.title: Minerva's Judgment

1131111111.content:
Myrrh and Tyra walked down the hallway following their meeting with Queen Minerva. Myrrh was still shaken from the harsh words she got from her mother. It surprised Tyra for Minerva to have such power. Before, she thought of Myrrh as a strong-willed person who could stand tall in any situation. With just a few words, Minerva had shattered Myrrh's will and the girl nearly broke down in her prescence.

"It's ok 'mother'. That was kind of harsh of her" Tyra said, attempting to reassure her.

"No, I deserved each and every word. If it wasn't for me, you wouldn't be like this" said Myrrh, sadness still evident in her voice. With that, Tyra suprised Myrrh by giving her a hug.

"But you'll take care of me for now right?" asked Tyra, truely looking like a child that needed guidance. Myrrh put on a sad smile and hugged the young girl back.

"Of course, I'll take care of you the best I can" said Myrrh, a little happier. It made Tyra happy that Myrrh was cheering up a bit. The two continued down the hallway, with Myrrh making turns here and there.

"Your room will be next to mine so I'll be able to look after you" said Myrrh. This sounded reasonable to Tyra so she nodded in reply. Suddenly, they appeared at a stone door, similar to the hospital door. Myrrh let Tyra go ahead of her.

"Go ahead, Just touch the door. Your signature is added to it so it'll react to you" said Myrrh. Tyra nodded apprehensively and gently touched the door. Instantly, it faded into thin air like before, allowing entry into the room beyond it. Tyra smiled as she was excited to see her new bedroom. The two girls entered the room and Tyra gasped at her room.

It was about average-sized, with peach-colored walls through out the room. There were dresser-like cabinets which contained what Tyra imagined to be clothes. Misterians had some variety of clothes but not much. There was a pretty large window, which led to a balcony. That would allow Tyra to get out and fly around whenever she wanted.

"Wow" said Tyra in amazement at her new room. The, something caught her eye. There was no bed in the room. Instead, she saw a large 'love seat' which had a covering to use for privacy if needed. "Um, what is that?" asked Tyra to Myrrh. Myrrh nodded after understanding Tyra's predicament.

"That ia a bed for young kids and male Misterians" said Myrrh.

"What about the bed that I was laying in earlier?" asked Tyra.

"Don't you remember? You were in a sitting position on that bed, not laying down. Laying down in a bed like humans is only for mature female Misterians. This is because we can turn our energy wings on and off so to speak so we can sleep on our backs. However, you know that young Misterians as well as mature males have solid wings. They can't sleep on their backs because they might injure their wings. So, they sleep in a kneeling position in the bed there and wrap their wings around them to keep warm. We also use a wrap around the wings that is also for warmth" explained Myrrh.

"A kneeling position? That doesn't sound comfortable" said Tyra, making Myrrh smile again.

"Trust me. When you're tired and ready for bed, you'll feel plenty comfortable" assured Myrrh. Tyra would just have to wait until tonight to find out if it was true.
1131111111.title: After the meeting

11311111111.content:
As Tyra and Myrrh walked out of Tyra's new room, her stomach suddenly growled. This drew an embaressing blush to Tyra's cute face. This drawed a giggle from Myrrh.

"I see someone is hungry" said Myrrh, still giggling. Surprisingly to Tyra, she softly giggled in response after patting her belly with one hand.

"Yeah, guess I forgot that I haven't eaten since I got here" she said.

"Well, let's fix that then" said Myrrh. With that, she navigated Tyra through the castle walls once again, explaining things along the way when Tyra didn't understand something. Soon enough, they entered a room with a grand table with many seats. They were similar to the one Minerva was sitting on, with a narrow back to help the wings. Near the table was a balcony which allowed the fresh air to come in with no problems.

"All right, you sit down and I'll make something. It's the least I should do as your mother" said Myrrh as she walked away and through another door to prepare a nice lunch for the two of them. Once she was in the other room and out of sight, Tyra took a random seat at the table.

"Hmm, feels nice" she said as she relaxed. The narrow back chair actually felt comfortable and allowed her wings to be free. She leaned back and closed her eyes as she felt the fresh wind breathe on her. To a Misterian, she figured that this must feel like heaven. It was nice and quiet.

At least, until she heard someone crying in apparent fear.

"Woah!! Ahh!!" yelled the unknown voice. It sounded like a young girls voice, at least to Tyra. She looked back and forth to try and find the source of the voice but couldn't see anyone there. She knew she heard someone but she saw no one.

"Are my ears playing tricks on me?" asked Tyra to herself. Her questions were answered when she suddenly heard a crash into the dining room. She turned towards the balcony, which was where the sound came from and gasped.

There, laying on the ground and badly hurt, was a young girl. She looked to be around the same age as Tyra. She wore a similar dress top like Tyras, except hers was orange. Her skort was bright yellow and her sandals were of the same color. She appeared to be a few inches shorter than Tyra with very soft skin. Her hair was a beautiful sun blonde color and it was shorter than Tyra's, going down to her neck. However, what really caught Tyra's attention was that she was laying face down of the floor in apparant pain and her wings seemed to be bruised.

"Are you alright?!" Tyra shouted as she ran to the injured girl. The girls face was contorted in pain and tears were falling out of her eyes. The floors of the castle were made of stone and she fell down hard. Tyra felt so sorry for the girl. She ran around the table and gently approached the young girl. She seemed to be having trouble getting up as she wimpered in pain.

"Hey, are you alright?" asked Tyra again, this time even softer. "Here, I'll help you up" she continued to say as she gently grabbed the young girl and tried to get her into a sitting position. The poor girl continued to lightly sob as she clutched her left arm. Apparently, she landed on it and it showed. It was badly bruised and bleeding slightly. Tyra knew from her human experience that she may have broken her arm.

"Oh my, that doesn't look good. Don't worry, I'll help you get to a doctor or something and we'll get you healed up" assured Tyra, smiling as if to comfort the injured girl. She hadn't said anything since she landed and it worried Tyra. However, soon her lips parted slightly, as if she was trying to find words to say.

"T-...Thank...y-you" said the girl in the softest voice Tyra had ever heard. Getting a closer look at her, Tyra felt how very soft her skin was. The sunlight seemed to glisten off it. What she also saw was her eyes. They were a deep blue color that almost looked mesmerizing. Tyrs then turned to the girls wings. They were currently white but they were bruised in so many places. To take a closer look, Tyra lightly touched a bruise on the wings, getting a cry of pain from the little girl. It surprised Tyra so much that she immediately backed off.

"P-Please...d-don't t-touch...my wings. It-t...hurts..too much" said the girl in her still soft voice. Tyra nodded in understanding and sat down with the girl. She seemed to be so fragile. She was so different from Myrrh. This girl looked like she could break as easily as glass.

"Do you have a name?" asked Tyra. The girl looked straight at her.

"I-It's L-Leala...Please...call me...Lea" said Lea, still struggling to talk.

"Lea? That's a good name" complimented Tyra. To her surprise and delight, Lea gave her a small smile.

"Thank you....W-What's...your name? she asked.

"I'm Tyra" said Tyra simply. Lea's eyes widened in surprise.

"T-Tyra? Y-You mean..as in...P-Princess Tyra?! S-So.. the rumors were..." said Lea, unable to complete her sentence. Tyra tried to comfort the girl as best as possible.

"Please, you can call me Tyra. No need for titles" she assured with a smile. To her delight, it also brought a small smile back to Lea's face.

"T-Tyra? Ok..." said Lea. Then, Tyra spoke up again.

"So, you know about me?" Tyra sked. Lea slowly nodded. Tyra began to figure that the word had spread in the few hours that she was knocked out. Especially that she was now part of the royal family. "Well, it looks like we're about the same age. How about it Lea? You want to be friends?" asked Tyra. Lea looked stunned.

"F-Friends? W-With...me?" asked Lea. Tyra smiled to assure Lea. She felt a surge of joy as the first true smile adorned Lea's soft face.

"T-Thank you" she said.

'I think this is the beginning of a great friendship, one that will help define us both.' thought Tyra. "Sharing experiences, triumphs and tears, helping each other find our place in this world.'

"That was beautiful." said Lea, giggling as she said that.

Tyra blushed. She had forgotten Misterians were telepathic.

"Now that was humiliating" said Tyra with a sigh.
11311111111.title: A visitor makes an entrance

113111111111.content:
"I don't think so. I think it was quite touching" said Lea, still giggling. Her fear and anxiety seemed to be lessening in Tyra's presense. This pleased Tyra but something still needed to be done about Lea's broken left arm.

"Anyway, I'll help you with your arm" said Tyra as she walked over to the table and grabbed a small cloth from it. She couldn't heal Lea's arm but she could at least help out. Lea looked confused as to what Tyra was planning.

"What are you doing?" she asked softly.

"Relax, I'm just doing to stabilize your arm until you can get it healed" said Tyra as she started wrapping the cloth around Lea's injured arm. Once it was properly covered, Tyra used the remaining parts of the cloth and wrapped them around Lea's shoulder. She pulled a know around the shoulder, creating a suitable sling for Lea's arm.

"There, this should work for now. The sling will stabilize you until we get you healed" said Tyra. Lea looked amazed.

"Is this how humans treat injuries?" asked Lea. Tyra nodded, assuming that angels probably didn't use slings often because they could could just go to a doctor and get them healed. Then, with the sling done, Tyra took a while to notice how tense Lea still seemed to be. 'Maybe I can get her to open up if I help her relax' thought Tyra.

"How so?" asked Lea, making Tyra remember once again that they were telepathic. Tyra smiled as she needed to keep that in mind.

"Just watch" said Tyra as she positioned herself at Lea's back. She got her hands ready and placed them on Lea's shoulders. It was a good thing she still remembered this from her days as James. Slowly but surely, she started trying to message :ea's shoulders. Of course, as messages usually go, it intially hurt for Lea.

"Ow! What are you doing?" she asked, a little cared.

"Relax. I'm not trying to hurt you. It'll hurt a little bit but just wiat a second" assured Tyra. Lea trusted Tyra so she let her continue. After a few more seconds or so, Lea instantly started feeling more relaxed as Tyra worked on her shoulder muscles.

"Oh, that feels...nice" said Lea as she gave a happy sigh.

"I'm glad" said Tyra.

"What is this technique?" asked Lea.

"It's called a message. Humans use this to try and relax. I figured that you could use one because you've looked tense since you landed here" said Tyra as she continued to rub Lea's shoulders, making the girl sigh contently again. After a few minutes, Tyrs then turned to Lea's bruised wings.

"You know, I think can message your wings too. Just give me a sec" said Tyra as she moved to one of Lea's wings. She placed her hands on it and tryed to rub it in a similar way. Surprisingly, Lea started to giggle.

"S-Stop that, it tickles!" she giggled, making Tyra happy that Lea was happy. She continued working on both of her wings.

"By the way, your wings look really damamged. Did you damamge them in the fall?" asked Tyra. Lea looked a little sad as she hung her head a bit.

"No, I injured them long ago. A few months ago, I was trying to fly but couldn't do it very well. I ended up falling through the barrier to the surface" started Lea. Tyra was shocked to hear that, especially because she nearly avoided falling as well.

"Really? Did you injure them then?" asked Tyra.

"No, I was able to make a soft landing on the ground. However, I ended up coming across 2 human men. At first, I didn't pay much attention because I figured that they couldn't see me. You might not know but only those that are pure of heart can see anglels and demons" explained Lea. Tyra nodded in understanding.

"However, I found that that these men could indeed see me. They were drunk and apparently possessed. I tired to get away but they wouldn't let me. They saw me as..." Lea gulped as she struggled to find her next words, "quick entertainment". Tyra was appaled to hear that, although she knew that it wasn't the human's fault, just like the humans who shot her.

"They tried to rape. To do that, they broke me wings first so I couldn't escape. Long story short, my mother, whi is a Valkyrie, was able to save me from them. Howwever, my wings have yet to heal. They tried over and over to completely heal them. However, it has yet to work. I can fly a little but I can't control my flight pattern because of my injuries. It's likely that I won't be able to fly normally until I get my energy wings when I come of age" explained Lea.

"So humans have hurt you too?' said Tyra with a sad look.

"You don't hate the humans do you? You used to be one of them" said Lea.

"No I don't. It's just that you have and I have both been terrible injured by them" said Tyra.

"It was the work of demons. They are not at fault. Everyone seems to think of them as creatures to pity because they are not as 'evolved' as us. Hoewever, I think they are fascinating people. In fact, if possible some time, I wouldn't mind living amongst them for a while" said Lea, which surprised Tyra.

"Really? Why would an angel want to live down there?" asked Tyra.

"As much as those men scared me, I saw other things while I wasdown there. There were some scary things but I always saw people that looked so happy. There was one of those playgrounds as you call them where all those children were playing. I wouldn't mind experiencing the life of a human some time" said Lea.

"Hmm, well maybe someday, I can give you a grand tour of where I used to live" said Tyra with a smile.

"Really? You'd do that? You don't have to.." said Lea. However, Tyra stopped her.

"Of course I can and I will. We're friends right?" asked Tyra with a smile, getting one from Lea too.

"Right. Friends" said Lea. With that, the two fell into momentary silence as Tyra kept working on Lea's wings, making the girl feel more relaxed and happy than she had ever been in recent memory.
113111111111.title: Healing Lea

1131111111111.content:
As Tyra finished up her first real message session, the door opened, revealing Myrrh. She seemed surprised at first to see Lea there.

"Ah Lea. What are you doing here?" she asked her. Lea didn't really want to answer so she allowed Myrrh to get the whole story from her mind. Tyra watched as Myrrh closed her eyes and watched the incident from her memories.

"Oh, so that was the sound I heard earlier. I thought somebody had just dropped something" said Myrrh as she put some plates down of the table. She then turned to the young girls.

"So Lea, so you want to join us for lunch?" asked Myrrh politely.

"M-Me? Oh no, I don't want to intrude, your highness" said Lea, trying to be respectful. Myrrh smiled and shook her head in response.

"Lea, I've told you that you don't need to call me that. 'Myrrh' is just fine. Now come on over here and perhaps I can get your arm healed too" said Myrrh. The two girls got up and walked over to Myrrh and took a look at the food. Tyra wasn't sure what to think, given that she had never seen Misterian food before.

"First things first, let's get you better" said Myrrh as she placed her hands on Lea's injured left arm. Her hands glowed a light green as it enveloped Lea's arm. Tyra watched in awe as Myrrh repaired Lea's arm. A minute later, the glow vanished.

"There, the bones should be healed now. You'll be a little stiff for a while though, so be careful" said Myrrh. Lea smiled and nodded her head.

"Thank you so much Myrrh" said Lea as she unwrapped her arm and tried to move it around. The bones were perfectly healed, although it was stiff as Myrrh said.

"Guess it's a good thing I made a little too much this time. We've got enough for me so eat on" said Myrrh as she took a seat at the table. Tyra and Lea took seats next to each other on the other side of the table. Lea helped herself to what Myrrh brought out but Tyra didn't know what do do. Myrrh looked at her and began to giggle. This kind of annoyed Tyra, her wings turning a little red in the process.

"And what is so funny?" said the annoyed angel. Myrrh tried to talk but she kept on giggling like a little schoolgirl.

"Your face is what. I know you know what kind of things we eat but your expression was priceless" said Myrrh, continuing to laugh. Lea even giggled slightly through her meal. Anyway, Myrrh finally calmed down and started to explain.

"Anyway, these are fluff noodles. They're kind of like that Mac & Cheese meal you have in your world. They're grown here in places with much cloud cover because that's what they feed on to grow. The result is a rather watery taste but the sauce mixed in with it is a kind of dairy product we also grow here. Have a taste" said Myrrh. Luckily, the utensils they used were the same as the humans so Tyra picked up a fork and took a bite of the 'Angel Mac &Cheese' so to speak. Her eyes it up as she did.

"Wow! This is good!" said Tyra as she continued to eat more, to the delight of Myrrh and Myrrh. Myrrh went on to explain that the drink was a nector harvested from Nimbus trees which grew in the nearby forest. They were, in a way, similar to cocao tres from the surface, except nimbus fruits grew instead of cocao beans. Those were then used to make the 'milk' they drink here.
1131111111111.title: Myrrh finally comes back

choices: 3 Weeks later (staying in the human world)
11311111111112.content:
Meanwhile, as Tyra happily began to enjoy the pros of being a Misterian, things were a different story back on the land.

It had been over a day since James Walker had seemingly disappeared off the face of the Earth. Those closest didn't have a clue as to wha happened. A missing person's report has been file and the police had been notified. However, so far their efforts had been fruitless but they assured friends and family that it would continue on.

Nate and Erin Wilson had often been questioned as they were the last to know of James. They explained how they had just finished up their day and were just heading home. They didn't find out until the morning that James was gone. There was an invesitgation at the scene where it was believed James had been involved in. The 3 men that were found unconscious were questioned but they had no recollection of what happened. They were posessed by demons so naturally the memories didn't stay with them.

However, one fact at the so-called "crime scene" caught everyone's attention. Some blood was found at the scene. It was currently being tested on, but it was currently believed to be James' blood. Nevertheless, he was still considered "missing".

At this time, James' friends and family were extremely concerned. Nate and Erin wanted to do anything they could to help them find James. Erin had been unable to sleep since the incident and she almost always felt the need to cry whenever James came up. Nate would always comfort his sister, knowing that she had a crush on the boy. He inwardly swore to smack James for making everyone worry once they found him.

James' family tried to continue on as normally as possible. Michael and Jane, James' parents, kept up hope that their son was still alive and tired to keep their daily life going. However, the same could not be said for James' 19-year old sister, Ellen. She and James had a typical sibling rivalry as kids but they had a peacfeul and loving family relationship over the last few years. The news that her brother was missing and possibly dead pratically killed the young woman on the inside. She barely slept or ate and her parents were becoming increasingly concerned with her.

Nate and Erin had offered whatever help they could. However, they all knew the truth of the matter at hand. Only one thing could cure Ellen's sadness: James returning home safe and sound.

Similar things could be said for James' youngest siblings: 8-year old Trevor and 6-year old Nicole. Trevor began trying to act like and say some of the things James would do, in hopes of joy returning to the family. It sometimes worked but everyone knew that it was his way of trying to deal with the loss. Trevor was always one who thought of others. Nicole was also extremely saddened by the loss of her brother and became a bit withdrawn as well. She started avoiding playing with her usual dolls, as James had often offered to play with her when she was sad or alone.

It was anyone's guess as to how this would turn out.
11311111111112.title: Dealing with Loss

113111111111121.content:
"Ugh, what a day!" yelled Tyra as almost collapsed. She had spent the rest of the day with Myrrh as Lea left soon after lunch. Tyra happened to notice that, once Lea left, she had a depressed look on her face.

"I imagine that your first day here was satisfactory?" asked Myrrh with a hint of a smirk on her face. Tyra gave her 'mother' a small jab in the sides for that but both girls giggled.

"It's so wierd to be giggling like this" said Tyra.

"I imagine you'll get used to it" said Myrrh simply. Tyra nodded at her answer.

After they had eaten lunch and Lea had left, Myrrh spent most of the day explaining other things to Tyra. For example, she showed her how time was kept in their world. They used the sun and moon to determine time in their world. A parmo was a minute. A mot was an hour. Midday and midnight were called qua-circles. A full day or night was a hav-circle. So, an example was that 7: 15 would been seven mot fifteen in this world. It confused Tyra a bit but she was glad that some things were similar to the human world.
