After that, they had dinner together. It was just the two of them this time. The meal was a kind of cooked steak that Myrrh said came from a brave bird. Apparantly, it was a kind of bird that survived at this altitude and had 4 wings. Tyra ended up hoping that she would never come across such a thing, to Myrrh's amusement.

"I'm amazed that many things from the human world have an influence here" said Tyra.

"Well yes. We have no quarrel with humans and we have no problem learning a thing or two from them if we feel like it" said Myrrh.

"Seems like the Misterians and humans can work pretty well together" said Tyra with a smile. Myrrh gave a small smile but then turned away slightly.

"Too bad not everyone thinks that way" she said softly. It confused Tyra as to whom she was talking about.

"What do you mean?" asked Tyra with a raised eyebrow. Myrrh looked at Tyra and then shook her head slightly.

"Forget it. You'll know in time. Anyway, it's now 8 mot in the evening now. Time for you, young lady, to go to bed" said Myrrh. Tyra almost gasped at her words.

"So I really have to listen to you now?" sighed Tyra, somewhat not enjoying having to be mothered around like a kid again. Myrrh put her hands on her hips and continued on.

"Well, I am your mother now. You'll need some sleep since you're starting school tomorrow" said Myrrh. Tyra looked surprised again.

"S-School?" asked Tyra.

"Yes, school. It'll be better for you to learn amongst other kids your age. It'll be good to make some friends. If not for Pallas and others keeping me on track, I probably wouldn't have done well" said Myrrh, a little sheepishly. This caused a smirk to adorn Tyra's face.

"Oh, so you were a slacker huh?" asked Tyra, a little cheekily. Myrrh smirked herself and then started tickling Tyra mercilessly. Tyra laughed and laughed while while begging for Myrrh to stop. She did eventually.

"I'd watch your mouth if I were you. Now, come on so I can show you how to properly go to sleep here" said Myrrh as she grabbed Tyra's right hand and they started walking towards Tyra's room. That reminded Tyra of how Myrrh explained how they slept up here, using those love seats as beds. Tyra was still skeptical on how such a thing would be comfortable but she would just have to find out herself.

Eventually, they both entered Tyra's room together.

"All right, I'm sure you know how to brush your teeth and such right?" asked Myrrh. Tyra nodded and went into the bathroom to do just that. Luckily, that was the easy part as she emerged a few minutes later.

"Ok now, as I might have told you earlier, we only wear skirts to bed. That means everything else comes off" said Myrrh. Tyra was a little apprehensive but she did as told.She removed her toga top and removed the training bra from her body, exposing her bare chest to the world, which felt a little cool. She then removed her sandals and skort and Myrrh took out a blue skirt for her which she immediately put on.

"Now, just sit down in the bed in a kneeling position" instructed Myrrh. Tyra obeyed and sat down on the love seat, her legs being hugged against her chest.

"Now, close your wings around yourself" said Myrrh. Tyra didn't have much experience today in regards to using her wings. It felt so odd with the two extra 'limbs' so to speak on her back. Tyra slowly moved her full wings against herself and wrapped them around her. Surprisingly, she felt a little warm now.

"One last touch" said Myrrh. She grabbed a white wrap from a container in the room and walked over to Tyras. She gently wrapped it around Tyra's wings and body, careful not to damamge anything. It was made so Tyra could simply remove the wrap by extending her wings when she woke up. Once she was done, Tyra felt surprisingly warm....and tired to her amazement.

"Wow, it's so warm. And (yawn) I'm suddenly feeling tired" said Tyra.

"What did I say? I told you that it was comfortable. We dont end up with any back problems like humans would do in this situation" explained Myrrh. Tyra heard her but merely nodded as she was beginning to doze off.

"Ok.....(yawns)....good night....mother" said Tyra with a smile as she gently feel asleep. Myrrh felt a bit of pride within her as she smiled at Tyra's words. She leaned forward and gently placed a motherly kiss on Tyra's forehead, sending her a telepathic message as she left the room with the lights dimming as she did.

Good night and sweet dreams....my little angel'
113111111111121.title: That Night (back in Skyaira)

choices: Start of the New School Year
1131111111111211.content:
Tyra had perhaps one of the most peaceful sleeps she had ever had in her lifetime. In her dreams, she still found herself longing for the human life she lost, even though she knew it was beyond her now. However, her gentle sleep was suddenly interrupted.

"Tyra. Sweety, it's time to wake up" said Myrrh in a gentle voice. She lightly shook Tyra's shoulder, waking the little girl up. As Tyra gave a big yawn, her wings instinctively spread out, causing the wrap to simply fall of her body, and stretch out. However, she almost immediately started shivering as a cool wind spread across her body.

"Brrr. W-What time is it? The sun doesn't even look up yet" said Tyra, her arms trying to cover her topless body. Myrrh smiled at her.

"It's 6 mot 15" said Myrrh. Tyra gasped as that meant Myrrh had just woken up in the early morning.

"Why would you wake me up this early? It's freezing!" said Tyra as she tried to get herself warmed up. Myrrh kept smiling and helped Tyra to stand up.

"Because today is your first day of school. Don't want you to be late on your first day" said Myrrh. Tyra looked confused.

"You have school this early?" she asked.

"School runs from 7 mot after the night qua-circle and runs until 1 mot after the day qua-circle. Basically, in human terms, that means from 7 in the morning to 1 in the afternoon. You get a lunch break that lasts for 30 parmo (minutes) at the day qua-circle" explained Myrrh. Tyra nodded in understanding, although that didn't help how cold she was.

"A-And how are you not freezing right now?" she asked, getting another smile from Myrrh.

"Come with me and I'll explain along the way" said Myrrh as she grabbed Tyra's little hand. She started escorting her to the the bathroom in Tyra's room. "All misterians devolop a small resistance to cold weather. In addition, our wings kind of act like solar panels, absorbing heat to keep us warm. However, you have yet to build that resistance. It might take a few days or possibly over a week but soon you'll be able to wake up in the morning without feeling cold at all" said Myrrh.

"Sounds nice. So, what now?" asked Tyra as they were now standing in Tyra's bathroom. Myrrh put down what appeared to be a new set of clothes for Tyra next to a sink and then pointed to an open area that had a shower faucet centered above it.

"Time to show you how to take a show here. I'm sure you know that you have to strip down" said Myrrh. Tyra blushed and was a bit hesitent as she started to pull her skirt and underwear down.

"Relax, it;s just us girls here" said Myrrh with a giggle. Tyra blushed and pulled her clothing off completely. Myrrh took them and set them somewhere else.

"Now, stand underneath the shower while I get it going and set the temperature" said Myrrh. Tyra did as instructed and walked into the large flat area, presumbably to make sure everything didn't get wet. When she was wettled, Myrrh turned some levers and, like a normal shower, the water started pouring on Tyra. A little cold at first but it warmed up quickly. As it poured down, Tyra felt her wings becoming heavier.

"Spread your wings out and shake them lightly. That'll get the water out" said Myrrh. Tyra did as instructed. She was still getting used to moving her wings but it was getting easier. She slowly spread them out and lightly shook them. The water easily came out and they felt lighter.

"I'm just glad that you guys have indoor plumbing" said Tyra with a giggle.

"Makes things easier huh?" said Myrrh with a smile.

"So, do I just wash myself normally?" asked Tyra. Myrrh shook her head slightly.

"It's mostly the same as a human shower, with one major difference: cleaning the wings" said Myrrh.

"How do you do that?" asked Tyra. Myrrh grabbed a small brush and walked over, carefull now to get too wet.

"The wings of young boys and girls are very fragile. To clean them, we use a special small brush to lightly groom through them. I'll do it for a while. Eventually, you'll be able to do it yourself" said Myrrh. Tyra nodded and turned around to allow Myrrh to reach her wings. She gently grabbed one wing and started lightly brushing each feather, careful not to harm her. However, she started to feel it shaking a bit and looked at Tyra, who was giggling.

"That tickles!" said Tyra. Myrrh giggled as well and continued grooming gently. After that, she moved to the other wing, working through Tyra's continued giggling.

"I'm surprised that my wings are so ticklish" said Tyra, her giggling going down a bit.

"Well, of course. They're just as much flesh and bone as the rest of your body. Now, the rest is just the same as a normal shower. Wash your body and hair and we'll go from there" said Myrrh.

Tyra did as instructed and grabbed the bar soap and washed off her body. She moved to her hair after that and found it annoying considering it's longer length now. 'How do Ellen and Nicole deal with this?' thought Tyra as she finished up. Myrrh went over to the levers and turned off the water.

"Now, to dry off, just do 'the twist', I believe you humans call it" said Myrrh. Tyra gave an incredulous look before giggling a bit at Myrrh's instruction. She did as told and shook the water off of her. She got as much as possible before Myrrh grabbed a towel. Tyra was careful to dry herself and avoid her wings. With that done, Tyra changed into similar clothing from the previous day. The only differnce was the colors. Her toga top was yellow, the skort was red, and her sandals were brown.

"One last thing before we go. I need to inspect your eyes" said Myrrh as she carefully looked at Tyra's blue and green eyes. Tyra was confused as Myrrh inspected her. 'What in the world is she doing?' thought Tyra. Apparently, Myrrh heard her thoughts.

"For Misterians, a slight or huge change in eye color is a sign of sickness. This is especially important for you, given the heavy shock your body took during the transformation. Your immune system may be weak for a while" said Myrrh. Tyr nodded in understanding. Myrrh kept looking and smiled as she saw no difference in Tyra's eyes.

"Well, let's go get some food before setting you off to school" said Myrrh as she took Tyra's hand and escorted her out of the bathroom.
1131111111111211.title: The Morning Comes

11311111111112111.content:
After catching a good breakfast, Myrrh and Tyra were on their way to the school, walking along the stone roads that lead to an edge of the mainland. Tyra was confused. Where was the school? She couldn't see it anywhere. Myrrh saw her confusion and giggled a bit.

"Look up" said Myrrh, and Tyra looked up, gasped at what she saw.

http://www.scenicreflections.com/files/s...

"Wow! That's school?!" asked Tyra. She almost seemed to have forgotten that she was supposed to be older than she really was. Her childhood curiosity and excitement had been reborn along with her body. She knew this but didn't really have a problem with it after all. It was all good to her.

"Yes. That's where you will learning everything" said Myrrh.

"Like what?" asked Tyra. Myrrh thought about it but then shook her head.

"I'll let you figure out what we teach. It'll be good for you to learn on your own" said Myrrh. Tyra gave her a smug look.

"You better not be getting lazy with my teachings. You know what grandmother will do" said Tyra with a giggle. Myrrh gave her a hard look that was intended to shut her up but it instead made Tyra laugh harder.

"Fine whatever. Anyway, let's get you up there. It'll be a good first flying lesson for you" said Myrrh as she grabbed Tyra's little hand and lifted her into the sky. Tyra was a little worried at first but was getting a little better despite being miles above the ground. She slightly smiled as she looked to Myrrh.

"All right, soon enough this should all become instictive. For now, I'll hold you up but you should do the flapping. Just focus your mind on it. As I said before, your wings are just as much your limbs as your arms and legs are" said Myrrh. Tyra nodded and tried to control the wings on her back. Slowly but surely, it was working! Not goood enough yet to fly on her own but passable. A sense of pride and enjoyment went through Tyra as she pretty much flew for the very first time.

"I'm doing it!" yelled Tyra in excitement.

"Good job" said Myrrh as they stayed like that for the rest of the flight there. As they reached the suspended land, Myrrh helped her gently land on the soft ground. They then turned to the school as their wings took a resting position.

"Just like the castle, the outside is just for appearances. You might be more familiar with it when we get inside" said Myrrh.

"Sounds good" said Tyra. Then, she heard noises as she turned to the buillding and saw numerous Misterian kids flying around, playing with each other before the start of classes.

Now, Tyra knew what it felt to be the 'new kid' so to speak. It wouldn't get any easier from there on. Myrrh giggled slightly as Tyra's wings turned to a bright green color, showing her nervousness.

'Well, won't this be fun' thought Tyra sarcastically.
11311111111112111.title: Start of the New School Year

113111111111121111.content:
"Well, have fun. I'll pick you up after school" said Myrrh as she smiled and flew off the floating island. Tyra gasped and reached out for Myrrh, only for her to already be out of reach. Tyra's wings glowed red in anger at her 'mother' leaving her.

"Oh great, feed me to the wolves why don't you?" said Tyra in frustration.

"What does that mean?" asked a female voice from behind Tyra, startling her a bit. She turned around and saw a young 10-year olf girl behind her. This wasn't Lea. This girl had brown hair that was tied into a ponytail, with her hangs still hanging on her face. Her eyes were a bizzare purple color but held a certain calmness in them. She wore a more modern top on her body, being tied at the back of her neck as female kids wore. The top itself was violet as well. She also wore a white skort and black boots that went halfway up her calves and was tightened with purple laces. Underneath the boots, she had violet stockings that went to her thighs. She was quite pretty for her young age.

"Huh? Oh, it means that she just left me to fend for myself with no warning at all" said Tyra. The girl giggled at Tyra's expression and explanation.

"Oh, is that how humans phrase it? Kind of like how we got 'thrown out of the nest here'" said the girl. Tyra laughed a bit at the girl's words.

"Well, we have that too" giggled Tyra, before she snapped out of it and looked at the girl. "Wait, how did you know that? And who are you anyway?" asked Tyra. The girl calmed down and gave a serene smile before giving a small bow.

"Oh, my apologies, my name is Karis. I'm a student here. As for you being human, hasn't someone told you that your two eye colors reveal that fact?" asked Karis. Tyra nodded as she remembered that fact.

"Oh right" said Tyra. Then, she turned again to Karis. "Also, you don't have to bow. If you're bowing because I'm a princess, you can drop it. I don't like special treatment. Just treat me as Tyra" said Tyra. Karis smiled and rose fully up.

"The rumors are ture, you are quite modest" said Karis, making Tyra blush a bit. "Well, shall we? Let's introduce you to some of our classmates" said Karis as she gently took Tyra's hand and brought her forward. Tyra was apprehensive, meeting a bunch of young Misterian children. It would be something that she would have to get used to though. Suddenly, a young male swooped in out of nowhere and hung upside down in front of the girls, startling them a bit.

"Hello ladies. Wonderful morning isn't it?" asked the young male. He looked 10 years old as well. His toga top was brown and he wore black shorts with them instead of a skort. On his feet, he had green sandals.

"Hello Ewol, how are you?" asked Karis.

"Pretty good" said Ewol as he touched down on the ground and straightened himself up. Tyra looked at his youthful face and started to feel a small blush growing on her face. Being 21 years old originally, Tyra shuddered as she kenw what this was. 'Are you kidding me?! I've only been a girl for a day or so and I'm already crushing on a boy?! What is with me?!" yelled Tyra in her mind. Ewol seemed to somewhat hear her loud thoughts.

"What did you say?" he asked innocently.

"N-Nothing!" said Tyra, a little flustered, her wings turning pink (which generally meant blushing). Karis giggled next to her. As annoyed as Tyra was, she noticed something about Ewol. He had two eye colors! One was red and the other was brown. It worked out with his short brown hair.

"Well whatever, welcome to Skyaira!" said Ewol, extending a hand in welcome. Tyra calmed herself down a bit and shook his hand.

"Thank you. Ewol, was it?" asked Tyra.

"Yep yep, Ewol's my name, making life fun is my game!" said Ewol, jumping into the air and hovering. He took his leave and flew around the area a bit. Karis sighed and looked at Tyra.

"That's Ewol all right. He was a human once like you and was rebirthed" said Karis.

"What happened to him?" asked Tyra. Karis thought about it.

"Hmm, maybe later during lunch or something. We got to get going into the school. I'll introduce you to everyone on the way" said Karis. Tyra nodded and followed the girl towards the school building.

"Karis, I think this could be a wonderful friendship" said Tyra. Karis smiled, knowing how difficult it must be for the former human male to adapt to this life.

"I agree Tyra" she said, before a smirk graced her face. "Although, hopefully you won't be acting around every guy like you just did with Ewol" said Karis, barely containing her laughter.

"Augh, she's never going to let that go" said Tyra, sighing as she walked along with Karis.
113111111111121111.title: Being the New Kid

11311111111112112.content:
Walking along the stone path, exiting the palace, Myrrh turned to Tyra and smiled. she saw that her daughter was slightly embarrassed about 'going back' to grade school. "Try not to feel bad about this, Tyra." she said. "You can not hide your emotions from others, they will be concerned." she touched Tyra's small shoulder. "Besides, you will be learning an entirely new way of life."

"I suppose so." replied Tyra. "I can't help feeling nervous, though." she paused, adding, "I'm still thinking like a guy."

"That will change in time." assured Myrrh. "Take is slowly, you have all the time in the world."

Tyra looked around, taking in her new environment, and spotted what looked like small bird nests on top of a number of poles, lining the walkways. Myrrh followed her gaze and again smiled. "Those are flame fairy nests." she explained. "They're tiny people, like us but don't worry, they're harmless. Just don't pester them, they have magic and they'll use it."

"Does it hurt, if they do?" asked Tyra, wincing.

Myrrh shook her head, giggling. "No, but you'll be glowing for a short while." she said, grinning.

Just then, Tyra spotted something moving at her feet. She knelled down and was surprised to see a tiny fairy, walking on a spider web. "Hi, there." she said. "I'm Tyra."

http://www.myfreewallpapers.net/fantasy/...

The fairy stopped walking and turned to Tyra and smiled. "Hey, there, new comer." she said, noticing Tyra's two differently colored eyes. "Welcome to Skyaira. I am Kimble. Are you being given the grand tour?"

"My new mom is taking me to school." replied Tyra. "I have a lot to learn."

Kimble smiled. "Admitting you have a lot to learn is the first step to learning." she said. "Enjoy your day."

"Come, Tyra." said Myrrh, giggling. "We must not be late."
11311111111112112.title: Along the way there

1133.content:
"I'm in a strange world, high above the clouds, with winged people," trying to convince herself it was a dream, Tyra said. "and, of course, they speak English."

Myrrh giggled. "We speak all of Earth's languages, Tyra." amused, she replied. "I am merely speaking English to accommodate you. Our language is much different."

"Is she awake, Myrrh?" softly, a new voice asked. "I wish to meet my new granddaughter."

"She is a bit shy, mother." smiling, Myrrh replied to a tall woman stepping into the room. "Let me dress her first."

Tyra blushed brightly seeing the woman she guessed was Minerva enter. She was a near perfect replica of Myrrh in a stunning Victorian era dress and a beautiful silver crown on her head. Seeing Tyra blush, she giggled.

"We are all girls here, Tyra." smiling, Minerva said, kindly. "You have nothing I have not already seen before."

Tyra sighed, feeling something move over her wings then felt her wings moving through it as if being pushed through a sleeve before turning to the mirror to see herself wearing a silk white blouse, which went very nicely with her skirt. Only, as she looked at the blouse more closely, she saw no openings for her wings. Confused, she turned to Myrrh, causing her and Minerva to giggle slightly.

"It's called liquid fabric." smiling, Myrrh explained. "It is much like silk only it becomes like a heavy liquid when offered resistance to allow passage for your wings then, when no resistance is offered, it becomes solid again, giving your wing roots the warmth they need."

"Wing roots?" asked Tyra.

"Where your wings meet your back." simply, Minerva replied. "With liquid fabric, we can make any style clothing we wish without any concern for our wings."

"That makes sense." smiling, Tyra said. "You must be Minerva."

"Grandma, if you please." patiently, Minerva corrected. "I understand that all of this is a shock but please show respect."

Tyra blushed. "Sorry... grandma."

Minerva smiled. "It will take you some time to adjust to your new world." kindly, she said. "Don't rush anything, you have all the time in the world."

"Um... If you are queen, does that make me a princess?" curious, Tyra asked.

Myrrh nodded. "Yes, it makes us both a princess, Tyra." looking at me, Myrrh replied. "However, that does not give us the right to boss anyone around." wincing, she added, "I learned that the hard way when I was ten."

"Enough chatter." with a wave of her hand, Minerva said. "I think Tyra would like to see her new home."

"I- I don't know if I can fly." blushing, Tyra said. "I never had wings before."

"That will come with time, my dear." kindly, Minerva said. "For now, we'll carry you."

Then, a thought came to Tyra and she turned to Myrrh. "What of my family back home?" worried, she asked. "They will be worried about me..."

"They know you are alive and safe." patiently, Minerva replied. "When it became obvious that we had to change you to save your life, I set events into motion that placed your family at ease."

"How?" confused, Tyra asked.

"It's a bit complicated to explain." sighing, Minerva said. "Simply put, I magically placed a suggestion into the minds of your family that you had moved out long ago and is doing well in parts unknown."

"It's better than allowing them to think you are dead or worse, not knowing." with a sad smile, Myrrh added. "You are alive, doing well, and in parts unknown to them so none of it is a lie."

"I guess that makes sense." sighing, Tyra said.

"Ready to see your new world, my granddaughter?" offering her hand, Minerva asked.

Tyra shyly nodded and accepted Minerva's hand.
1133.title: First Visitor

11331.content:
"Wait. I don't have any footwear" said Tyra, realizing that her feet were still bare.

"Oh, I almost forgot. Here, you can try these" suggested Myrrh, holding a pair of odd material. It was blue in color and somewhat looked similar to this liquid stuff that Minerva suggested.

"This is another kind of liquid fabric that conforms to the user's feet for good support. You could mold them however you like, but we can get to that later" said Myrrh.

"Oh, well ok" said Tyra, taking a while to accept it. She accepted the footwear and gently slipped them on. As Myrrh said, they formed nicely around her feet, almost feeling like the swim shoes she used to wear at water parks.

"Feel good?" asked Myrrh.

"Yeah" said Tyra.

"Well, with that out of the way, let's proceed" said Minerva.
11331.title: Brief Stop

113311.content:
Both Minerva and Myrrh took one of Tyra's arms and took flight towards the high ceiling. Tyra winced, seeing it come fast but blushed as the glass ceiling opened allowing them to fly out into the crisp morning air. "When you're done fretting, take a look ahead." said Myrrh, giggling.

Tyra looked and took in a slow breath in awe. What she saw no picture could ever give justice. It was a majestic view of several mountain tops surrounding mist covered valleys with low buildings of every style and grace resting on the many plateaus that seemed to have been carved into the mountainsides. What made everything all the more magnificent was the fact the mist made the mountain tops appear to be floating in mid air.

"Wow..." she whispered.

Minerva smiled proudly. "The valleys below have trees that are as wide as your houses and as tall as your buildings." she explained, taking Tyra down to the tree tops. "It is in these tree tops we have built our homes."

"Are you ready to take a closer look?" smiling, Myrrh asked.

Tyra, filled with a sense of wonderment, nodded and they flew in among the trees, stopping to hover near one of the tree top dwellings with bridges spanning the distance to the others. Curious, Tyra turned to Myrrh, who giggled. "Flying takes a certain amount of effort, we like to walk when we can." she said. "Only your home is with me, in the palace."

http://www.writing.com/main/redirect.php...

*Credit to concrete playground.com for the above image.*

"Where is the palace?" curious, Tyra asked.

"Just over those two mountain tops in the distance." replied Minerva, pointing. "It will be your new home from now on."

With that said, Minerva and Myrrh took Tyra high above the mist filled giant trees towards the two mountain tops where she saw another spectacular sight....

http://pseudowitch.deviantart.com/#/d58t...

The castle rested upon a gigantic tree stump in the center of the misty forest, seemingly dwarfing the other trees, causing yet another awe filled gasp to escape Tyra's lips.

"Welcome Tyra." said Minerva, smiling. "Welcome to Skyaira Castle."

"Magnificent!" breathed Tyra.

Minerva giggled. "Just wait until you see the inside." she said. "But first..."
113311.title: Taking a Look

1133111.content:
"We want you to see some of our finest guardians in action."

"Guardians?" confused, Tyra asked.

"Remember the two who had saved your life after you were shot, saving me?" blushing, Myrrh asked. "They are a part of a team known as guardians. The boys are known as Archangels and the girls are Valkyrie."

"Hang on, little one." giggling, Minerva said. "You have the best view of the game."

Now Tyra was really confused as was taken into Myrrh's arms. "What game?"

Just then, a winged man flew downwards between Myrrh and Minerva, causing Tyra to scream in surprise as a winged woman flew right behind him, firing a lighting bolt from her hand. "Let's play!" laughing, Myrrh said.

She then dived, taking Tyra with her, as Minerva flew after another man. "It's called lightning tag." firing a bolt of energy from her hand, Myrrh explained. "The energy does not really hurt but the thunder that follows is deafening. If you get hit, you are out of the game for that round." she giggled. "It's boys verses girls in this match up but its only training."

Suddenly, the winged man Myrrh was chasing turned. He quickly spread his wings, energy sparkling between the gleaming feathers. He then brought his wings crashing together, literally throwing the electricity off his wings, towards Myrrh in a stunning display of balance and timing. Myrrh, however was ready for the attack and spun out of the way.

"Boys can't fire lightning from their hands?" curious, Tyra asked, seeing Myrrh fire back.

"The girls and boys produce lightning in different ways." quickly, Myrrh explained. "Only now is not the time."

Tyra screamed again as a bolt of lightning nearly missed her, flashing across Myrrh's chest and she quickly turned to face a young man who was preparing for another strike. "He's open." said Tyra, "Can't you fire?"

"That's against the rules as he can not fly while firing." dodging the second blast, Myrrh said. "We can fire and fly at the same time but their blasts are more powerful, they are forbidden to use full strength."

At that moment, a buzzer was sounded and Myrrh flew to the other players who had stopped.

"Good game, everyone." joining the group, Minerva said. "Thank you for allowing our participation."

"Our pleasure, your highness." bowing, a woman replied. she paused seeing Tyra and smiled. "Is this the kind young man who came to princess Myrrh's rescue?"

"This is." smiling, Myrrh replied. "Please welcome our newest family member, Princess Tyra.
1133111.title: Lightning Tag!

11331111.content:
"Welcome to Skyaira, princess Tyra." bowing slightly, one woman said. "I am Etoile."

Tyra turned to the one who introduced herself as Etoile. She appeared to have been no older that nineteen or twenty years old in human years. Tyra gazed upon her doll like face and smiled as she truly looked like an angel. Only Tyra blushed seeing strange armor Etoile was wearing. It looked like a blue skirted one piece swimsuit; the skirt seemed to have been made of metallic like feathers. The midsection and bust looked much like a leather corset, fitting her very snugly. The top seemed to have been made of black latex, with the way it shined and had armored plates over the shoulders that were made of the same metallic like feathers as the skirt. The helmet looked like something out of the mid-Evil times, making Etoile looking very beautiful but also very dangerous.

"It- It's a pleasure to beet you, Etoile." nervous, Tyra said. "This place is simply awe inspiring."

Etoile giggled, removing her helmet, revealing her beautiful raven black hair. "What you have seen so far is but a taste of what Skyaira has to offer, little one." she said. "Would you care to see the palace? I am heading there shortly."

"An excellent suggestion." smiling, Minerva said. "Let us go together."

After dismissing the other players, Myrrh carried Tyra towards the palace with Minerva taking the lead and Etoile following close behind. As they came closer, Tyra noticed an arched pathway, leading from the dense forests to the palace and became curious. "Why can't we walk to the palace down there?" she asked.

"That path is for emergencies and evacuations only." sternly, Myrrh replied. "Just step on the path, from either side, and you are on the other side in an instant."

"There are several paths like that, leading to and from the palace." added Etoile, flying closer to Myrrh. "If some one is injured, they can come to the palace immediately rather than flying."

"I see." softly, Tyra said.

"We are about to land." smiling, Myrrh said. "Prepare yourself, the palace is a sight to see."

Upon being placed onto her feet, Tyra looked up to see two massive doors, which were opened to reveal a magnificent hall beyond that took her breath away. The hall was long with mirror like marble floors and high, beautifully decorated pillars that curved, following the arched, vaulted ceiling. Between each pillar was a tall, live tree, curving with each pillar, giving the entire hall a majestic outdoor look and feel. "Oh wow!" Tyra whispered. "It- It's beautiful!"

"Every room and chamber as a natural look and feel to it." explained Minerva. "Bare walls are too cold to stare at and art, although beautiful, is not real. Therefore, when this palace was built, they made certain every wall, every door, and every room would be alive with the outdoors."

With that, Myrrh game Tyra a gentle push forward. "Go one, little one." smiling, she said. "Explore your new home."

Tyra, although nervous, smiled and began to walk down the hall with Myrrh following with a motherly smile on her face. "She may have the mind of an adult human." she thought. "But even human adults are children at heart."
11331111.title: The Guardian, Etoile

113311111.content:
Tyra was amazed by the seemingly simplistic style of the palace, though she did spot several modern looking lights beyond the vines on the high ceiling. As she walked deeper into the hall, a smile touched the corners of her mouth as she watched a girl rise to the next floor above, riding a platform with no visible means of lifting it. "What a very curious place." whispering, she said. "It seems very simple yet, at the same time, it seems more advanced than anything I had seen."

Curious, Tyra was about to walk to one of the platforms when a strange sound echoed from another hall. At first, Tyra suspected it was a coo from a baby and began to walk closer towards the hall. Myrrh, hearing the sound as well, smiled as she watched Tyra's curiosity get the best of her. Only she said nothing as Tyra approached the entrance to the hall to investigate the odd sound of a cooing child.

http://24.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_m8jl0p...

"Hello?" looking around, Tyra asked. "Is anyone there?" pausing, she gently added, "Come on, I won't hurt you."

It was then Tyra saw a patch of the vines moving and smiled with genuine wonder as a small creature hesitantly showed itself, cooing like an infant. The creature looked like it was made of intertwined wines with tiny flowers of various colors mixed in. Its head looking like a small vine colored melon with long and soft moss like hair. She, as Tyra guessed, had a slender body and sleek black eyes that peered at her in the center of it circular eyebrows that like two little bird nests in the front of its head with two tiny slits for a nose and a small mouth with tiny but sharp looking teeth. This did not concern Tyra as the mouth was too small to bite her anywhere as the creature was the size of a doll.

"Hi there." softly, Tyra said to the timid looking creature. "You are a cutie."

Tyra slowly reached out her hand with Myrrh watching from a distance, smiling. The creature slowly reached out her hand in turn then touched Tyra's finger. It felt as soft as moss on a tree. Tyra smiled, having made contact with, in her mind, was an alien being. "Nicole would be so jealous of me right now." looking at the creature, she thought.

Not wanting to scare the little thing, Tyra moved as slowly as she could and began to stroke the creature's 'hair'. At first, the creature did not seem to know how to react as it pulled away slightly. Only Tyra continued to gently stroke it's hair and she began to purr. It sounded like a distant woodpecker, knocking on a tree, making Tyra giggle.

"It looks like you made a friend." slowly approaching, Myrrh said. "It's called a vine sprite, they eat nuts and berries in the forest outside, they look like vines to hide from predators."

Tyra watched as the vine sprite crawled into the nook of her arm, stroking its head against her chest, as if wanting to be petted more. Tyra began to pet it again then, before she knew what she was doing, asked, "Can I keep her?"

Myrrh giggled. "Your first day as a Misterian and you already want a pet." smiling, she said. "I don't see why not, so long as you can care for her."

"Oh, it is a she." smiling back, Tyra said. "I guessed she was."

"All vine sprites are girls." explaining, Myrrh said. "Vine nymphs are males." shaking her head, she added, "What are you going to call her?"

After a thought, Tyra replied, "Flora, because of her cute flowery body."

Myrrh nodded, amused. "Well, bring Flora along, there is much more to see."

Tyra and Myrrh continued to walk down the main hall...
113311111.title: Exploring the palace.

choices: I wish to do it myself.
1133111111.content:
As Tyra continued to walk with Myrrh, she looked down the many halls and corridors with Flora perched on her small shoulder, still purring. Then the sound of a small girl giggling was heard down another hall and Tyra turned to see a young girl with long blond hair and blue eyes. She was wearing what looked like an Anime style school uniform as she flew over her and Myrrh, laughing. "You can't catch me, Ewol!" she teased.

Then Tyra saw who must have been Ewol, flying not too far behind, laughing as well. She was surprised to see him wearing a form of blue jeans, a white shirt, and tennis shoes. "You boast to quickly, Lea!" he teased back. "I'll catch you this time for sure!"

"Not on your best day." laughing, Lea said. she dodged a swipe of Ewol's hand and flew back, seeing Tyra and Myrrh before calling, "Time out!"

Ewol moaned as he came down to land with Lea. "I almost had you." complaining, he said.

"Tyra, this is Lea and Ewol." motioning to the two children, said Myrrh. "They are the fastest, most maneuverable flyers in their age group and are constantly trying to determine who is the best between them."

"They seem pretty even to me." looking that the two, you said. "Why the competition?"

"Something to do." shrugging, Lea replied.

"Something to brag about." shrugging, Ewol said.

"Lea, Ewol, this is Tyra." introducing her, she said. "I have rebirthed her after saving my life, she is now my daughter."

Lea and Ewol looked at Tyra for a moment, then smiled. "Welcome to Skyaira." shaking my hand, Lea said. "Have you been given the grand tour yet?"

"This is my first day here." blushing, Tyra said. "Myrrh was showing me around." smiling, she added, "I already made a friend, I call her Flora."

Ewol chuckled. "Vine sprites choose their friends carefully." smiling, he said. "She must see a lot of good in you."

"We can show you around the village, if you want." offering, Lea said.

"That sounds good." smiling, you replied.

"Tomorrow, if Tyra is not too tired." firmly but kindly, Myrrh said. "She has not yet learned how to fly."

"We can teach her." smiling, Ewol said. "It's easy."

Myrrh sighed. "I appreciate your offer, Ewol." patiently, she said. "Only..."
1133111111.title: Enter Lea and Ewol.

11331111111.content:
"It's a mother, daughter thing and I do not wish to miss the experience." smiling, Myrrh said. "When you have children of your own, you will both understand."

Ewol nodded but froze as Tyra said, "I'm sorry but.. I will only have one mother. Reborn or not, I will never call you 'mom'."

Lea and Ewol looked at each other stunned then turned back as Myrrh sighed, smiling. "I sort of expected that." touching Tyra's cheek, she said. "I do not take any offense but I do expect you to call me 'ma'am'." becoming serious, she added, "I am your guardian and I will not tolerate you calling me by my first name, do you understand?"

"Yes, ma'am." quickly, Tyra replied.

Myrrh smiled again. "With that aside, I think we should continue on to your quarters so you can get settled." motioning to a flight of stairs, she said. "After that, I will allow you to go exploring on your own with Lea and Ewol until star rise."

"Star rise?" confused, Tyra asked.

Lea giggled. "Humans call it moonrise." smiling, she said. "I learned all about them on the world viewer, its kind of like the internet except it works on what you might call magic."

"You have magic here?" surprised, Tyra asked.

"Everything one does not understand can be called magic." smiling, Myrrh said. she pointed up to a large round hole in the ceiling. "Would you like to try to fly to the next floor?"

Tyra looked up then shrugged, figuring she had to learn sometime and focused on her wings. At first, they did not seem to want to respond but she eventually found the right muscles to move and her wings opened up. As she tried to get them to lift her off the ground, Lea covered her mouth to stifle a laugh while Ewol shook his head, smiling. "What am I doing wrong, ma'am?" asked Tyra, flapping her wings harder. "I'm not going anywhere."

"Easy, calm down." approaching her carefully, Myrrh said. "It takes more than just flapping your wings to get off the ground, you need to generate lift." she then stood, facing Tyra. "Do as I do."

Myrrh slowly opened her wings, with Tyra mirroring her movements, then bent her legs slightly before bringing her wings down as she lightly leaped off the ground. Tyra copied her every move and was surprised and elated to be lifting off the ground. "I'm doing it!" excited, she yelled, "I'm flying!"

She was so excited, she forgot to keep flapping her wings and fell back down to her feet. "You need to keep flapping your wings, once you are in the air, Tyra." giggling, Myrrh said.

"I know that." blushing slightly, Tyra replied.

Lea could not hold back her laughter. "I made that mistake too." smiling, she said.

"So did I." smiling, Ewol admitted. "It's natural."

That made Tyra feel better and she tried again, this time continuing to flap her wings, climbing higher and higher until she reached the hole in the ceiling with Myrrh, Lea, and Ewol following. When they were on the second floor, Myrrh pulled Tyra to a landing. "That's enough for now." she said. "You need to get used to using those new muscles, don't want you to push yourself."

"Yes, ma'am." nodding, Tyra said.

"Your quarters are at the end of that hall." pointing to a vine covered hallway, Myrrh said. "You will find your name engraved in the door."

"My quarters are that way as well." smiling, Lea said. "My mother is a Valkyrie." she smiled, seeing Tyra blush then added, "Would you like to see my quarters or do you want to see your own first?"

What does Tyra decide?

She touched a small panel that had a hand etched into it before a green light was seen before a buzz was heard and the door clicked opened. Tyra shrugged in turn and followed Lea into her bedroom. What she saw surprised her.

It's beautiful." smiling, Tyra said. "You did a great job rebuilding the plane." pausing, she asked, "Does it fly?"

Lea giggled. "No, I don't need it to, I can fly on my own." she replied. "I keep the world viewer in what I believe they call the cockpit. Want to see it?"

1133111111121.content:

"Focus on the keys, Tyra." smiling, Lea instructed.

114.content:
"Be at peace... Eton." said Myrrh. "It was the only way we could save your life."

"How can I 'be at peace'!?" asked James, annoyed. "You turned me into a kid with wings!"

Unknown to James, now Eton, his wings had changed to a mixed shade of pink and black before turning an all off white color as he suddenly stopped and asked, "What did you call me?"

Myrrh smiled. "Eton, that is your name now." she said. "New life, new name." she blushed slightly, her wings showing a pink highlight. "That is the tradition when a human is rebirthed into a Misterian. You are my son now."

"What of my family, my friends?" demanded Eton. "They will be worried about me, once they discover I am missing."

Myrrh sighed. "You know that matter can not be created or destroyed, it only changes form." she said. Eton nodded. "When you became a little Misterian child, due to the rebirth process, what was left of your body was left behind."

Eton gasped. "You mean..."

Myrrh sadly nodded. "Your 'remains' will be found in a bloody mess on the alley floor." she said. "James will be pronounced dead by a horrific death, those who knew you will morn their loss and move on." she saw Eton's wings turn a shade of blue and black, showing your emotions, and quickly added, "That would have been your fate if we had not acted as the bullet had severed your main artery, just above your heart."

Eton sighed, wanting to scream. "Where do I go from here?" he asked.

"I do not expect you to accept or even adjust to your new life over night, Eton." said Myrrh. "It will take time but I promise you, I will do all I can to raise you right."

Eton turned away from Myrrh to look in the mirror again and frowned. "So, I'm now a little girl named Eton?" he asked, not really liking the thought. "I guess that explains why my chest is itching so bad." he looked closer. "Why is one of my eyes green and the other brown?"

Myrrh laughed. "No, you are a boy named Eton." she said, smiling. "Here, the boys and girls look the same on the surface as the men and women share all aspects of life."

Eton's eyes widened. "All aspects?" he asked.

Myrrh nodded, giggling. "Normally, I would not explain this to a ten year old but you are mature enough to understand." she said, lightly teasing. "Briefly, men carry their 'equipment' inside their 'vagina', which only comes out when having sex. The girls carry the child but the men endure the pain through a telepathic link. Once the child is born, the man and woman share the duty of breast feeding." she paused, smiling. "In case you are wondering, yes, boys here have monthly periods but they are to expel dead sperm so to the guarantee pregnancy of their mate during mating season."

Eton shook his head, it was a lot to process. "This is deep." he thought. "It can't be real, I'm dreaming."

"It's no dream, Eton." replied Myrrh, surprising him. "We are a telepathic race, I heard your thought but don't worry, you will learn to control your thoughts and block out the overly curious in time. As for the color of your eyes, it is a mark that you were once a human who was rebirthed after a heroic deed. You will be openly accepted."

Eton sighed then asked, "What of your wings changing color from time to time?"

Myrrh smiled, pleased that her new son's anger was slowly turning to curiosity. "It shows our emotions." she replied. "When we are happy, our wings are white. When angry, they turn black. Pink is embarrassment, blue is sadness, indigo is fear, and so on."

"Curiouser and curiouser." said Eton. "How deep does the rabbit hole go?"

Myrrh tilted her head. "I'm sorry, the... rabbit hole?"

Now it was Eton's turn to laugh, his first since his transformation. "It's from a popular fairy tale on Earth, named Alice in Wonderland." he explained. "How curious is your world?"

Myrrh smiled, understanding a little better. "Will you let me show you?" she asked.

Eton nodded and Myrrh smiled, touching a section of the wall...

1143.content:
The transparent ceiling vanished and Eton felt the cool air rush in. He took a deep breath and caught a whiff of a sweet scent that reminded him of freshly baked bread. "That smell is making me hungry." he said, his wings turning white.

Myrrh smiled, knowing that opening her world to Eton slowly was the best course of action. She needed to gain his trust and 'dropping' him into a flying lesson was not going to do that. "That's not surprising." she said. "It's been a hav-circle since your rebirth so I'd imagine you'd be starving."

"A what?" you asked, confused.

Myrrh giggled. "That is what we call a full day or night here." she explained. "It's all based on the movements of the sun and moon as we live high above the Earth." she took a breath. "A minute is a parmo, an hour is a mot, mid day or night is a qua-circle, and a full day is a hav- circle. Right now, its seven mot fifteen."

"Seven fifteen in the morning." said Eton, catching on. "What do you call a week, a month, a year?"

Myrrh giggled. "A week is par-rot." she replied. "A partial rotation around the sun. A month is a moonth and a year is a fullrot or a full rotation around the sun." she smiled. "Now, do you want to continue class or are you ready for breakfast?"

"Breakfast?" asked Eton. he then smiled. "Definately. I'm starving. I'm glad you use some human terms up here"

Myrrh sighed. "I have my work cut out for me. Trust me, not everything will be simple." she said. "Yes, we have breakfast, lunch, and dinner like humans do."

Eton giggled. "I'd love to have breakfast with you." he said. he looked up. "How do we get out?"

Myrrh laughed then spread her wings and launched herself upwards. "Just use your wings." she said. "Come on, try."

Eton started to flap his arms, causing Myrrh to laugh. "no, no, no!" she giggled. "Your wings, not your arms!"

"Don't laugh!" scolded Eton, his wings turning a shade of pink. "I've never had wings before!"

Myrrh smiled kindly. "I'm sorry, Eton." she said, gently. "Focus on your wings, they will respond."

Eton tried and, to his surprise, his wings spread outward and he was able to launch himself skyward. Only, he was panting after only a few seconds of being in the air. "This is harder than it looks." he said. "I'm already tired."

Myrrh took Eton's hand and took him skyward. "Just relax then." she said. "We can work on learning to fly after you get your strength back."

Eton nodded and looked around to see where he was and let out a low gasp, seeing a large number of islands, floating in the sky, above the clouds! "Oh... wow!" he breathed.

http://digital-art-gallery.com/oid/0/r16...

Myrrh smiled. "Eton, welcome to Skyaira, your new home."

"It's... enchanting!" whispered Eton, his eyes dancing.

Although Eton was now a ten year old Misterian boy, he had the mind of an adult human. Only, upon seeing his new home, his childhood was rekindled and his eyes lit up with wonder and curiosity... he had been truly reborn...

Seeing the look of wonder in his eyes, Myrrh smiled and took her new son...

Myrrh giggled. "Yep. The palace is on the main continent, just passed these islands."

http://simplywallpaper.net/pictures/2010...

Eton watched in awe at the large and small islands as they passed them. "What's keeping them above the ground?" he asked, curious. "Why haven't we, err, humans found them by now?"

"Those are good questions, Eton." said Myrrh. "We do not know what keeps them afloat in the air but it is though powerful magics that make these islands and continents of the sky invisible and non-corporeal to humans. It is what has allowed us to live in peace these many centuries."

Eton nodded then looked forward again to see an ancient palace below them. "Is that the palace?" he asked.

http://travelhappy.info/wp-content/uploa...

"Yes, it is." replied Myrrh. "We maintain the original outside design to honor our ancestors but the inside is quite modern as you will soon see."

Upon landing at the main entrance, Myrrh turned to Eton. "Inside, you will find a hall with Misterians standing at attention on either side." she said, seriously. "They are not permitted to move or speak, while on duty, guarding the entrance hall unless there is danger." she smiled. "Do not speak, keep your eyes forward, and do not stop walking until we enter the main place, understand?"

Eton nodded, though he was a bit confused. Myrrh took his hand and led him passed the main doors, which opened for them, revealing a beautifully decorated hall with smooth multi colored floors, walls and ceilings that seemed to change as they entered the hall. Eton tried his best to keep his eyes forward but the changing walls and floors and ceilings was very distracting and he could not help dart his eyes up. He saw the ceiling showing changing images of his rescue of Myrrh as James and his change into a little boy over and over. Each time, it ended with Eton awakening to his new form.

"Interesting." he thought. "It's like the palace hall is announcing our arrival."

Eton did not hear a word from the guards and nor did he see any of them move a muscle as they passed them, it was a bit unnerving to him to think that they were really not statues. Upon reaching the end of the hall, Myrrh touched the wall then, with her free hand, took Eton's wrist and had him touch the wall as well. The wall vanished, revealing a great room beyond which they entered as the wall reappeared behind them.

"Now we can talk freely." she said, smiling. "The silence serves as a gesture of respect to the guards, both Valkyrie and Archangels, men and women who protect the palace and our people."

Eton nodded then looked around to see that the room they were in had an halls branching off into several directions, each of which seemed to have been decorated to honor a different culture. He turned to Myrrh, confused. "The palace looked a little smaller from the outside." he said.

Myrrh giggled. "Nothing is as it seems." she replied. "It's a matter of perspective. The palace seems smaller on the outside only because most of it is invisible to the naked eye." she smiled. "Remember, we maintain the 'original' outer look to honor our ancestors."

Eton's eyes widened, glistening with wonder. "That's so cool!" he said, excited. "What does the palace really look like?"

Myrrh touched Eton's nose, giggling. "You'll find out in time." she said. "I didn't see the true look of the palace until I was a hundred years old."

Eton looked at Myrrh, stunned. "A hun... hundred years old!?" he asked. "You look no older than twenty, twenty five."

"Why thank you, Eton." said Myrrh with a smile. "I'm actually 485 years old. We Misterians live a long time, 2500 to 3000 years, in fact so you have all the time in the world, young man."

Eton's jaw dropped with his eyes still wide in shock, causing Myrrh to laugh. "Please close your mouth, a bird might make a nest in there."

A laugh escaped Eton's throat as he closed his mouth. "I'm guessing that is but the first of many shocking discoveries." he said, now walking with Myrrh again. "I wish my little sister, Nicole could see all of this. She always dreams about flying among the clouds."

Myrrh smiled but did not respond as an image of Nicole entered her mind. "I wonder." she thought. "Could she be our 'missing angel'?"
11431.title: to the palace.

114311.content:
Soon enough, Myrrh and Eton arrived at a grand set of doors, which also had some guards at attention there. Eton still felt a little wierd around these 'living statues' so to speak. Myrrh grabbed his hand in assurance.

"Relax, beyond these doors is....mother" said Myrrh after a small pause, her wings changing to a color that told Eton of how nervous she was.

"Well, (gulp) let's go" said Eton, not knowing what to expect when meeting the ruler of the Misterians. Was she a more casual ruler? Or perhaps more strict? Eton wasn't sure he wanted to find out. Then again, is she was his grandmother now, he would have to face her sooner or later. Besides, Myrrh could use the support. After all, Eton wasn't the one in deep trouble for causing the situation in which he had to become a Misterian.

"Come" said Myrrh as she gulped and proceeded forward. She pressed her hand on the door and it slowly opened at her touch. Unlike other doors that vanished on touch, this one opened like normal doors. Of course, because they were so large, they caused a huge noise as they glided across the ground.

Myrrh and Eton walked together into the hall. Eton;s mouth once again hung open as he looked at the grand majesty of the hall.

'This is the 'Hall of Miracles' told Myrrh into his thoughts. Eton wondered why they called it that. Myrrh responded, mentally again. 'It's called that way because, if you're her because you're in trouble, it'll be a miracle if you get out with no problem. That's more or less a rumor though just to scare kids into eating their healthy foods' thought Myrrh with a slight giggle. Eton gave her a dull look that pretty much said 'Seriously?'.

Anyway, as they walked along, Eton looked at the throne at the end of the hall. There sat a woman of obvious grand stature. She looked like an older version of Myrrh, with longer dark hair and wearing white clothing. Her energy wings shined behind her. They were mostly white right now, but they had a tint of red which worried Eton.

Soon enough, Myrrh and Eton arrived at the foot of the throne and met Queen Minerva's gaze.

"H-Hello mother" said Myrrh, not doing a good job of hiding the nervousness in her voice. Minerva's eyes traveled to Myrrh, making her gulp again.

"Myrrh. This is quite a problem you've caused. Bacause of your foolishness, this young man's life has been turned upside down with his friends and family in grief. How do you justify yourself?" asked Minerva, calm and cool as a ruler should. Myrrh however, was none of that. She fumbled around her words, trying to explain herself to the ruler of Skyaira.

"You can't, can't you?" said Minerva, more telling than asking. Myrrh hung her head down in shame. "I told you over and over that one day, bad things would happen if you couldn't learn how to grow up. You didn't listen to me and look at what has happened. You now seem to have the rare honor of being a mother who hasn't even mated yet. Such things could reflect horribly on you Myrrh" explained Minerva.

"I-I understand mother. It's just that..." started Myrrh, but Minerva wouldn't let her.

"Do you know? I'm not so sure. You're the only heir I have Myrrh. These are things you should have learning centuries ago. When are you going to start taking your duties seriously?" asked Minerva. She sighed and then continued. "Unfortunately, nothing can change the past. You're stuck with what you have caused Myrrh".

"W-What do you mean?" asked Myrrh, barely able to look her mother in the eye. Eton didn't know what to do in this situation. Myrrh was getting a harsh lecture from her mother but Eton really couldn't do much about it. This meeting was more about Myrrh than it was about him.

"I'm sure you know. This boy is your son now. Thus, you will be tasked with raising him properly' stated Minerva, putting empathesis on the last part. "Maybe this could be what causes you to mature, Myrrh. If I find out that you are not properly raising him, there will be severe consequences. That, I assure you. Even I can't protect you anymore Myrrh" said Minerva, ever keeping her cool.

"Yes mother" said Myrrh, a little more calm now that she knew that she wouldn't be severely punished. Then, Minerva turned to Eton.

"Now, you are the victum in all this. I'm deeply sorry for what my daughter has caused" said Minerva. Eton didn't know what to say but had to say something.

"I-It's nothing, g-grandmother" said Eton, getting used to the word. Minerva actually gave a small smile as she heard it, as if she found it amusing.

"I pray that we can make your new life as good as possible. I can assure that for your heroics" said Minerva. Eton nodded in gratitude at Minerva.

"Now, I believe you both have business to do now. You know what to do Myrrh. You're both dismissed" said Minerva.

No more needed to be said as both Misterians left the hall with many things to think about now.
114311.title: Meeting Queen Minerva.

1143111.content:
Upon entering the hall outside the throne room, dubbed the 'hall of miracles', all the guards stood at attention as queen Minerva came into view behind them. "All hail Prince Eton, daughter of princess Myrrh by rite of rebirth!" she announced.

The guards immediately turned to Eton and bowed before declaring, in one voice, "Hail prince Eton, daughter of princess Myrrh! You shall not be harmed!"

With that said, the guards returned to their posts, unmoving. Eton, taken back, turned to see the heavy door sliding closed with a low ruble and caught a warm smile from queen Minerva. *You may just be what my daughter needs to finally grow up, Eton.* she thought to you. *Welcome to Skyaira, my grandson.*

A smile touched the corners of Eton's mouth as he waved bye to his new grandmother then turned away and followed Myrrh down the hall, to another corridor that was lined with doors and other halls. Once they were far enough away, Eton asked, "What was that all about... mommy?"

Myrrh sighed. "It was my mom's way of reminding me that I am not alone in raising you." she replied "Queen Minerva never shuts anyone out or leaves anyone to fend for themselves in her kingdom."

Eton nodded then asked, "So where are we going now?"

"The dining hall." replied Myrrh. "You did say you were hungry, right?"

Eton blushed as his stomach began to growl, causing Myrrh to giggle. "We don't have the foods you are used to but I can assure you they are just as tasty." she said. "I will bring you a little variety and tell you what each dish is."

Myrrh then led Eton into a grand hall with a long table in the center of the room with a large number of narrow backed chairs, which he guessed were to accommodate for a Misterian's wings. Myrrh smiled then said, "Find yourself a seat and I'll go talk to the kitchen staff."

With that, she touched a section of the wall, causing it to vanish, and walked through as the sounds of a busy kitchen filled the dining hall. Eton tried to look inside but the 'door' closed as soon as Myrrh was through, leaving the hall in silence again. "What a curiously wonderful place." said Eton, softly. "I feel like I'm in one of those fairy tale s Nicole loves to read."

Just then, Eton sensed that some one was watching him. It was not an new found power but a learned skill he had acquired when he was a grown man. He looked around and spotted a small child, no older than himself, nervously peeking into the hall, looking at him. Eton smiled, catching the child's eye. "I don't bite." he said. "Please, come in and know me better."

The child visibly gulped and walked into the room. As boys and girls all basically dressed the same, Eton could not tell if the person was a boy or a girl. "Hi, I'm Lea." she said, timidly."


Eton rose from his seat. "I'm Eton." he replied. "Um... forgive me, I was just... rebirthed. Are you a boy or a girl?"

Lea looked at Eton for a moment, then giggled as an attractive woman walked up behind her. "Lea, you're laughing!" she said, happy but surprised. "What's so funny?"

The woman looked into the hall as Lea explained between giggles and giggled herself as Eton blushed brightly. She entered, bringing Lea with her and gave you a respectful bow. "Girls keep their hair longer than boys and are more developed, when they enter puberty." she explained. "Also, boys have a more muscular frame."

"I see." said Eton, looking slightly lost.

The woman smiled. "I am Charity, master of arms of the Valkyrie."

"I'm Eton, son of princess Myrrh by rite of rebirth." replied Eton.

Charity's eyes widened slightly then bowed further, urging Lea to do the same but Eton shook his head. "Please, I'm still trying to wrap my head around being a little boy again." he said. "You don't have to bow before me."

Charity rose, smiling with Lea following. "May we join you?" she asked.

Eton nodded.
1143111.title: Exiting the Hall

11431111.content:
Charity took a seat next to Eton with Lea taking a seat on the other side of him. "Please allow me to enlighten you on a few pointers, Eton." said Charity, kindly. "First, it's not necessary to always add 'by rite of rebirth' to your name. Merely saying Prince Eton, you state your standing and your different colored eyes give the status of your rebirth."

"I used to have blue eyes." said Eton. "Why did that change to brown?"

Charity smiled. "All parts of the rebirth are random." replied Charity. "You could have come out of it a girl like Lea or a man, or a woman with any combination of traits and eye colors that exist in the royal family." she gave a low giggle. "I take it Myrrh did not explain Misterian clothing to you."

Eton shook his head. "Um... no, she dressed me quickly then off we went." he said. "I saw that everyone dressed pretty much the same so I didn't question it."

"Well, there are subtle differences." explained Charity. "The toga like... dress, I think you call them, wraps around the body and is secured by a single clasp at the shoulder. Boys wear the clasp on the right while the girls wear them on the left, more as a tradition than anything else."

"What do we wear when we sleep?" asked Eton, curious.

Lea giggled, finding it amusing that Eton knew so little. "Boys and girls just wear panties and a 'night skirt'." she said. "We don't wear any tops to bed, not even a bra."

Eton turned another shade of red as he remembered Myrrh putting him in a training bra. She did it so quickly, it was a blur to him. "The lines between genders seem very blurred here." he said.

Lea giggled again. "You have a lot to learn." she said.

"As do you, Leala." scolded Charity, smiling. "Judge not less thee be judged yourself."

"Mommy!" said Lea, blushing. "Must you use my full name?"

"When you misbehave, yes." replied Charity. she then turned back to Eton. "Males and females here are equal on many levels but there are lines that separate them we just don't believe in etching those lines in stone, so to speak."

Eton nodded, understanding. "Thank you." he said. "Is there anything else I should know?"

"I think I should allow your mother to cover the rest." she said. "I have already stepped a little out of line telling you what I did but you needed to know."

Just then, a section of the wall vanished, bringing sounds of the kitchen as Myrrh returned, the wall reforming behind her. She smiled, seeing Charity and Lea, sitting with Eton. "Ah, I see you've already made some friends." she said. "It's a good thing I had a lot prepared."
11431111.title: A friendly conversation.

114311112.content:
Inside her throne room, Minerva frowned as she watched an image through the eyes of one of her scouts, a Valkyrie who walked on earth as a police woman. She accompanied the human policeman who reported to James' home. She and the policeman informed James' family his remains had been found. The policeman seemed visibly sick as he explained that it looked as if James had been literally torn to pieces. Mom immediately fell into hysterical tears as Dad vainly attempted to comfort her. "Any ideas who did this?" he asked, distraught himself.

"We are investigating." replied the policeman. "We found three men at the crime scene but they were seriously messed up themselves and had no memory of what had happened." he sighed, frustrated. "We'll find your son's killer."

Behind mom and dad, Nicole hugged Trevor, wailing in tears. Watching, Minerva wanted to comfort her but knew it was not possible for her to do so. "I'm sorry, child." she said, softly. "I wish you could all know the truth but its not our way."

Over near a corner, sat Ellen, James' oldest sibling. Her hands were balled up in fists as she was trying remain strong in the presence of tragedy. However, her facade wasn't working well as tears were leaking out of her eyes. Without a word, she ran upstairs to her room before she could break down in tears in front of her family.

She then spotted a young man comforting a woman and recognized them, from Eton's memories, as Nate and Erin and listened in as her scout telepathically sent what she was experiencing to her. "I'll find who did this, Nate." he whispered, crying with her. "I'll make the bastard pay, I swear it!"

Minerva shook her head. "I fear this Nate will tear the city apart, looking for his friend's 'killer'." she mussed. "I admire him but I must find a way for this family to find peace."

Then she noticed something odd and mentally instructed her Valkyrie to comfort Nicole. "Place your hands onto her back, tell me what you find." she thought to her.

The police woman placed her hands onto Nicole's back and inwardly gasped as she discovered a pair of hardened lumps where a pair of wings would be rooted. Nicole, feeling the policewoman's touch turned around to see her smile sadly. "We know you miss him." she said. "I promise we will do all we can to find who did this."

Nicole immediately hugged the policewoman while, high above, Minerva heard the report and sighed. "This case just got more complicated."

Later on...
114311112.title: On Earth, James' family grieves.

1143111122.content:
"So, this is what Misterians eat?" asked Eton as he observed the buffet Myrrh made for themselves and their guests. Aside from a drink that looked similar to milk, the foods looked somewhat odd to Eton. One dish was that of what looked like Mac & Cheese noodles. Except that they were almost white in color and they had a sort of green spice on them.

"Yes, these in particular are spiced noodles. We grow our own food here but we do have some foods that humans eat. The green spice is from a kind of Misterian crop that has a...bit of a kick to it so to speak" said Myrrh with a sly giggle. Eton squinted at her, as if she just said something odd.

"You didn't spike it did you?" he asked. Apparently, Myrrh and Charity knew what he meant as they giggled a bit. Lea on the other hand had absolutley no idea.

"No, I wouldn't do that to a kid. It's kind of like that spicy sause those people from Mexico, I believe you call it" said Myrrh. Eton sighed in relief. She was talking about the spiciness, not if there was alchohol in it. Anyway, he grabbed a fork and took a bite out of it. Almost instantly, his face lit up with heat. He immediately grabbed his drink and gulped down half of it, much to the amusement of the 3 girls present.

"Told you it had a kick to it" said Myrrh as she giggled. Eton glared at her with an indginant look on his face. Before he could respond however, they heard a knock on the nearby door.

"Myrrh? I need to enter if possible" said a female voice. No doubt that it was Minerva. Myrrh heard it and motioned for her to come in, the door vanishing as the queen made her entrance.

"Ah my queen. To what do we owe this pleasure?" asked Charity. There was a bit of sarcasm in her voice which made Minerva smile. Charity was an experienced and responsible woman, and she had known Minerva for centuries now. No doubt there was some playful humore between the two friends.

"You aside for now" said Minerva, gesturing to Charity. Then, she continued while looking at Eton, "I need to borrow Eton for a minute. Could you please?". Eton was confused but he didn't want to go against the queen so he nodded and got up from the table.

"Don't eat my share!" he yelled just to make sure. Myrrh gave him a smile that both assured him and yet made him uneasy. Anyway, the two walked into a nearby room for a little privacy.

"What do you need, g-grandmother?" asked Eton, a little uneasy. Minerva smiled.

"No need to be nervous. I just need to ask you something" said Minerva.

"That would be?" started Eton. Minerva composed herself before continuing.

"When I first met you, I saw your memories of what had happened, as well as some other aspects of your life. Then, something caught my eye. A young girl was most often present in your memories. About 6-years old I imagine? Who is she?" asked Minerva. Eton smiled as he remembered his youngest (and perhaps favorite) sibling.

"That's Nicole. She's my youngest sister. We adopted her 4 years ago. I was always the one with played with her the most. Like me, she often dreams of being able to fly one day. We would always talk about our dreams, to the amusement of anyone around" said Eton, slightly laughing which brough a smile to Minerva's face.

"If I may, what were the circumstances of your family adopting her?" she asked.

"Well, it's kind of odd. Mom said she found her in a dark alley. She said her clothing was shredded and that she was badly bleeding. She also had these wierd markings on her back, which the doctors said were bone spurs on her shoulders. Anyway, Mom saved her and brought her to the hospital to be healed. When she woke up later, we were at a meeting to discuss wether she should go to an orphanage or not. She woke up right ther and asked if Mom was her mother. It seemed as if she couldn't remember anything. Mom said yes and Nicole never questioned it" said Eton.

"Never questioned it?" asked Minerva.

"Yeah, like she really believes that she's a blood-related member of the family. No one had the heart to tell her that she was adopted. Anyway, we decided to adopt her as an orphanage would be bad for her. Then, Trevor noted that she looked like a sleeping angel. So, we named her Nicole, meaning 'born by angels'. Funny huh?" said Eton, finishing his story.

"And this Nicole, she believes that she is normal?" asked Minerva. This confused Eton.

"Yeah, she's happy believing that Mom gave birth to her and we're happy when she's happy. Why?" asked Eton.

"Oh, it's nothing. I was just curious. You can go back to lunch now" said Minerva.

"Ok. Good day" said Eton as he exited the room and made his way back to the others. Minerva stayed in thought.

'So Pallas' daughter is alive? She'll be happy to know this. Now, should we convince Aria to come back to not?'
1143111122.title: Minerva asks Eton about Nicole.

11431111221.content:
Myrrh returned to her chambers to find Eton and Lea talking outside on a high balcony. She smiled, seeing Charity watching them from a comfortable distance. She noticed Myrrh and quietly waved her over, her wings a bright white, showing her joy. "They are already becoming friends." whispered Charity, smiling. "Your new son is adapting well."

"They do look lovely together." agreed Myrrh, quietly. "We should take a picture to mark the memory."

"Not together, though." said Charity. "Two lights frighten Lea terribly."

"Two lights?" asked Myrrh confused.

Charity sighed. "Lea was about six at the time, she tried to fly on her own and ended up gliding down to Earth." she said, explaining. "This only happens in three out of a billion times and, of course, it happened to Lea."

Myrrh tried her best not to giggle. "What happened?"

"I went after her but not before she landed on a dark road." replied Charity, sadly. "A human motor vehicle came over a hill and headed straight for Lea. The two lights on the truck paralyzed her with fear as the driver sounded a warning with a loud horn and attempted to stop."

"She wasn't hit, was she?" asked Myrrh, startled, but still whispering.

Charity shook her head. "No, but that incident stayed with her." said Charity. "Now, when she sees a flash out of the corner of her eye, she panics and tries to run from it."

"I see." said Myrrh. "We'll have to get their attention before taking the picture then, so not to alarm her."

Charity nodded then took what looked like a computer pad from her side bag as Myrrh did the same.

http://c686819.r19.cf2.rackcdn.com/wp-co...

Holding them up, they saw Eton and Lea, still talking on the ledge. "Hey Eton, this way." said Myrrh.

Eton and Lea turned, blushing slightly and saw the cameras. "Smile." said Charity.

The flashes went off, one at a time and Lea stomped her foot, annoyed, spreading her wings to emphasis her mood. "Mom! Must you!" she protested.

Only, as she said this, a powerful gust of wind blew over the balcony and caught her wings, throwing her over the railing. Lea screamed in fright, falling and Eton reacted by jumping after her.

"Eton, Lea!" screamed the perspective mothers, running to the railing. They looked down and breathed a sigh of relief, seeing Eton flapping his wings, holding Lea in the air by the wrist.

"Are you okay?" asked Eton, panting slightly with effort.

Blushing brightly, Lea replied, "Yeah, thank you."

Eton blushed as well. "Any time." he said. "Can you start flapping your wings, I'm getting tired."

Lea blushed even more and began to flap her wings, bring her level with Eton in the air. "Sorry, Eton." she said. "I was so scared, I forgot for a moment."

"I'm scared too." admitted Eton.

Lea looked at Eton, confused. "Why, you saved me."

Eton glanced back at his mom and Charity looking at them with loving eyes, which Lea noticed. "I see, you think they might want to play cupid." she said.

"I've seen that look in a girl's eyes before." said Eton. "I know they will."

After a short time of talking some more, Eton and Lea returned to the balcony and made a soft landing into the arms of their mothers. "That was very brave, Eton." said Myrrh. "I'm proud of you." she then whispered, "I think you just made your first friend today, get to know her more."

"You made a great friend, Lea." said Charity. "I'm happy you are safe." she then whispered, "He's cute, you might want to get to know him more."

Eton and Lea looked at each other, blushing.
11431111221.title: Leala's fear.

114311112211.content:
Meanwhile, back on Earth, to say things were miserable would be an understatement.

After James' "remains" were discovered and the family notified, things were silent around the Walker house. The parents, James' Mom and Dad, didn't speak much although they did attempt to try and brighten the spirits of the remaining family members. They had to prepare for James' funeral and they wanted everyone to try and remember the good times they shared with him.

Ellen had rarely come out of her room since the news. When the police came, she was visably shaking while trying to maintain a strong facade. Sadly to say, she ran up the stairs and secluded herself in her room before she bursted out in tears.

Trevor, the youngest of the male siblings, was distraught yet indignant. Losing his brother tore him up but also grew hatred in him for whoever did this. His first words following the policeman's report was that he wanted to track down whoever did this and take them down (and he used more adult words while saying it). Everyone admired his resolve in the face of this tragedy.

Perhaps the worst off was the youngest sibling, Nicole. Only 6 years old, she was perhaps the closest to James. They shared a dream of flying together, to the amusement of whoever was around. As Eton had said earlier, Nicole was adopted but had no memory of whoever she was before. James was the one most accepting of her into the family and played with her at each oppurtunity. She hadn't played with her toys at all since the news and just sat on her bed, your legs swinging back and forth off the ledge.

"Nicole dear, it's time for dinner" said Mom as she opened Nicole's door, hoping for her daughter to eat more. In the past day, Nicole had barely eaten and it already showed since she was naturally a thing girl. She wasn't anorexic by any means, but her lack of nutrition wasn't helping.

"Ok mom" said Nicole. Jane, the mother, sighed in relief that Nicole finally acknowledged that. Nicole slowly jumped off her bed and walked out the room, Jane holding her small hand as she did.

They weren't the only ones who had heard the news. Nate and Erin had been told as well. Like Ellen, Erin was distraught at the news and tried her eyes out, despite Nate's attempts to help her. Like Trevor, Nate swore that he would find whoever did this and make them pay for taking the life of his best friend.

Little did they know that it wasn't an end, it was a beginning. Especially for Nicole, as she would be more wrapped up into what was to come much more than the others.
114311112211.title: Back on Earth...

1143111122111.content:
After an uneventful dinner, everyone retired to their rooms for bedtime. Currently, it was about 10:30 in the evening. While sleep came easier for most of the family, Nicole was unable to have a peaceful sleep. Since James' death, she had been feeling wierd, almost sick to her stomach.

'I shouldn't tell mommy and daddy yet though. I can't let them worry about me now' thought Nicole. Everyone was dealing with James' death. Nicole didn't want to worry her family even more with how she was feeling. The reason why she didn't eat much was because she constantly felt sick to her stomach. Her head was pounding, as if there were hammers pounding inside of it. In all honesty, it was driving Nicole crazy.

Right now, it was worse than it was before. Her face was a ghostly shade of white and she felt as if she was going to throw up.
