Currently, she was still laying in bed, trying to endure through it and get through the night. However, she was beginning to sweat profusely and her breathing was hard. If only one could see the inside of her mindscape right now.

*****Nicole's Mind******

Nicole's mind was an absolute maelstrom of darkness, thoughts swirling in her head. Occassionately, vague visions would appear, such as a boy with what appeared to be angel wings. It scared Nicole not to know what it all meant. All she was now was extremely frightened. Voices could be heard all around but Nicole couldn't make them out. It was like she was drowing into an infinite abyss without the smallest speck of light.

*****Real World*****

For unknown reasons, her condition seemed to be geting worse. Nicole was starting to believe that she was going to die. As this was happening, her door opened slightly, revealing Ellen in her sleeping clothes.

"Nicole, are you alright? I thought I heard....Oh my gosh!" yelled Ellen as she ran over to Nicole, taking a look at the distressed girl. Ellen didn't waste a second calling her parents down. No matter what, Nicole wouldn't wake up, but she was shaking uncontrollably. If her face could get any more white, it just did. Eventually, Michael decided it was best to take Nicole to the hospital.

Ellen tried her best to comfort her ailing sister as the family drove her to the hospital. It was no use and Ellen felt helpless as nothing seemed to calm down Nicole.

About half an hour later, Nicole was laying in a hospital bed. A doctor had taken a look and couldn't quite figure out what was wrong. He guessed that it was perhaps a bad cold but no one seemed too sure. Anyway, Nicole was given some medicine to help calm her down. The family watched in relief as Nicole's breathing slowly went back to normal, some color finally returning to her face.

"Thank goodness" said Jane as she watched Nicole's previously contorted face soften and relax. She gently combed through Nicole's brown hair as Nicole's head finally began to clear.

'What....is...happening?' thought Nicole before a peaceful dreamless sleep enveloped her.
1143111122111.title: Nicole's Plight

11431111221111.content:
"Man, what a day!" said Eton as he sat down on the hard ground without a second thought. Lea giggled behind him. The two had just finished up Eton's first day at school.

After dinner last night, Myrrh showed Eton how Misterian's slept in what Eton described as love seats. It was surprisingly comfortable sleeping in a sitting position. That mroning, Eton recieved an abrupt awakening, learning that school started at sunrise for kids his age. Myrrh showed him how to properly shower, which involved grooming his wings. It involved an open shower where Myrrh had to help as well until he could learn to do it himself. Being male, he would have to learn since he would have physical wings throughout his whole life, unlike the energy wings that females developed which required no cleaning.

Anyway, Eton was then brought to a small island off the mainland that housed the school for Misterians. Once again, Myrrh left him, leaving him by himself. Luckily, Lea found him and gave him the grand tour of the building. Needless to say, Eton didn't talk much to the other kids besides Lea. It was rather uneventful for a first day. Not many talked to him, although he could hear them discussing about him. He probably would have to confront them tomorrow if not earlier.

"It's just as boring as regular school" said Eton, glad to be out of there.

"Really? I heard you liked Astronomy from when you were human" suggested Lea.

"Yes, and that part was kind of cool. Everything else was boring" said Eton, sighing and making Lea giggle again.

"I totally agree, my friend!" yelled an energetic male voice from behind them. Eton and Lea turned around to see a couple of kids their age approach them. One was male with short light brown hair and a smile that seemed to be permanently etched onto his face. He was wearing a green toga top with the clasp on his left shoulder with what seemed to be brown shorts on, unlike the skorts that most wore.

His partner was a brown'haired girl who had hers in a ponytail. She had striking purple eyes which seemed bizarre but seemed to carry an energy in them. She was wearing a top that covered her chest completely and wrapped around her neck, leaving half her back open for her wings. The top itself was purple and she had white fencing gloves that covered her hands and forearms. She wore the standard skort which was white and she wore boot that went halfway up her calves. The boots were purple with green laces wrapping around them.

"I know you. You kept interrupting the teacher" said Eton, pointing to the male. The male smirked, as if he had no shame. Looking closely, Eton was surprised to see that he had 2 eye colors! As far as he knew, only rebirthed Misterians had 2 eyes like he had.

"Guilty as charged. Just thought I'd make it more fun. I'm Ewol by the way" said Ewol, extending his hand. Eton gave him a weary smile and shook his outstretched hand. His attention then went to the girl with him.

"I'm Karis, pleased to meet you" said Karis, shaking his hand as well. She then turned to Lea and smiled. "You must have had quite an impact on Lea. She's usually quite depressing" said Karis. Eton was confused at this, while Lea blushed at her words and hung her head.

"Really?" asked Eton.

"Yeah, everyone picks on Lea because she always carries this air of depression with her. To see her so happy around you, it's quite refreshing. Congratulations on your new friend, Lea" said Karis, making Lea blush more.

"No...it's nothing" said Lea in a tiny voice. Then, Karis smirked, and not the good one either.

"So, judging by your aura when you're with him, I assume you've already picked him as your mate-to-be?" asked Karis, allowing Lea's face to invent a new shade of red.

"W-What? No! I-I don't..." stumbled Lea, not many coherent voices escaping her mouth before she shut it. Karis then giggled and patted the girl on the back.

"Relax, I was joking" said Karis, trying to laugh it off. Lea wasn't laughing though and tried to tell Karis that that wasn't very nice. Eventually, the two girls started going back and forth on it, leaving Ewol and Eton to themselves for a minute.

"Well, there they go. Such energetic girls they are. Can't say it's not attractive though" said Ewol. Eton laughed a bit as how much Ewol seemed to remind him of Nate back down in the human world. Then, Ewol turned to Eton.

"So, you were rebirthed as well?" asked Ewol.

"Yeah. I noticed you must have been as well" said Eton, getting a nod from Ewol.

"Yeah, I was originally a human named Brandon. I had been an orphin for as long as I could remember and I was taking a leisurely stroll around the block. Then, I see this winged girl being attacked by these guys. I tell you, they didn't seem normal. Their eyes were blood red" said Ewol, chilling Eton to his bones.

"Who was the girl?" asked Eton.

"Lea" replied Ewol. This surprised Eton but he allowed Ewol to continue first.

"So, my first instinct is to get them away from her. I picked up some rocks and hurled them at the guys, telling them to leave her alone. However, I was so in over my head and one of them stabbed me in the stomach. As I understand it, Lea's mother then came and slayed the demons in those men, knocking them out. Lea pleaded with her mom to save me and she did just that. After that, I've been Lea's older brother" said Ewol.

"Really? Her brother?" asked Eton.

"Yeah, crazy right? Well, it's pretty good so far. It's only been about 5 months since it happened but I'm over it. It's not like I had any family down there who cared about me" said Ewol, a little sadness evident in his normally happy voice.

Eton was surprised to already meet someone who already had gone through what he went through. This would be the start of a wonderful friendship between them.
11431111221111.title: Eton's Day

114311112211111.content:
Suddenly, Ewol's aura seemed to brighten up again and he smiled at Eton.

"But enough about me, you got rebirthed as the son of the princess. That's quite a shock as no one expected Myrrh to be having any children for a long time" said Ewol.

"Why's that?" asked Eton.

"Well, let's just say that Princess Myrrh is in no rush for her own family. She's nearing 500 years of age but has barely even dated someone in her lifetime" said Ewol.

"Well, the people of this race have such long lifespans. I don't think I'll have to rush either" said Eton. Ewol kept smiling and wrapped one arm around Eton's shoulders.

"Me neither" said Ewol. Looking ahead, they saw the girls finally joining them again. Lea was apparently still not forgiving Karis for her joke.

"So, you girls done?" asked Ewol.

"Yeah, mostly. Anyway, let's go. I want to get some practice in today and you both are coming" said Karis, apparently not taking no for an answer, or even waiting for an answer that is. She quickly walked to the edge and flew down to the mainland. Lea was trailing behind her. Ewol sighed as he watched Lea fly off.

"If only Lea could actually act herself around me" said Ewol, confusing Eton.

"What do you mean?" asked Eton.

"Being an only child, Lea doesn't exactly conprehend how to live with a sibling. She always feels like she owes me for putting him in danger and she always tries to be the good sister. She almost never opposes anything I say. It's almost like she's trying to be my servant. It's kind of frustrating" said Ewol.

"I know how it feels to have siblings. Ellen and I would fight alot as kids. However, we've become very close over the last few years as we grew up" said Eton, reliving the good old days with him and his siblings.

"Sounds nice. I wouldn't mind if Lea and I messed with eachother, because that's what siblings do. I want her to be herself. Maybe you can help her since you had siblings as a human" sais Ewol. It was more of a request than a statement though, and Eton caught on to it.

"Sure thing..friend" said Eton. Ewol smiled at the word and the two fist-bumped each other. This friendship was off to a great start.

"Anyway, what was Karis talking about?" asked Eton.

"Oh that? She's talking about sparring and training at the Training Hall. You see, Karis dreams of becoming a high-ranking Valkyrie. When you get to know her, it's not hard to imagine why. She's a born leader and alot of people look up to her bravery and grace. She's pretty good with a sword in her hands too and her magic is strong as well. She has the total package" said Ewol, almost in an admiring tone.

"Do you like her?" asked Eton, innocently. Ewol smirked and shook his head.

"No. Not like that. She's a pal and that's good for now. Maybe in the far future, things could change" said Ewol, and Eton took that reasonable explanation. Then, Ewol got an idea.

"You know, you should come too. It's good to train with a weapon. Helps the mind and body much more than this place will" said Ewol, referring to the school. Eton laughed at his words.

"Sounds fun. Are there instructors there?" asked Eton.

"Yep, many. They'll help anyone with a weapon. I even heard there's a sword and shield instructor from Titania visiting. She's supposedly quite the looker" said Ewol with a gleam in his eye.

"Titania?" asked Eton.

"It's a Misterian city in Europe. I think it's over the United Kingdom. It a pretty sophisticated place, and they house a Royal Academy for Archangel and Valkyrie training. If this girl is from there, she must be quite skilled. There's even a rumor that she's a rebirthed human as well, born in France" said Ewol.

"Well, what are we waiting for then. Let's fly" said Eton. With that, the 2 friends flew off the edge of the island. Ewol did have to gently support Eton though as he wasn't completely ready to fly on his own yet.
114311112211111.title: New Friends- Ewol and Karis

1143111122111111.content:
After a few minutes of flying, which Eton was not used to, Ewol pointed ahead, towards a magnificent temple on another floating island. "There is it, Training Hall." he said. "Karis and Lea are just now landing, we better pick up the pace."

http://smashbros.neoseeker.com/w/i/smash...

Eton nodded and tried his best to fly faster but he was already tired and Ewol had to almost drag him and help him land. Both were panting by the time the reached Karis and Lea. "You need to practice more, Eton." said Ewol.

"Give me a break." pouting, Eton said. "I'm trying my best."

"Don't pick on him, Ewol." warned Karis. "I remember how hard learning to fly was for you."

Ewol blushed slightly. "I also remember how hard you were on me to learn more quickly." he fired back.

Suddenly, Lea took Eton's hand. "This place always makes me shiver." she said. "Would you go in with me, Eton?"

Eton, slightly taken back nodded and followed Ewol and Karis into the main entrance. What greeted them caused shivers to run down Eton's spine. "The temple seemed much older on the inside than it did non the outside and he could see shadows of what he could only describe as demons flying about the room!

http://bestgamewallpapers.com/files/2moo...

"You... You see them?" asked Karis, seeing Eton push Lea behind him in a protective gesture. "Only a destined Valkyrie or Archangel should be able to see the demons."

Lea gulped. "Demons!?"

"Their just illusions." said Karis. "the point is, they are there as a reminder to those who train here that they are a constant threat and we of the Valkyrie and Archangels must forever me on alert."

Just then, a large sword sliced down in front of Eton! He let out a surprised yell as he thrust his wings outward, jumping back, taking Lea with him. He tried to look up to see his attacker but he or she would not give him the chance as the sword came down again only, this time, it was coming closer. Eton was not one to back down from a fight, that part of James was still within him and a fire came to his eyes. "You want a fight, then?" he asked, angry. "Bring it!"

With that, a renewed sense of energy surged into his body and he swung his wings downward, not only shooting him into the air but throwing dust at his unknown attacker. He heard a feminine cough and threw himself at the sound, hoping to knock whoever it was off balance. Only to his surprise, a hand caught his shoulder and gently pushed him to the ground.

"This exercise is over." she said calmly. "You're pretty good for your age" she continued, a hint of a french accent in her voice.

Eton looked up at the woman annoyed but froze, taken back by her beauty.

http://www.webtraj.com/img/valkyrie-prof...

(Notes: Her hair is a dark black and her armor is dark blue instead of purple)

"Who.....who are you?" he stammered.

The girl smiled at him. She wasn't that much taller than Eton. Only about 5'2 in height.

"I'm Etoile, and I'm an instructor from Titania. It's a pleasure to meet you" said Etoile with the same smile.

Eton blushed brightly as Lea giggled.
1143111122111111.title: The Training Hall

11431111221111111.content:
"That's a pretty shade of red on your face" said Etoile, giggling at Eton's blush. Eton turned his head away, trying to calm himself down. Once he did, he spoke up again.

"I just noticed, you have a french accent" he told her. Etoile just kept smiling.

"Well, that would be natural. I was born there after all" she stated. Eton's eyes widened and he looked at her eyes. Ewol's rumors were true! She had blue and green eyes!

"So, you were a human as well?" asked Eton.

"Yes I was. I'm glad to meet someone like myself after so long. There aren't many like me in Titania" said Etoile.

"Really? So how old are you?" asked Eton. Etoile was a little taken back as how casually he asked it, before Karis socked him in the head.

"Never ask a girl her age!" yelled Karis as Eton clutched his ailing head. Etoile giggled at the sight.

"It's fine Karis. It's natural for him to know since we were both human to begin with. I just turned 50 this year" said Etoile. Ewol was the surprised one this time!

"Really?! Such little time and you're one of the Royal Academy's top notch instructors?!" yelled Ewol, estatic that he was meeting someone who young, yet so skilled.

"I caught up on things quickly. I've got a bit more stamina than the average woman. A complete opposite from how I was as a human" said Etoile, a hint of sadness in her voice. Karis grew a bit concerned for Etoile.

"Are you ok? Do you not want to talk about it?" she asked. Etoile perked up and smiled at Karis.

"No, it's fine. It's just that, even now, it's so surprising how everything happened to me" said Etoile.

"Well, let's go outside to a table and talk about it. I'm sure both Eton and myself are curious as to how another human got here" said Ewol.

"Yes, you're right. Let's leave here first" said Etoile. With that, the group of 5 left the hall, going to one of many resting tables outside, made for people to just sit down and talk or have lunch together. Once they found a table, they eagerly waited for Etoile's story.

"As you're already aware, I was born in France about 50 years ago. My name than was Astrid. I was born into a wealthy family who had a mansion and everything. I certainly would have had a charmed life" said Etoile.

"Would have?" asked Eton. Etoile closed her eyes and frowned at the memory.

"I was born with a very frail constitution. Even daily activities were difficult for me. I would always end up sick and back in bed. I never got to go to school or make friends with anyone. I wasn't expected to live very long as well. It was only a matter of time before I passed on" said Etoile, to the shock of all present.

"How sad" said Lea, sniffling a bit at Etoile's story. She smiled softly and continued on.

"So, I was about 5 years old when I sensed something bad in my room. I didn't know until later that it was a demon going after me. Luckily, a valkyrie saved me. Her name was Kleio and she was from Titania. However, after she conquered the demon, she was badly injured. I realized that I was the only one who could see her and she was too injured to make it back. So, despite my health, I allowed her to stay with me. I fed her some of my food from dinner and allowed her to sleep in my room until she was better. She was surprised to see a human so caring for a being with wings" said Etoile.

"Wow" said Ewol, noticing how everything seemed to connect back to demons.

"She noticed that I was always looking out at the stars at night. I always hoped that a shooting star would come. I wished that I could be better. That I could have friends and live a life like everyone else. She was surprised to hear that I had been doing that for at least 3 years" said Etoile with a small giggle. Karis sniffled a bit at how sad Etoile's story was.

"So, what happened?" asked Ewol.

"Well, the inevitable eventually happened. A few months after my fifth birthday, my condition got worse. I was on my deathbed, just laying there for death to come. On the night that I knew would be my last, I thanked Kleio for her company, as I never had someone to talk to, not even my own parents. However, Kleio had other ideas. She wanted to thank me for nursing her back to health and wanted to give me a better life. So, she rebirthed me into her daughter. Like with you, my remains stayed behind for my family to bury. She named Etoile, which is french for 'star', after how I wished on one for so long" said Etoile, her story nearing it's end.

"Wow, what a story. Maybe the demon attacking you was a blessing in disguise then. If it hadn't attacked you, you might never have met Kleio and would be dead by now" said Ewol, getting a nod from Etoile.

"So, my weakness then became my strength. Suddenly, instead of being a frail human, I now had more stamina than the average female Misterian. I want to teach others to defend themselves so I became an instructor. And the rest is history" finished Etoile.
11431111221111111.title: Etoile

114311112211111111.content:
After hearing Etoile's story, Eton lowered his head in thought. He wanted to become stronger than he was right now. Etoile had gone through so much as a human and found strength in her new life. He wanted to do the same to protect his new friends and family.

"Hey Etoile!" he cried out, getting everyone's attention.

"Yes?" she asked curiously.

"Will you instruct me as well?" he asked, getting some surprised looks from Lea and Karis. Ewol smirked, as if he had suspected such a thing to come.

"Why do you ask?" asked Etoile. Despite her words, a small smile graced her lips. She had a good idea as to why he would ask.

"I was too weak to really protect Myrrh when she was attacked. That was pretty much the queen saving her instead of me. I want to become stronger than that. I should at least learn how to better protect myself" stated Eton. Etoile's smile got wider.

"I figured you might say something like that. I think I'll take you up on your request" said Etoile.

"Really?" asked Eton, excited.

"Yes, really. Unfortuntely, I am tied up for a while. How about we start next Monday and we can go from there?" asked Etoile.

"That's fine" saiod Eton.

"Then it's settled. Well, it's been fun, friends. Now, I have to get some work done of my own. Au revior!" she said in her native tongue, taking her leave as she left the table.

"I must say, that was unexpected" said Karis with a matter-of-fact tone.

"Well, I figured that it would be best for me to learn some defense. I don't want to mess up again" said Eton. Lea shyly smiled in admiration of Eton's resolve, something Karis noticed and smirked.

"I think you have a fan now" said Karis, getting Lea's attention and flustering her again. Karis laughed at Lea's expense, the boys not getting the reason why. It's not like they needed to know anyway.

"Well, I think it's good for you to learn how to use a weapon" said Ewol in support.

"Do you all know how to wied a weapon as well?" asked Eton.

"I'm good with the bow and arrow but that's it so far. I still need much practice at it. Of course, I imagine that you haven't been taught how to even use a slingshot yet, right? You should learn that first" said Ewol. Eton nodded in understanding.

"Yeah, got it. Anyway, what abpout you two?" asked Eton to the girls.

"I'm adapt with a sword so far. I prefer not to use a shield as it requires a different style. My magic is getting good enough to compensate anyway" said Karis. Lea mumbled something but nothing could be understood.

"Lea doesn't wield anything. She's too clumsy to use a weapon" said Ewol.

"I-I'm not clumsy!" Lea retaliated.

"Yeah, and I wear boots on my hands" said Ewol in response, getting everyone to laugh while Lea blushed again, her wings continuing to turn a bright pink in the process.

"Anyway, I'd like to get in the practice I wanted to get in" said Karis as she started to walk back in.

"Come on in. We can get you started with having a blade in your hands" said Ewol with excitement. Eton agreed to that. It sounded fun. With that in mind, the group entered the Training Hall again but Karis directed them into another room.

"The 'Demon Room' wasn't where we wanted to go. The 'Fight Room' is where we wanted to go. That's where we czn train against others, without the threat of demons around" stated Karis.

"So, that's what happened" understood Eton. The four of them took a left turn and went into a much lighter room where some other kids and adults were training in any which way. It was pretty grand and reminded Eton of a gym back on Earth. Then, Karis picked up a couple of training swords and tossed one to Eton.

"You ready for a lesson?" asked Karis with a smirk.

"Just so you know, you're going to get a lot of bruises from her. Have fun" said Ewol as he and Lea watched from the sidelines.

'Oh crud' thought Eton. He knew he was in for it when Karis started charging at him.
114311112211111111.title: Eton's Request

1143111122111111111.content:
"Man, I'll be feeling those for a while" said Eton as he was sitting in his room. Karis had given him some pointers on how to wield a sword. It went without saying that Eton got beat up pretty well.

"So, enjoy your first day?" asked Myrrh as she walked into Eton's room. It was the first time she had seen him since dropping him off at school. Needless to say, Eton just glared at her.

"Yeah, no thanks to you dropping me off like that" he said, a little spitefully.

"Oh, you'll get over it. You got to meet some friends today right?" asked Myrrh with a smile. Eton frowned but answered her anyway.

He told her about meeting Ewol and Karis, as well as finding Lea. He told her about the school day, about how it was often boring with the lessons on demons and such like that. The astronomy part was interesting but that was it. Then, there was the Training Hall and the meeting with Etoile. Myrrh smiled as Eton told her about his request for her to train him as well as Karis' beatdown of him in the hall.

"Sounds like fun. Glad you made new friends" said Myrrh, a bright smile on her face. Eton blushed a bit and turned away.

"Well, that's great. I'll stil wait to wait a week until Etoile can start with me" said Eton. Then, Myrrh started smirking.

"So, Lea, Karis, and Etoile right? So who do you think is the cutest?" asked Myrrh, making Eton blush like crazy.

"W-What are you talking about?" asked Eton.

"Just answer" said Myrrrh, and Eton knew he wasn't getting out of it.

"Well, Etoile is more mature and kind of feels like an older sister. Karis is graceful and tomboyish, which has a certain charm. Guess she's like a pal. Lea is soft-spoken and friendly, kind of like a younger sister" Eton told her. Myrrh kept smirking.

"Hmm, I wonder if you'll still feel that way years from now" she smirked.

"What do you mean by that?" Eton glared at her. He still had 22 years of human experience to go back on in situations like this.

"Oh, nothing" said Myrrh, trying to wave it off. Eton was stil ticked with her but he decided to let it drop.

"Well, I hope my family is still doing well" said Eton.

"We probably won't know how they'll get out of this for a while so we'll have to wait. Now, let's have dinner" said Myrrh, trying to usher him out.

'I especially hope my siblings are ok' thought Eton as he walked out to have dinner with his mother.
1143111122111111111.title: Back home

11431111221111111111.content:
The very next day, Eton was back at school. Myrrh had dropped him off as usual and left, leaving him with Lea, who was waiting there for him.

"Everyone ignored me yesterday. They won't this time" said Eton with a sigh. Lea's face became filled with worry as she gently touched Eton's shoulder.

"It's ok. I-I'll be there with you" she said, trying to make hm feel better, but she stuttured as she said it. To her surprise, Eton laughed.

"Thanks Lea. It's nice to have you around" Eton said, making a massive blush appear on Lea's fair-skinned face. She looked down in embaressment and mumbled to herself.

"Anyway, let's go" said Eton, as he walked off and Lea followed him. Waiting at the entrance was Ewol and Karis, ready to start the day as well. Karis giggled at the bruises Eton still had that she inflicted on him.

"Well well, if it isn't the new kid" said a young male voice. The group turned to find that most of the kids were looking at them now. The boy approached them. The boy had short blonde hair.

"Conan, what are you doing here?" asked Ewol, crossing his arms as he said that.

"Not much reason. Just curious about the new kid here. We didn't do much yesterday. However, it's time for a chat" said Conan, walking up to Eton's face. "Hmm, you don't look like much. You sure you're the one who saved the princess?" said Conan, with a bit of arrogance in his voice.

"Of course he is,Conan. The transformation just made him like this" said Karis, trying to defend him. Conan smirked and lightly pushed Eton's shoulder.

"That so? Well, just so you know, it's kind of embaressing for a Misterian to be at least 10 years of age and not able to fly on his own" said Conan with a smirk, his group snickering behind him. Eton was a little mad at this guy, but someone else unexpectedly came up to his rescue.

"L-Leave him alone, Conan!" squeaked out Lea, to most people's surprise. Conan smirked again at Lea.

"Well well, little Miss Gloomy is actually defending someone. Didn't know you could actually talk that loud" sneered Conan, making Lea's face drop down in nervousness.

"Hey, why don't we give him a real welcome instead of one of yours, Conan" said a strawberry-blonde haired boy from the crowd. His clothes were light blue in color mostly.

"Mind your own business, Hal!" shouted Conan, annoyed at him for interrupting. However, another spoke up.

"Why don't you pick on someone else for a chage?" aksed a young girl with braided brown hair.

"You too Darcy?" asked Conan to Darcy. His fists were balled up in frustration. "Fine, whatever. Let's go. Class will start soon" said Conan, him and his group leaving through the hallway.
11431111221111111111.title: Confronting the Classmates

114311112211111111111.content:
"Sorry for that guy. He always lets his arrogance show around newer classmates" said Hal as he approached the group. He respectfully extended his hand and Eton met him for a nice handshake.

"Welcome. My name is Hallvurdar, but please call me Hal" said the boy. Eton smiled as he finally met a nice person at school.

"Glad to meet you. I'm Eton" said Eton with equal respect.

"So, you're the prince now? Maybe we should show more respect" wondered Hal. Eton immediately shot that down.

"No thanks. I don't need anyone standing on ceremony with me. Just treat me normally" requested Eton. Hal smiled and brought his hands back.

"Good enough for me. How about we head back to the classroom now?" he suggested, to everyone's agreement. They all started walking together, ignoring the continued muttering of the fellow kids.

"Trust me, I understand what humans go through" said Hal as they had a pleasant conversation. "Actually, I lived among them for a while" he continued, getting surprised looks from the group.

"Really? I never heard of that" said Karis, genuinely shocked for perhaps the first time. Lea was surprised too but said nothing.

"Yeah. I fell to Earth during a training lesson when I was 4 years old. I was found, loved, and protected by a human family. I was so young that I had actually forgotton where I came from, but they genuinely cared for me. They even hid the fact that I had wings from everyone else. They even tried searching for my real home. Eventually, when I was 9, my grandfather, another human who helped me, flew me through the skies and approached Skyaira. However, he suffered a heart attack and dies before the Valyries and Archangels could save me and him" said Hal, giving a short version of his past. This surprised everyone once again.

"Wow, he must have been a wonderful man" said Lea, finally speaking up. Hal nodded in agreement.

"He was. He's the only human to be buried on Misterian soil. I haven't seen the human family who raised me since, but they know I'm safe. I do plan to see them again sometime" said Hal, a little longing in his voice for those kind people. Eton smiled and gently placed a hand on Hal's shoulder.

"Don't worry. You'll see them again soon. We can even go with you if you'd like" said eton. Everyone with him nodded in agreement, making Hal smile.

"Thank you. I didn't think you'd be so kind to someone that you'd just met" said Hal with some surprise in his voice.

"You're a good person, I can tell. It's easy to get to know someone like that" said Eton.

"That it is. Well, story time aside, shall we?" suggested Hal to everyone's agreement. They kept walking until they reached the familiar room from the previous day and slowly made their way inside. Once they did, a young girl with waist-length red hair and bright hazell eyes jumped in front of the group. Her clothes consisted of a red and gold top with a white clasp on her left shoulder. She wore a skort that was a little different from the others. The skirt part was just as long, red in color with some frills on it. The leggins underneath were shorter and showed more of her legs but still covered her well enough. On her feet were red aubrun sandals that stopped at her ankles. Her figured was small and slim but with a certain charm to it.

'Wow, she's cute' thought Eton. Hearing his thought, Lea felt a pang of jealousy while Ewol and Hal nervously smiled, as if they had seen this before. Karis was holding in giggles.

"Hello new guy! I'm Runa! Pleased to meet you!" yelled the girl as she extended a hand and Eton shaked it. The girl, Runa, winked at Eton after that, making him blush. Hal couldn't take it anymore after that.

"Runi, stop it. We know you and your sister like to do this, but you're freaking him out. Leave the flirting to Runa" said Hal. Eton gasped and looked at 'Runa'. She smiled and her body slowly changed into a male form. The changes changed to a male style with the gold parts becoming black and the markings on the top changing.

"You caught me. Yoou don't miss a beat don't you?" asked Runi. Eton was still too stunned to talk at the moment.

"Nope. Can't you take it easy on the new guy?" asked Karis. Runi just chuckled. soon enough, a girl that looked just like what Runi looked like showed up and gave a genuine smile.

"Hello, I'm Runa. Sorry if my brother freaked you out there. He's pretty good at mimicing me isn't he? Of course, I'm just as good as he is with his form" said Runa, making Runi laugh again.

'What is up with these people?' thought Eton as he sighed.
114311112211111111111.title: An Interesting Cast

1143111122111111111111.content:
After meeting Runi and Runa and being properly introduced, Eton looked to his friends in confusion.

"So, what's up with these guys?" asked Eton. Hal spoke up.

"As you can tell, Runi and Runa are twins. They also have similar build sizes and interests. They have a special magic between them which they can use to swap eachother's looks and gender. They use this to play pranks on everyone, especially the teacher" said Hal, to the smirking faces of the mentioned twins.

"Yep, that's the sum of it. Sorry if I overdid it on the flirting though. Your expression was priceless!" said Runi, still cracking up over how Eton was so convinced that he was a girl.

"Whatever" said Eton, not really in the mood to extend this conversation.

"Are we having a pleasant conversation here?" asked a female voice from behind them. It was a woman that was dressed rather well and carried an air of authority, as one would expect from a teacher.

"Hi mom" said Hal to the teacher, who was in fact his mother Trinity. She looked a lot like Hal himself, except obviously being a woman.

"Hello Mrs. Trinity" said Karis, respectfully. Trinity smiled and looked at the group.

"I see you've met Runi and Runa. Did he prank you with appearing as his sister?" asked Trinity. Eton didn't respond but his face told the whole story, making Trinity smile but shake her head.

"Well, don't let it get to you. They've fooled many" she said before walking to the front of the class, the twins smirking at her accusations.

"Guess there's more to magic than I thought" said Eton. Ewol came up to him.

"Oh, there's plenty of uses for magic, and certainly many uniqye kinds. You've only scratched the surface" said Ewol, making Eton sigh at whatever wierdness he would encounter next.

"Don't worry. We'll take it easy around you. We just like to see people's reaction when they find out for the first time" said Runa.

"I see" said Eton before Trinity started calling everyone, as class was ready to begin for the day.
1143111122111111111111.title: Meeting the Switching Twins

choices: To the Surface again (A day later)
11431111221111111111111.content:
A week had now passed since Eton met new friends at school.

At the sunrise of the new Monday, Minerva looked down onto the world in worry. There was one thing about the human world at the moment that deeply worried her. Eton's human sister: Nicole. Not many knew of who Nicole really was: a fallen Misterian child who fell to Earth during an accident. Minerva had long confirmed that Nicole was indeed the child that disappeared those many years ago when Eton told her the story of how his family adopted Nicole. She remembered a few days earlier, when Nicole's angel mother, Pallas, was informed.

'4 Days Earler'

"You wanted to see me, your highness?" asked a young girl who entered the chambers. Despite a very teenage-like appearance, his woman was Pallas, a centuries-old Misterian who was going through a rough time. Her mate had succombed to injuries from a demon attack, and her young daughter was lost to the Earth.

"Yes Pallas. Please come in. I have something that I need to tell you" said Minerva as she motioned for Pallas to come closer. Pallas acknowledged and walked closer to the queen, who was looking at some kind of crystal ball. Then, she continued, "After hearing Eton's story about his family, I've been observing them. I think one person you will find most interesting". After she said that, Pallas' face became that of confusion. Then, an image appeared, showing the Walker family at home at the moment. When the ball focused on Nicole, Pallas' eyes widened in shock!

"Aria?! Is that my little girl?!" Pallas almost screamed. Minerva motioned for her to calm down a bit, but nodded. Pallas' eyes watered in joy at the thought that her dear daughter was alive, something she didn't believe was possible after all this time.

'Present Time'

Now, Minerva watched with worry over Nicole. She had told Pallas that they would need to wait to see if anything could be done to bring Aria back. However, what worried her was Nicole's condition. Starting with her nightmare after James' death, Nicole's health seemed to have gotten worse. The bad dreams plauged her almost every night, and her face always seemed to be a ghostly pale. However, that wasn't the worse part. The dreama were starting to affect Nicole's sanity. In contrast to the bright and cheerly girl she usually was, she had become much more irritable, and caused disturbances in her Kindergarten class. Nobody wanted to be around her now, some even began to theorize that she was begin possessed by some fell force. Minerva knew that James' death, as well as his transformation into a Misterian, was traumatizing the poor girl's mind.

Messages from Keme, a Misterian woman who was disguiesed as a policewoman in Los Angeles, gave her regular updates on Nicole and the family as a whole.

"This cannot go on. Nicole could end up commiting suicide is this keeps up" said Minerva as she kept observing. Something had to be done. Without another thought, she sent a mental message to Pallas, requiring her presence immediately. It only took a few minutes for Pallas to arrive.

"You called, my queen?" asked Pallas in her usual politeness.

"Yes, I did. We have things to discuss regarding your daughter" said Minerva, causing Pallas' face to pale. She almost broke down crying as she saw what Nicole was going through.

"Please my queen! Let's bring her back as soon as possible. Here, we can properly treat her and she can see her brother again!" pleaded Pallas, ever egaer to be reunited with her daughter. Minerva shook her head sadly however.

"That would not be wise at the moment. What Nicole, or Aria, needs is not that. We need to help her mental instability, not further it by bringing her to a world she doesn not recognize. She can continue living down there, but we do need to do something to calm her down. The poor girl is bordering on insanity" said Minerva, causing Pallas to become more worried.

"What shall we do?" asked Pallas. Minerva thought for a minute, wondering what to do. Then, her eyes widened as a light bulb went off in her head.

"Pallas, I have a proposal for you"
11431111221111111111111.title: Observing (Back to Nicole's story)

114311112211111111111111.content:
While Minerva discussed her proposal to Pallas, Eton was in the Training Hall. He clashed swords with Etolie as she giggled at his efforts. "You are showing some improvement, young Eton." she said, smiling. she then hit him on the rear with the flat side of her sword, causing him to yelp. "You still need to watch your left side, though."

Eton moaned then gave a slight grin before waving Etolie forward. She returned his grin then suddenly threw her sword at him, something he did not expect. Eton screamed and threw his sword up to block it. The two swords made contact and he managed to knock it to the side. It was not until then, Eton realized that throwing the sword was a distraction as the flat side of a smaller blade made painful contact with his rear from behind. "Never take your eyes off an opponent, no matter what they do." instructed Etolie, seriously. "Demons are full of tricks and they will use them all to kill you."

"Point taken." said Eton, shaking. "Here's mine."

Without warning, he swung his foot around, tripping Etolie with the intention of taking her by surprise only Etolie brought out her wings and used them to push herself back on balance and pushed Eton in return, causing him to stumble a little. "That might have worked against a Gaian." she said. "However, we Misterians have wings we can use to keep ourselves balanced in any fight."

"Gaian?" asked Eton, confused.

Etolie sighed. "They are a race of barbaric shape shifting beings from another world." she explained. "They live in their spacecrafts deep under the ocean." she gave a low chuckle. "They are not exactly the friendly type."

"Okay...." said Eton, slowly. "Are they our allies, our enemies?"

"Neither." replied Etolie. "We leave them in peace they leave us in peace." she paused, looking at me. "There are other races on this world, other than human. Care to learn more?"

Eton nodded.
114311112211111111111111.title: The First Lesson with Etoile

1143111122111111111111112.content:
"Whew. What a workout!" said an exhausted Eton as he wiped his face with a towel. It had been quite an ordeal, going through Etoile's training session. She was no slouch, that was for sure! She was more effective than his gym teachers back on Earth.

"Um, excuse me" said a small female voice. Eton looked to the side to see a young female Misterian staring at him. It was Pallas, not that he knew that though, not having met her before.

"Who are you?" asked Eton.

"My name is Pallas. I'm a good friend of Queen Minerva and one of the teachers at the school. It's a pleasure to finally meet the boy who saved the princess" said Pallas with a grateful smile, making Eton blush a bit.

"Well, it was nothing" said Eton, trying to dismiss it. This made Pallas giggle. Eton then took a good look at the girl. She looked very small for a grown-up Misterian. Eton knew that she had to be centuries-old but she didn't look any older than a high school sophmore, maybe even a freshman. Apparently, Pallas had some idea of what he was thinking.

"Yes, I'm aware of my rather young appearance, even for my age. That's what happens when you stop aging after reaching adulthood. You get stuck at however you looked" explained Pallas. Eton nodded in understanding.

"So, why are you here?" asked Eton. Pallas' face went a little red and she fidgeting a bit.

"Well, can you tell me more of your sister, Nicole? Like, what kind of girl has she become?" asked Pallas, to Eton's surprise. Eton imagined that she heard of Nicole from Minerva, but why was she interested?

"Why do you ask? It's not like you personally know her or anything, right?" asked Eton,making Pallas figet a bit more.

"Well....um....that is...well" mumbled Pallas, unable to form a coherent sentence, making Eton wonder if she was alright. Soon enough, she straightned her words up. "Well, sometimes, rebirthed Misterians suffer some memeory lapses so I wanted to make sure that you didn't forget anything about your human life. Also, Minerva told me about what you said about her and I'm curious" stated Pallas. Eton still couldn't grasp why she would care, but he didn't see any harm in telling her. He figured that Pallas looked trustworthy enough.

"Well, no harm in telling you. She's a great kid" said Eton. Pallas instantly felt more relieved and gently smiled.

"Really?" she asked.

"Yeah. I would always play with her the most when we had spare time. She's really gentle but not afraid to stand up for somebody. Sometimes, she had stood up in defense of others when they're being bullied. Unfortunately, she would always end up in the nurse's office when she did that, but she won't stop doing it. She's pretty much your regular tomboy, wanting to do things like wrestling in the house, or tossing a ball around outside. I think she actually wants to join a sport when she grows up more" explained Eton.

Pallas felt calmness in her heart for the first time in a while. Despite not being able to be there for Nicole, she was happy to hear Nicole was still living a peaceful life and was growing into a kind-hearted young lady.

"Thank you, young prince" said Pallas, as she turned around and flew off in the direction of the castle. Eton couldn't help but notice how bright her wings were as she left, as if she was feeling a very strong emotion at the moment.

"I wonder what it could be" wondered Eton to himself.
1143111122111111111111112.title: Talk with Pallas

11431111221111111111111121.content:
Something seared Eton's left ear, causing it to burn with with agony. It didn't feel like anything ordinary. Well, not that anything here was 'ordinary', just that... the sensation it invoked in him was numbing. And worst still, it was spreading to the rest of his limbs.

"Etolie!" He called out anxiously. "Something..." Bright lavender tinted his wings.

His instructor was faster than ever. One second she was gliding above him, and the next, she had swooped into the shadows, like a hawk after its prey, closing in for the kill. What was she doing?

"Oh gosh, Karis!" Etolie exclaimed with shock. "What..." she trailed off. "By the black blood of the Demons! What are you doing with a Male bow?"

"I apologise," was all Karis replied calmly. "I..."

"You shot that, did you now?" Etolie demanded.

"It was by mistake, Etolie," Karis explained quietly. "It was an intended prank. It was not supposed to hit Eton."

Eton found the numbness in him slowly wearing off. Finally. That was creepy. Gingerly, he made his way towards the conversing pair, wondering what was going on.

"Karis!" Etolie shook her head in disapproval. "Those arrows cause paralysis! They are dangerous! Tell me, where did you obtain that from?"

Eton looked from one person to another, puzzling over the so-called dangerous arrows. "What?"

"Eton," Etolie finally acknowledged him gently. "Are you alright?"

"Better than ever. What's going on?"

Both Etolie and Karis heaved an apparent sigh of relief, before Karis's wings turned a shade of pink. Though her face kept up the 'cool' facade, she obviously was embarrassed. Those burning purple eyes of hers had suddenly turned downcast as well. Okay, this was suspicious.

"Err... Karis?" Eton asked, concerned. "You're the one that looks far from alright."

"I..." Karis hesitated. "I took Conan's bow and arrows."

"Took?" Etolie asked, her voice gentler now. "Why?"

Karis shrugged, he purple eyes calmer now. "He always acts like a jerk," she reasoned. "He was boasting over his new set of bow and arrows. And then he went around threatening to shoot the lot of us."

"What?" Eton asked, definitely shocked now. "How can he?"

Etolie shook her head, "No, he cannot. It is against the laws for one Misterian to lay hands on the other."

Karis was clearly upset, but she didn't look anything but composed. "He. Was. Acting. Like. A. Jerk," Karis stated. "So what if he is the son of a great Archangel? I am too! And you know what? He gets a Misterian-made bow, and what do I get, nothing!"

"It is extraordinary for him to possess such a thing. He really shouldn't have it until his coming of age. It is customary for males to get one at that age" Etolie explained

"And females?" Karis asked collectedly, but with traces of contempt. "I am by far a better fighter than him! I trained more than him as well!"

Eton had to agree with Karis. She was most convincing. And it sounded more than reasonable. Conan was nothing than a great bully, while Karis was the true warrior here, female or not. She had trained hard for it, and was definitely more deserving.

"I agree with Karis," Eton said. "Conan doesn't deserve even half an arrow."

Karis shot him a wane smile, before looking back to Etolie seriously. "See?" she pointed out, her wings turning crimson red. "Conan is an undeserving-"

"Karis, Eton," Etolie cut in with a sigh. "Perhaps you are right, but the bow and arrows still rightly belong to Conan."

"Of course," Karis agreed rationally. "I mean to take this back to him, after teaching him a lesson."

Etolie smiled at this. "Good. Once you are done," she gestured towards Karis and Eton. "I have a surprise for you."

Eton clearly understood what Etolie was getting at, and so did Karis. Of course, to comfort them, she was planning on presenting a weapon to them. Or at least he thought she was. Etolie was their fighting instructor after all. What better sort of present was there than a weapon?

He wondered what sort of weapon it could be then.

Karis lips tugged upwards at this piece of news, before she stood to her feet quickly, with the bow still at hand.

"Please let it be a Mysterian sword," she said, her purple eyes ablazed with excitement. "I would be most overjoyed."

"Then, be overjoyed," Etolie replied, a smile forming over her attractive features. "Because yes, it is a sword. Either feathered or metallic. Up to you two."

Karis's wings turned white with pure happiness, while Etolie began to wonder what a 'feathered' one meant. Surely, the sword could not be made out of feathers right? What good would it do to have a feathered sword?

Reading Eton's mind, both Karis and Etolie laughed outright, their wings both turning different hues of the same colours. Eton only stood there, blushing with embarrassment.

"No," Karis explained between laughter. "a 'feathered' swords means the sword was created from an adult male's features. They are truly amazing!"

"An adult male's...?"

"Yes," Etolie agreed. "Male wings contain a hardening agent- which explains why they are stronger than steel."

"So... wow," Eton murmured in awe. "That is so... cool."

Etolie nodded, still smiling. "Technically, you are still too young to wield a weapon, but I, as instructor have seen you fight, and I must say, you are not bad. So, I will allow you to choose a sword which would probably last you another hundred full-rots. Do choose wisely."

"Thank you, Etolie," Karis and Eton said gratefully, before Karis spread her pure white wings and took off with the bow, eager to return it to Connan.

This was all truly amazing, but Eton wondered what sort of sword to choose: Metal or 'feathered'? He had a feeling that it was going to make a difference some day.
11431111221111111111111121.title: Karis appears

11431111221111111111111122.content:
The sun flowed into through Nicole's window as Tuesday had arrived.

"Another day" said Nicole, rather emotionless in her voice. The last few days had taken a huge toll on the young girl's mind. Her face was as pale as ever and she looked very sickly. However, the biggest difference was her behavior. The poor girl's sanity had taken a huge hit. Nowadays, she almost claimed that she could see wierd visions and see people that weren't there.

Needless to say, most people had taken to staying away from her since the change.

Nicole got up and did her usual routine, taking her bath, and putting her clothes on. Today, she wore a violet t-shirt that was covered under a blue zip-up sweater. Other than that, she wore normal blue jeans and white and grey shoes. When she was done with that, she walked downstairs, barely speaking any words.

The rest of the Walker family was greatly concerned for her. It was hard enough with James' passing, and now Nicole was acting out of character. They did take her for a doctor's appointment but it yielded no results. No one knew what was wrong with her.

"Um, morning Nicole" said Trevor, trying to cheer her up. Nicole almost glared at him and he shuddered back. Their mom and dad looked on sadly at the scene. There weren't many more words shared that morning.

Anyway, after breakfast, Nicole walked with Trevor to the bus stop and waited there. As stated before, most of the students now didn't really talk to Nicole, afraid that she might lash out at them or start seeing wierd visions or something like that.

Nicole sat by herself on the bus, oblivious to the mutterings around her. She didn't care. All she thought about was her confusing thoughts. Her head still felt as dark as it was last week and not getting any better. The darkness was driving her crazy.

'Why is this happening? Why does nothing make sense anymore? All the things I'm seeing make no sense' thought Nicole, not knowing how things would change soon enough.

Minutes later, Nicole was sitting in her Kindergarten classroom. The classmates continued to mutter about her. Eventually, the teacher came in.

"Good morning to you all. Today, I'd like to introduce a new student" said the teacher. More mutterins overcame the classroom. Nicole found herself wondering why there would be a new student at this time of the semester.

"She's a little quiet so please give her a warm welcome. You can come in" said the teacher. In walked a girl about Nicole's age. She walked in and looked the classmates, allowing them to observe her. She had waist-length brown hair that was partially covered by a green and white baseball hat that she wore normally. She wore a pale green t-shirt with light brown shorts that went to just above her knees. On her feet, she wore simple grey sneakers and white socks. What seemed to catch Nicole's attention however, were her green eyes, which seemed to be somewhat similar to her own.

"Hello. My name is Paula Wilson" said the girl in a soft voice.
11431111221111111111111122.title: Nicole's New Day

114311112211111111111111221.content:
The moment Paula Wilson's introduction was completed, the girl's electric green eyes had unnerving flickered to Nicole. It wasn't a very apparent movement, but Nicole had been alert enough to notice that glance. The girl was studying her... Studying her? That was creepy.

And then, a miracle happened. Paula looked up, gazed into Nicole's green eyes, and smiled.

That smile... melted Nicole. It was smile which offered so many things at one go. Friendship. Solace. Help. Happiness. And... Love.

And Nicole did something she hadn't done in a long time. She simply returned the smile.

"Paula Wilson, as you might have heard," The girl nodded towards her, still smiling. "Hello... Nicole."

She knew her name! Nicole thought. How did that girl know..?

And as though reading Nicole's thoughts, the girl giggled abruptly. "I have known you for a.. very long time."

Nicole gaped. So now the girl could read her thoughts as well! What couldn't she do?

"Known... me?" Nicole asked, freaked out now.

The girl grinned sheepishly. "No, I mean- what was I saying?"

"You said you've known me for a very long time!" Nicole accused playfully.

"Errr... I looked at the attendance list you see..." The girl bit her lip. "Yes, that's why."

"Gosh!" Nicole laugh felt unused. "You freaked me out, Paula! I thought... Oh nevermind..."

"You thought?" Paula pressed on curiously.

I thought this was another nightmare, Nicole thought to herself. With scary winged people all around.

"No," Paula said gently, scaring Nicole once more. "This is reality. It is fine."

This Paula was very... strange at times. It almost seemed as if Paula could read Nicole's mind. She could reach to the roots of her fear and comfort her somehow. But Nicole didn't mind. Paula had cheered her up. She had been the first person to coax her into laughing this week. She had driven the darkness away.

Unconsciously, Nicole felt alive once more. She felt... herself.

And at the same time, amid that happiness, she felt an urge to do something.

Hello Paula, Nicole thought, half hoping for a reply. Can you hear me?

Silence. Some sort of hesitation. Some sort of uncertainty. Yes, Nicole, I can.

Nicole couldn't believe her ears! So they could talk... in their mind? Wow! That was amazing! Both girls stared at each other for a long moment, before Nicole broke into a grin once more. She had made up her mind. She had made up her mind about Paula.

Paula? Nicole called out hopefully. Will you be my friend forever?

Forever, meant forever. It sounded simple, but it a great promise. A promise to stay by her side for all eternity.

Paula's eyes widened at the word 'Forever'. After all, how could Paula, a true Misterian remain on Earth forever? Yes, Nicole was her daughter. But if that was the case, shouldn't she be telling her the truth? Shouldn't both of them be heading back to their true domain and living happily ever after?

But Nicole may not want that... How should Paula reply?
114311112211111111111111221.title: A New Girl

114311112211111111111111222.content:
As Nicole observed the new girl, she felt something odd within herself. After seeing the girl's electric green eyes that reminded her of her own, it got Nicole thinking as to just who this girl was.

'Who is she? Why does she kind of look like me?' thought Nicole, the questions endlessly swirling in her head. If this went on, she'd go even more crazy than she already was.

Paula observed the class and set her eyes on Nicole near the back. By now, Nicole had hung her head down, trying to figure out that she was thinking about. Paula sighed to herself.

'I've only been on Earth for a little while and my presence may be making her feel worse. Her mind seemed so clouded and it's as if there are many walls surrounding it. As much as I'm glad to finally see her, I don't know if Minerva thought this out' thought Paula. In reality, the girl was Pallas, disguised as a young human girl thanks to Minerva.

***A couple days earlier***

"You mean that I should go down there and help Aria?" asked Pallas. Minerva had explained her proposal. It was for Minerva to use her royal magic to turn Pallas into a 6-year old human girl. She would still have a little magic with her, and thus still be part-Misterian.

"I feel that, with your presence, you may be able to calm Aria down and clear her mind. Besides, this way, you can finally meet your daughter after so many years" explained Minerva. Pallas loved the idea, although she was still anxious about all this. She'd have to come up with a backstory and fit in with humans, something she had never done.

"Guess you better get studying on humans then" smirked Minerva after reading Pallas' thoughts, making her blush.

***Present Day***

"She really has grown though" muttered Paula with a smile, glad to see that Nicole was at least somewhat healthy.

"All right Paula, you can use the empty seat next to Nicole" said the teacher. Paula thanked him and walked to the back of the class. As she walked, both she and Nicole heard the class mutter.

"They look like sisters" said a random student, making both girls blush. Soon enough, Paula sat down in her seat.

"Hello, I'm Paula. Then again, I guess you already know that, right?" said Paula, giving a small laugh as she did. It was nice and sweet as befitted her appearance.

"Hi" said Nicole and she left it at that, making Paula sigh.

'This might be harder than I thought. However, I can't let her down. How can I call myself her mother if I don't?' thought Paula, trying to keep her spirits up.
114311112211111111111111222.title: Reaction to the News

1143111122111111111111112222.content:
It had been a couple of days since Eton's training with Etoile had started. He was becoming more adept using the sword, although he still had much to learn. It was hard for him to embrace the fact that it would probably take years for him to perfect the sword and shield style Etoile was teaching him.

"This is tiring" he said after drying himself with a towel. He had just finished another session with her. Etoile was giggling a few feet from him.

"For one that used to be 22 years old, you are quite childish" said Etoile, continuing to giggle. Eton's wings flushed pink as his face did the same.

"It's just my new age affecting me. I'm just a bit more like how I was as a kid" said Eton, defending himself. Etoile continued to smile sweetly at him.

"Of course" she said. Suddenly, a visitor approached.

"Oh, hello Eton. Still going at it?" asked Karis, approaching the area where they were resting. Karis had taken a huge interest in Eton's training, wondering how far he would go. Everyone wondered weather Eton would consider becoming an Archangel if he got good enough. Internally, it was something Karis hoped for.

"We just finished for today" said Etoile. Karis came over and they began having some small conversation. Eventually, Ewol and Lea joined along, having been searching for Eton to talk with him.

"Well Eton, I'd say that we're done for today. Keep working on what I've show you, ok?" she requested, getting a nod from Eton. She smiled again before flying off, getting back to other things she needed to do.

"Seems like you're always getting quite a workout thanks to her, huh?" asked Ewol, giving Eton a small pat on the back. Eton nodded slowly.

"Yeah, it's hard work but I think it'll be worth it" said Eton. As Eton continued to dry himself off, Ewol broke off to talk with Lea for a bit. However, Eton and Karis could overhear them.

"So, you hear the rumors of what's happening under the ocean?" asked Lea.

"Yeah, that supposedly there's a new princess in the Kingdom of Olympia? It's said that she was a rebirthed human but no one knows for sure. Aquarian news doesn't travel well up here" said Ewol, getting a nod from Lea. Eton looked confused as he listened on. What's an Aquarian?

"Um, guys, what's an Aquarian?" asked Eton. Karis looked over to him as the group rejoined together.

"Oh right, you haven't been told much of the other races, right?" asked Karis.

"Well, I think Etoile told me a bit of this race called Gaians, but that's it" said Eton. Karis nodded.

"Hopefully, she told you to stay away from them. Those guys are bad news all around. Anyway, Aquarians are merpeople" said Karis, causing Eton's eyes to widen.

"Merpeople?" asked Eton.

"Yep, half-fish and everything" confirmed Ewol. Then he continued, "They have their own cities in the ocean and have their own barriers like us. They also possess their own telepathy. We're not on good terms with them though".

"Why not?" asked Eton.

"Well, we don't quite see eye-to-eye regarding humans. We Misterians like humans. We think they're interesting and fun to watch" said Karis.

"I thought you guys pitied them" said Eton.

"That too. Mostly because they're young and unevolved. Also, they don't get to experience the freedom of flight like us. Other than that, we don't have a problem with humans, despite their pollution issues. Luckily, that doesn't hurt us much. Our skin offers stronger sun protection so the burning of the Ozone layer isn't a huge problem" explained Karis. Eton was surprised to hear most of that, although the pollution part didn't surprise him.

"And the Aquarians?" he asked.

"Well, the Aquarians don't like humans nearly as much as we do. They often persecute them because they don't like how they often trash the oceans" said Karis.

"Sounds like a good reason" said Eton.

"Maybe, but they could do more to help instead of simply hating humans. Aqurians are a little more old-fashioned than us as well. They preserve their old traditions, since they're even older than the Greeks. We tend to go more with the flow, adapting new customs every now and then. That's why we don't see eye-to-eye on this. We're not at war or anything like that. However, don't expect a warm welcome if you decide to go there" explained Karis.

"Wow, that's quite a story" said Eton.

"Not only that, because we care more about the humans, the Aquarians often put is in the same breath as them. They think of humans as "young and child-like" and they refer to us in the same way because of how we are sympathetic with them. It's insulting and they don't take us very seriously because of it. Our two races are almost similar in age!" continued Karis, almost becoming a rant. Eton believed every word of it.

"Anyway, I don't recommend you go near an Aquarian. Besides, we don't really like swimming" said Ewol. Eton instantly agreed with them.

"Now that I agree with. Even though I lived by the ocean, I can't swim. I'm too afraid of the water to do so" said Eton. Then, Lea finally spoke up.

"Really? I think it might be fun to learn how to swim sometime" she said with her usual small smile.

"Well, maybe it'll happen" said Ewol, leaving that there are endless possibilities.
1143111122111111111111112222.title: Back in the Air

11431111221111111111111122221.content:
Later that day, Eton was flying home with Myrrh through the skies. Over the last few days, Eton's flying skills had tremendously improved. He still needed a little help with mobility and such, but he could now fly short distances with no help. However, Myrrh was currently helping him fly.

"You're getting much better" said Myrrh, with a proud smile.

"Thanks, Myrrh" said Eton.

"You know, you really should start calling me "Mother" or something like that" Myrrh lightly scolded him.

"Might not happen" said Eton with a smirk, which in turn made Myrrh smile.

"Well, might be best. Being called "Mother" might make me sound old anyway" said Myrrh, which made both of them laugh. Then, Eton got to a question that had been nagging him for a while.

"So Myrrh, what is a Gaian really? Etoile told me a little but I want to know more" he asked. Myrrh's smile fell and she sighed a bit.

"Very well then. They are not of this world like we are" said Myrrh.

"Huh?" Eton asked.

"They are from another world. Supposedly, they ended up destroying their own world by accident and came to this one. They live under the ground in the oceans" explained Myrrh.

"What did they do to their world?" asked Eton.

"They destroyed it, kind of like how humans currently treat the world. They strived for power and prosperity but it destroyed their world" said Myrrh.

"Wow" said Eton.

"Anyway, they're a barbaric race. Their goal now is to oppress humans. They believe humans are destroying their world like they did to their own and they're trying to "stop" them. However, their vision of that is harsh and they won't stop until all humans are dead" said Myrrh.

"That's horrible. Since when did they become the authority on how to run a world?" said Eton with slight anger. Everything about this race seemed to anger him in some way. Myrrh nodded in approval.

"Exactly. Not only that, they have their own way of rebirthing someone. It's called "Absorption". It's not a painless experience like how you rebrith someone into a Misterian or Aquarian. Their methods are more brutal. They almost literally tear the skin of your body before scaly skin reforms over it. It's said to be a pain like nothing else" said Myrrh with a small bit of fear in her voice.

"That's even worse! Thanks for telling me this. Now I know what to do if I ever come across one" said Eton. Myrrh smiled.

"I'm glad that you understand. Guess I'm doing a good job of teaching you" said Myrrh, proudly.

"Well, you'll get the ultimate grounding from Minerva if you don't, so you better keep it up" said Eton with a laugh.

"Watch it, you little brat!" said Myrrh, although her giggling gave away her true intentions.

Mother and son laughed their way to the Sky Castle, eager for their awaiting dinner.
11431111221111111111111122221.title: Going Back Home

114311112211111111111111222212.content:
Friday had now come down in the human world.

Paula arrived at her desk, tired from the past week. She had attempted to get through to Nicole on several occassions.

*****4 Days Earlier (Monday)*****

"Why do you keep trying to stay with me?" asked Nicole. The two of them were sitting together at a lunch table. Nicole had only known Paula for a few hours and she knew that the girl wouldn't leave her alone.

"I wanted to talk to you. I'm sorry if I seem so...effusive. I just don't have any friends of my own" said Paula, trying to sell her backstory to Nicole and gain her trust.

"Why me? If you want a friend, go find someone else. I shouldn't be anyone's friend" said Nicole. Paula's heart almost broke at such words.

"Is this because of your brother's death?" asked Paula. Nicole looked at her.

"How would you know that?" asked Nicole.

"Because I heard it from one of our classmates. I know what it feels like" said Paula.

"Yeah right. How can anyone possibly understand what I'm going through" said Nicole with slight anger in her voice. Paula was even getting a little angry herself. She really needed to get through to the confused girl.

"Because I'm the same way. My big brother died in a car accident. Not only that, my little sister went missing years ago. My family was torn apart because of it" said Paula, stunning Nicole. It wasn't entirely false. Paula/Pallas had lost her husband years ago and her only daughter (Nicole) fell from Skyaira as well.

"I...I see" said Nicole, still stunned to hear that the new student had endured heartbreak of her own.

*****End Flashback*****

After that, Paula had gone to the apartment that she rented with a fellow Misterian, posing as a mother and daughter. The woman was Irene, who was a servant in the castle and was happy to assist the queen as well as Pallas. Pauls noted to Irene that Nicole had unknowingly placed many mental barriers around her fragile mind in defense. Breaking them wouldn't be easy.

*****2 Days Earlier (Wednesday)*****

Nicole didn't talk much with Paula on Tuesday. She was likely still digesting the information Pauls told her about her "life". Paula could tell that Nicole's fragile state wasn't handling it well, and it worried her greatly.

"Nicole, are you ok? You haven't spoken much" said Paula, as they were settling into class for the day.

"I'm fine. Just doing a lot of thinking" said Nicole.

"I see" said Paula, sighing that she wasn't making much progress. Then, Nicole surprised her a bit.

"I'm...sorry that I insulted you like that" said Nicole, a small smile appearing on her face. Paula smiled as well. Nicole finally showed a small piece of who she really was. However, it would still take more time for Paula to break through the barriers.

*****End Flashback*****

In addition to all this, Paula was finding the human world to be very interesting. She had no problems in class due to her already knowing the answers to such easy questions. Luckily, she was quite a good actress, and could try to struggle with some questions (which she would get right anyway). She found playing sports to be quite fun during recess. She particularly enjoyed soccer, which was a sport Nicole also played.

'Depending on how long I stay, maybe I could join her' thought Paula, thinking of anything to reach Nicole's inner mind. Another idea had come to her. She had her magic still, and she was thinking of using it to slowly heal Nicole. Nicole had told Paula of the "bone spurs" on her shoulder blades, which Paula knew were where her wings used to be. Paula wasn't sure if they would ever heal properly.

"Anything to try to get to her" muttered Paula to herself, as Nicole sat in her own seat.

"Morning" she said, still a bit emotionless.

"Good morning" replied Paula. It was time to set her plan in motion.
114311112211111111111111222212.title: Nicole and Paula's Week

1143111122111111111111112222121.content:
*The italics show when Paula uses Magic

It was really really hard to heal a person, yet keep them in the dark at the same time. After all, Paula had no intention of scaring Nicole by revealing her Misterian powers. That wouldn't help one bit.

Most physical injuries required physical contact for healing to prevail. But mind you, mental injuries were far different. They were a trillion times harder to heal. Yes, physical contact could be still used. But using physical contact would mean blowing her cover as an innocent girl. So physical contact was pretty much out of the question.

So Paula was left with words.

For healing mental injuries, one had to lace their words with healing magic - so that the words could penetrate the wall of isolation which the victim had built around their fragile minds.

It was easier said than done. You had to mean the words you sprout. Every last one of it.

Paula had tried it on Nicole three times during Math, five times during English, and four times during play time. She was utterly drained.

"Nicole," Paula had repeated gently - lacing her words with healing magic. "I'm your friend. If you need help, feel free to turn to me."

"Thank you," Nicole had replied, tone rather dead. Had she returned to her previous self?

"You can tell me anything."

"I know," Nicole had said shortly.

It didn't seem to be helping one bit. The only thing it seemed to be doing, was killing the already dead Nicole. Paula wondered how long it would take to come into effect.



Day after day, Paula tried it over and over again. It was tedious work. It required concentration... and passion. She had both, but still, the results remained fruitless. To get her healing degree in Skyaira, Paula had to pass the 'Healing Test' which included Mental Healing! Man, why couldn't she even heal her own daughter then?

"Paula," Nicole said finally one day. "I don't understand why... why you're still trying so hard to help me... You keep comforting me, but... I don't understand..."

"I'm your friend."

"If you are, you... I don't understand why!" Nicole said, shaking her head over and over again, looking confused.

"I've been through the same thing, I understand you," Paula whispered soothingly.

Nicole's lower lip trembled. "Maybe you do... But you can't help me..."

"But I will always be there for you."

Nicole stared through her. And for the first time, the corners of her lips twitched upwards. A slight motion, which only Misterian eyes could catch.

"Thank you," Nicole said soflty, before turning away.

"Hey," Paula had took her hand once more. "You know-"

"Don't," Nicole had ordered lightly. "I..." She trailed off, before before breaking from Paula's grip and racing off, uncertainty written on her features.

But at least there was a slight emotion present in her voice. A teeny weeny bit. But still, it was there. Somewhere under that emotionless facade of hers, a speck was slowly returning.

A small light in the sea of engulfing darkness.



Paula didn't know what had happened. One moment, Nicole had been sitting stoically on the 'roof' of the playground facility, well out of the playful children's way -who were playing a game of catch-, and the next, she had fallen off! With a thud, Nicole had hit the ground head first, blacking out upon contact.

The rest of their classmates had paused in the middle of their catching game, a few erupting in screams of horror.

"She's dead!" One of them yelled. "Dead!"

"Call Ms Martin!" The other screamed. "Hurry!"

Paula's eyed widened before she hurried down beside her daughter and friend.

"Nicole?" Paula called out urgently. "Nicole?!?!"

When she received no reply, Paula got down on all fours before checking out the girl's arms and legs for any serious injuries. There were a couple of bruises, and a few minor cuts, but other than that....

"Oh my...!" Paula exclaimed.

For on the underside of Nicole's arm, lay a large gaping gash the shape of a monster's mouth. Oh man! Nicole must have scraped herself against something sharp on the ground upon falling!

The gash was raw, and fresh blood oozed out from it.

Paula didn't think twice. She didn't think of the consequences of performing magic on a human; nor did she think of the punishments she might face. Instinctively, Paula's fingers had hovered over the open wound as it normally did, before letting her fingertips slowly run over it. The healing was evident at once. The blood dried up upon contact, before the wound gradually closed up, leaving a dark scar etched behind.

Scars were unhealable. Paula left it as it was, before looking down at her unconscious daughter lovingly.

"I love you," Paula said quietly, knowing Nicole was out cold. "Always."

She didn't have to use healing magic this time. It came naturally. The words were so strong that it would have broken through Nicole's impenetrable fortress if she'd been conscious.

Ms Martin, following the group of children, quickly arrived at the playground with her handy first aid kit - which probably wasn't necessary anymore.
1143111122111111111111112222121.title: Healing Nicole
