1143111122111111111111112222122.content:
Back in Skyaira, Ewol approached Eton with a thoughtful look on his face. "Eton, you once said that, as a human man, you had a good relationship with your siblings, right?" he asked. "I mean, you got a long well, despite the occasional fights..."

"Well, yeah, we were all very close." replied Eton, surprised by the question. "Why do you ask?"

Ewol's wings turned a slight shade of pink. "Lea is becoming... difficult." he replied. "Always thinking that she 'owes' me for saving her life. I just want to be her brother and she to be my sister, a family."

Eton nodded, understanding Ewol's concern. "You are a good brother to her, Ewol." he said, making his wings turn a brighter pink. "I'll talk to her today, maybe I can convince her to be more like a sister."

"I'd appreciate that." said Ewol. "I really like that Lea gives me all this attention but I need her to let me in so I can help her when she is sad or afraid or just doesn't know what to do, I want to be her brother."

"I understand, Ewol." said Eton. "I'll talk to her."

Ten minutes later, Eton found Lea at school and unexpectedly pulled her side. "Eton, what?" asked Lea, her wings a slight pink and red color.

"We need to talk, Lea." said Eton, firmly. "Ewol is hurt."

"What!?" asked Lea, her concern rising. "Who? How?"

"You are, by waiting on him hand and foot." you said, causing Lea's wings to turn blue. "Ewol wants to be there for you when you are sad or scared or hurt but he can't unless you let him in." He placed a hand onto Lea's narrow shoulder. "Ewol wants a sister, not a servant."

"Wha-What can I do?" asked Lea, sad that she had inadvertently hurt her brother. "I thought I was being a good sister to him."

"A good sister shares her fears, hopes, and dreams with her brother." replied Eton. "Of course, a sister always keeps somethings hidden, just to drive her brother crazy." he winked, causing Lea to giggle. "Tell Ewol how you feel, let him in so he can share his experiences with you and feel as if he is doing his job as your brother."

Lea, still shaken, slowly nodded. "I-I'll try." she said. "I can't change who I am, though."

"No one is asking you to change." said Eton, smiling. "Just... open up a little, that's all."

Lea's wings slowly turned from blue to a white color as she hugged Eton, causing his wings to turn pink. "Thank you for telling me this, Eton." she said. "I will talk to Ewol as soon as I can."

"Why not now?" asked Ewol, walking up to them. "School has been canceled for the day due to a demon sighting. We are all to go home immediately."

"Eton!?' came Myrrh's voice. "Eton, where are you!?"

"Here... mom." you said, with pink wings.

Myrrh approached and took your hand. "You've already had one experience with demons." she said, firmly. "I don't want you to have another one so soon."

Lea, remembering her talk with Eton, turned to Ewol. "I-I'm scared, Ewol" she said, true to her emotions.

Ewol wrapped a protective hand around her waist, happy that she was starting to open up to him. "Don't worry, I'll get us home fast." he said.

It was then that Myrrh whispered to Eton...

"Let's go....now" she said, silently, but urgently.

Once they were a ways from the school, Myrrh turned to Eton again.
1143111122111111111111112222122.title: Eton's Next Task

11431111221111111111111122221221.content:
"You can relax a little, Eton." giggled Myrrh. "the demon sighting was only a drill."

Eton pouted slightly. "Does that mean i have to go back to school?" he asked.

Myrrh laughed. "No, school is always canceled for the day so to allow parents to prepare their children for the time a demon is sighted for real." she explained. "You already know the threat they pose to us and to humans, otherwise you would have been left in the dark that it was a drill as well."

"I see." said Eton, remembering his experience with the possessed men. "So what do we do now, go home and sit around?"

"Not quite." said Myrrh with a smile. "I wish to show you something that you might find interesting."

"What's that?' asked Eton.

Myrrh giggled. "You'll see."

Eton, filled with curiosity, flew with Myrrh to a grand looking building that looked much like a Greek temple. Upon landing there, they were greeted by Etolie who stood with a tall muscular Misterian man behind her. "Greetings, Myrrh." said Etoile, politely. "What brings you to the changing pool?"

"Travel port?" asked Eton, confused.

Etoile, understanding, giggled. "I take it you want him to see our watery friends."

Myrrh shook her head. "Just the portal." she replied. "From what I heard from Minerva, the Aquarians are having issues with the Gaians. Now is not a good time to visit them."

The man nodded. "The princess is correct, I just returned from Aquarian territory, they had found a small Gaian boy who claims to have been banished, they had sent an envoy to confirm the boy's claims when I took the return trip."

"Thank you, Taurus." said Etoile. she turned to Eton. "This is our current ambassador to the Aquarians, Taurus."

"It's an honor to meet you, Taurus." said Eton with a slight bow.

"The honor is mine, prince Eton." said Taurus. "If you'd like, I will take you to the portal."

Myrrh nodded and Taurus led them inside to a massive room with constantly changing images on the walls an ceilings, much like what Eton saw in the palace. Seeing his expression, Myrrh smiled. "These images you see are what is happening in the three worlds we may visit." she explained. "though we do not like to travel to Gaian territory, we must keep the option open in case we encounter an enemy they are familiar with."

"The enemy of my enemy is my friend." said Eton, quoting a human phrase.

"Well put, Eton." said Etolie, impressed. "However, the Gaians are not our enemies or our friends. They are merely a people we try to avoid."

Moving on, Eton then saw a large round pool with a greenish energy rising from it. Standing around the pool were a number of heavily armed Valkyrie and Archangels, all keeping a sharp eye on the changing images, while keeping an ear towards the pool. "This is the changing pool." said Taurus. "By merely submerging into its waters, you and your surroundings are changed. The change in body and surroundings all depend upon where you wish to be." he then smiled, adding, "If you do not think of a specific place, the pool sends you at random so do keep your wits about you when to enter."

"I'll keep that in mind." said Eton, eying the pool.

Then, the guards stood at attention as they saw a small boy with scaly skin fall into what looked like another changing pool somewhere else. "Taurus, we have a visitor coming from Kraken!" announced one Valkyrie, pointing to an image, frozen on the wall. "His body is shifting genders as well as species, I can only surmise that this is an accidental visit."

Taurus sighed before letting out a low chuckle. "It's the boy who thought he had been banished." he said. "He is certainly not having the best of days."

Etoile giggled. "Send word to the Gaians, we will return their lost child once his body recovers from the transformation." she said. "The poor boy is going to be in for a surprise when he arrives."

"Can I watch?" asked Eton, wanting to see a Gaian up close.

Both Etoile and Myrrh replied "No." before Myrrh lead him out.

Seconds later, a very frightened and confused Misterian girl appeared with tears in her eyes. "Wha-What happened!?" she asked, hysterical. "Where am I!?" she looked down, feeling a draft, and screamed. "Why am I girl!?" she then began to cry as she screamed, "Where are my clothes!?"

The guards all stifled a laugh as Etolie approached the girl, smiling. "Who dares to trespass upon Misterian soil?"

"Um... I guess that would be me." said the girl, terrified. "I'm sorry. My name is Coy, I come from the Gaian city of Kraken." gaining some courage, she then asked, Can-Can you send me back, I-I seemed to have lost my gender and clothes on my way here."

Again, the guards a laugh as Etoile shook her head. "You will have to wait until your body adjusts to the changes before we can do that, young lady." she replied with a giggle. "If you will follow me, I will find you some appropriate clothing and take you to the queen, she will decide what to do with you until you can be returned home."

Uncertain, Coy took Etoile's hand and allowed her to lead the way out of the strange building. Etoile struggled not to giggle as she heard her inwardly moan, thinking, "Why me?"
11431111221111111111111122221221.title: The demon sighting is only a drill.

Etoile smiled gently at Coy, sensing how frightened and nervous she was. "First of all, I am Etoile, a combat instructor." she said, kindly. "Secondly, allow me to welcome you to Skyaira."

"Thank you... Etoile." said Coy, still very nervous and blushing brightly. "I am sorry to insist but... I'm naked."

Etoile giggled. "This way, please."

Coy followed Etoile into a small room off the main chamber where an assortment of clothing was stored. "This is where visiting Gaians and Aquarians are given clothing to wear when they visit." explained Etoile. "Normally, we would have the clothing ready for our guest but as your visit was accidental, we had no time to properly prepare for your arrival."

Etoile smiled, amused by Joy's innocence. "Anything is possible, Joy." she replied. "Shall we?"

Joy nodded then followed Etoile out of the building to the edge of the floating island. There was a certain awe in her eyes as she saw all the other floating continents in the distance. "Your world is amazing!" she said, looking around. "When does the first shuttle come?'

Joy immediately panicked. "I-I can't fly!" she protested, not yet discovering her wings. "If-If I jump off of this floating island, I-I'll fall for sure!"

114311112211111111111111222212211.title: Coy and "Joy"

1143111122111111111111112222122111.content:
"Woah!" yelled Joy as Etoile's tickling of her wings caused her to lose her balance. Unfortunately, they were standing at the edge of the small landmass so....

"AAAAAAAAAH!!!!!" screamed Joy as she began plummeting through the sky and towards the surface.

"Hmm, maybe I should have planned that out better" said Etoile, nochalantly. She was just about to fly down and rescue the poor girl. However, just as she was about to, she caught something, or rather someone, flying towards Joy. Etoile was confused as to who it was at first. However, her sharper eyes soon caught who.

It was Eton!

*****A few minutes earlier******

"Well, catch you later today. We've got some chores around the house" said Lea. She, Karis, and Ewol had met Eton a little later after the "demon attack" drill and talked for a bit. Eton was still a bit dissappointed that he couldn't see what happened in the portal room. He expressed that to his friends, who sympathsized with him. However, Ewol and Lea now had some chores to get done before the weekend started (it was Friday today).

"Later" said Eton as he watched Lea pull Ewol away. He smiled to himself. Lea was going to try and be a better sister to Ewol, although he was unsure how she would handle it. He could hope that she didn't go overboard.

"So, now what?" asked Eton to himself. Myrrh was away on errands so he was on his own. Luckily, he could fly much better now, so he could get from place to place. He was still far from perfect though.

Suddenly, he heard a scream from a nearby landmass.

"What was that?" he asked himself as he turned the attention towards the noise. His hearing was improved as a Misterian, so that's how he heard it. He ran aways until he spotted a small figure falling from the landmass. Eton figured that it was another young Misterian getting a flight lesson for the first time. However, it struck him as odd that the figure seemed to be similarly sized to him. Also, that figure that screaming and was making very little effort to fly. He couldn't tell if it was male or female, but the scream sounded feminine.

"Oh no! She's not flying at all! Should I..." Eton wondered to himself. Should he interfere? Maybe this was the lesson that the girl needed to learn. However, Eton didn't want to wait until it was too late to save the girl. His chivalrous nature hadn't changed at all despite his rebirth.

"That's it! No more waiting!" yelled Eton as he ran towards the edge of the mass he was standing on and jumped off, allowing himself to glide on the wind. Eton had gotton gliding down, it was just trying to fly independent of the wind that he was still slightly working on.

He flew across the ravine, approaching the frightening figure.

*****Back to Present*****

"Hmm, guess I'll let him handle it. He seems commited enough" said Etoile with a smile. Who was she to deny Eton his chance to be a hero again? It seemed to come naturally to him.

Anyway, Joy was still screaming as she felt the wind pass her. She was almost at the barrier now.

'I can't look' thought Joy as she kept her eyes covered. She braced herself for impacting the earthly ground....

But it didn't come.

Instead, she felt herself land in something soft softer, somthing that apparently talked, as she heard it groan after she landed.

'Omph, this girl could stand to lose a few pounds!' She didn't know if it was her savior who said that. It didn't really sound like talking, more like something from his mind. In any case, she instantly became angered with the man and lashed out with her left hand, still with her eyes closed. Apparently, the smack she heard ignicated a direct hit on her savior's cheek.

"Ow! What did I do?!" yelled the figure. Joy didn't answer, as she was still too frightened to watch and kept her hands on her eyes. Suddenly, the figure's grip seemed to become softer, and she heard a chuckle.

"Relax. Open your eyes. You're not going anywhere" said a calm voice that sent a chill down Joy's spine. She almost felt...warm...on the inside. Pushing that aside for now, she slowly moved her fingers from her eyes, allowing her to look upon her savior. As we all know, it was a young brown-haired Misterian, wearing typical clothing. She also noticed a red mark on his right cheek, indicating where she hit him.

None other Eton himself, holding her in a bridal style.
1143111122111111111111112222122111.title: Saving the "Girl" Part 1

choices: Time for her to meet Minerva
11431111221111111111111122221221111.content:
'Wow. He's...cute...' thought Joy, a blush forming on her face as she thought of those words. Part of her couldn't believe what she just thought. Luckily for her, Eton was too focused on the girl he was carrying to notice.

The girl he carried was rather small, probably around his age. Despite that, she did have some muscle, probably more so than Karis or Lea. Her skin was tanned and really rough, which Eton found wierd but payed no mind to it. Other than that, she was dressed casually. However, Eton did notice her blue and brown eyes. This surprised him but he decided to wait on that.

"That was quite a fall. You alright?" asked Eton with a smile. Joy struggled to get the blush on her face under control as she instinctively tried to get away from him.

"Hey, you might not want to let go of me if your flying is that bad" said Eton. Joy stopped, knowing that he as right. Reacting to it, she put her arms around Eton so she wouldn't fall again.

"Can you...take me back up?" she asked softly. Eton smiled again.

"Sure, why not" said Eton as he tightened his grip and flew her back up. It was a little harder with the extra weight, not to mention that he hadn't prefected it yet, but he was able to manage. He eventually reached Etoile on the ledge and set the girl down gently. Etoile immediately noticed the red mark on Eton's check.

"What happened to you?" she asked, a hint of knowing what happened in her voice. Eton just shook his head.

"I'd rather not say" said Eton, making both he and Joy blush, their wings turning bright pink. This was something Joy hadn't noticed yet about her wings.

"Sorry about that, but I figured that he would rescue you. I'm sure you've thanked him, right?" said Etoile. Joy blushed again and slowly turned towards Eton.

"Um....thank you...for rescuing me" she said, a small hint of a smile on her face. Eton smiled back.

"No problem. What kind of prince would I be if I didn't help you" he laughed, which got a surprised reaction from Joy.

"P-Prince?" she asked with a bit of shock and fear in her voice. Etoile grinned and got into the conversation.

"Yes. You got saved by Prince Eton of Skyaira. You should be grateful" said Etoile, getting a surprised look from Eton. However, it didn't compare to the shock on Joy's face.

"W-What?! Oh, I'm sorry for troubling you!" she said, bowing slightly. Eton laughed sheepishly but straightened her out again.

"No problem, no need to do that kind of stuff. I just like to help" said Eton. Joy then finally gave a true smile, the first since she had been transformed.

Etoile looked between the two and came up with an idea.
11431111221111111111111122221221111.title: Saving the "Girl" Part 2

114311112211111111111111222212211111.content:
After politely clearing her throat, Etoile turned to Joy. "I realize that you have not yet even begun to understand how to use your wings but it is my duty to bring all visitors to the palace." gently, she said. "Will you trust me?"

After a pause, Joy nodded. "I-I trust you" she replied, uncertainly.

Etoile smiled. "You have wings, just like Prince Eton and myself" she explained. "See if you can't make them open for you."

Although Joy had no idea how she would do such a thing, she imagined her wings opening up and, to her surprise, they did, causing Eton to smile next to her.

"Very good" said Eton, giving her an applause. "Try to flap them now."

Joy tried and, at first, nothing happened. Her wings just turned more pink instead, showing off her nervousness. Eton chuckled lightly and demonstrated with his own wings.

"See? It's like this" he said to Joy. She nodded in response.

Again, Joy tried and this time, she succeeded. A bright smile came across her face as she lifted slightly off the ground. "I'm flying!" she announced to the delight of both Etoile and Eton. "I can fly!"

"Not quite yet." corrected Etoile, pulling Joy back to the ground. "It will take some time before you can fly on your own. This little lesson was just so you can glide with me as I guide you to the palace."

She then turned to Eton. "Do you think you can fly there on your own?"

Eton nodded. "I can manage" he replied, his wings turning slightly pink. "Will Joy be staying with us long?"

"It's too soon to tell, Eton" said Etoile with a sigh. "Time will tell until we get her someplace to stay"

Etoile did not want to worry Joy or Eton that she sensed that Joy's body showed warning signs that it may be locking into her new form. She had to get her to the palace so she could be examined by the healers. She turned back to Joy and offered her hand. "Shall we?" she asked. "I promise you won't fall this time."

Joy nervously took Etoile's hand and she led her to the edge and jumped off with her. Joy screamed but then began to giggle as she remembered to spread her wings, causing her to glide through the air with Etoile helping her along. Eton followed close behind, remembering his own first lesson in flight.

"What an odd girl" Eton mumbled to himself, smiling all the same. He had forgotton mostly about the Gaian that was said to have come through. However, even if he remembered that bit, he wouldn't have pegged Joy as one.

Eton smiled again, seeing the look of wonder on Joy's face as she looked at all the sights that blew himself away on his first day as a Misterian. It took all he had not to laugh out loud at some of her comments along the way.

"Everything's so open and uncrowded" stated Joy, in awe. "Is.. Is that a forest? Wow, I never saw one in person before... Oh! a lake and a waterfall!"

Etoile giggled. "You're enjoying this, aren't you." she said.

"Yeah" she replied, still looking about. "I never saw such things where I came from."

Eton thought about Joy's words. As he noticed her odd eyes, he figured that she must have been re-birthed as well. He figured that she must have been far inland or something to that nature.

"It's beautiful!" said Joy, tearing up. "I bet you can play hide and seek in there for weeks and not get bored!"

Etoile laughed with me following. "I never thought of it that way." she said.

Meanwhile, inside her quarters, Minerva frowned at a video screen as she talked to an image of a Gaian man, named Moro. "If what you are saying is true, Moro, that this machine is still experimental, I can not guarantee your 'daughter's' safe return back the way she came."

A sigh escaped Moro's lips. "Please contact me the instant you know for certain" he said. "I must report this the the tribunal... worse, to my mate."

Minerva sighed as well. "Good luck to you, Moro." she said. "I promise your child will be well cared for during her stay."

With that, she severed the link and slid a wall hanging over the video screen. The communication link she had with Kraken was used for emergencies only and only known to her. "This is turning out to be quite a year for the records." she thought.

Just then, the wall images announced Etoile's arrival with Eton and Joy. She sighed, seeing that I had already met her and ordered a guard to allow them in....
114311112211111111111111222212211111.title: Time for her to meet Minerva

1143111122111111111111112222122111111.content:
Hearing the rumbling sound of the stone doors opening, Joy gasped and took Eton's hand without thinking. Eton blushed, seeing Etoile smile but smiled back as he remembered how nervous he was, seeing queen Minerva for the first time. "Please enter." came Minerva's voice.

"It'll be okay." whispered Eton, carefully. "My grandmother won't hurt you."

Joy nodded, though she seemed unconvinced as Eton then escorted her inside as Etoile led the way. The doors closed behind them with a low rumble and slight thud, causing Joy to jump slightly. "You have nothing to fear, child." said Minerva, standing before her. "You are very safe here."

Minerva, Eton noticed, had donned the same royal garments she had worn when meeting him for the first time and guessed it was necessary attire for meeting family and honored guests. "I-I'm sorry I ca-came with-without warning, you-your highness." stammered Joy, bowing before Minerva. "I me-mean no harm."

Minerva looked at joy for a moment then giggled. "Who would have thought a Gaian child was so full of innocence?" she thought, privately, so not to be heard. then she said, "Relax, Joy, I know and understand that your visit was accidental, you are not in trouble, I merely wished to meet you." she paused then asked, "What do you think of Skyaira?"

"Your world is amazing, your highness." said Joy, raising her head, smiling. "I have seen wonders that only exist in pictures where I'm from." She was careful not to fully state where she was from. She knew that Minerva and Etoile knew who she was. However, Eton didn't, and Joy was no fool to how Gaians were portrayed. There was no doubt in her mind that Eton would hate her if he knew she was actually a Gaian. She didn't want to lose his friendship.

Minerva smiled as she motioned for a woman to step forward from further in the room. "I am glad you are enjoying your visit thus far." she said. "I would like to have this woman take a look at you, see that you are in good health, will you allow her to approach?"

Curious, Joy nodded and the woman stepped forward, placing a light hand onto Joy's head. doing so, she stared deeply into her eyes. Joy remained perfectly still, confused but somewhat awed by the woman's sea colored eyes. Seconds later, the woman took her hand away and stepped back before turning to Minerva who's wings turned slightly blue as she shook her head. "I will need to confirm this with the others, to be certain." said the woman.

"Report to me the moment you have your answer." said Minerva.

The woman bowed and left, deeper into the room from where she had come. Joy, confused by this, turned to Minerva who sensed her question. "It's just a quick medical examination." she said, lightly. "We do things a little differently here."

"Oh." said Joy, still curious. "So what now?"

"Well, I could give you a few flying lessons." offered Eton. "I'm not the best but I'm willing to help." he then smiled. "After that, maybe I can take you to the market to look around, it would be my first time there as well."

Joy smiled but inside, she was uncertain. "Oh no... Is he asking me out on a date!?"

Eton still wasn't skilled with mind reading yet, so Joy's thoughts did not reach him. However, Minerva and Etoile caught them, sending them into giggle fits. Eton and Joy looked at them confused.

'Oh my, has my grandson captured your heart already? I didn't expect him to do it so quickly'' thought Minerva, channeling it in a way that only Etoile and Joy heard them. Only a truely experienced Misterian could pull of that kind of trick.

'Wh-What?! How did you....' thought Joy, her thoughts still flowing through the connection between Etoile and Minerva. Minerva grinned again.

'Things are different here. We are telepathic as well. So, you might want to watch what you think. You don't want the whole city to know that Prince Eton has an admirer, correct?' thought Minerva, causing Etoile to giggle again and Joy to invent a new shade of red on her face. Eton looked between them, still confused.

"Are you guys mentally talking without me?" he asked with slight irritation. Etoile then controlled her giggles enough to talk.

"Sorry, just some girl talk" said Etoile. Eton sighed and nodded.

"Very well, I probably wouldn't want to hear it anyway" he said, making Joy sigh with relief that he wouldn't push it further. Etoile and Minerva smiled at each other. What a development this was. What effect could these two have on each other?

"This is going to take some getting used to." Joy said.

Minerva and Etoile talked to Joy and Eton for a few more minutes before Minerva told them it was time to leave....
1143111122111111111111112222122111111.title: Joy meets Minerva

11431111221111111111111122221221111111.content:
"So, how are you feeling?" asked Eton.

Eton and Joy had walked out of the Sky Castle and were on a ledge on the main landmass, as Eton had been able to glide them there. Joy had remembered how much fun it was to fly last time but she knew that mastering flight wouldn't be that easy.

"Ok, I guess" said Joy, still apprehensive. Two things seemed to plague Joy's mind. One, of course, was learning to fly, as there was nothing but a long way to the surface if something went wrong. The other was her odd feelings towards Eton. Could she really have a crush on him? She had only been a girl for a few hours! It frustrated her, and Eton noticed the look on her face.

"You sure you're ok. You've been acting even wierder since the meeting" said Eton. Joy perked up at this and glared at Eton, making him flinch a bit. Her face was quite scary when she was mad.

"I'm wierd? Is that all you think of me? Like when you called me fat?!" Joy almost yelled. Eton was confused at that last part.

"Huh? First off, no, I don't think you're always wierd. Second, when did I ever call you fat?" asked Eton. Joy's face went red as she huffed and cross her arms.

"When you caught me as I was falling, I heard you say that I could stand to lose a few pounds. That's why I slapped you" she said indignantly. It felt odd to her to be this concerned about her weight, something that never crossed her mind when she was a male Gaian. Eton, on the other hand, was briefly confused. However, his eyes widened as he came to the conclusion that she must have read his mind by mistake.

"Oh, that! No, I wasn't calling you fat. You're just...." Eton started, getting a very good look at Joy. Joy was certainly interesting, compared to other Misterians. Her tanned skin was a huge contrast to the mostly white skin of most Misterians. Also, despite the fact that her overall frame was a bit smaller than Eton's, she had some good muscle on her body. No wonder that slap still somewhat stung Eton's cheek. You could possibly make the argument that she had more muscle than Eton at this point, maybe.

"I"m what?" asked Joy, her eyes squinting at him, making him nervous.

"You were a bit heavy. However, I guess it's just because you're so well built. You must have been quite the athlete before you were rebirthed. I apologize if I offended you" said Eton, very politely. Joy's face gave a small blush as her anger settled down, and she softly smiled.

"That's all right. I shouldn't let that get to me anyway" she said. Eton smiled at her as well, glad to have that settled. "So, the lesson?" she asked.

"Oh right. Well, let's get started. You remember how you felt before right?" asked Eton. Joy nodded and Eton went through more pointers about flying that Myrrh taught him. Joy had a pretty good memory as she was able to keep up with every thing he said, nodding every now and then.

"You got it? Well, let's try it out" said Eton, awaiting Joy to attempt takeoff. Joy was still apprehensive about it, but she had faith in Eton to help her if she needed it. She smiled at that and tried to imagine her wings taking flight. As if commanded, her wings began to flap, slowly lifting off the ground.

"Good job, keep at it!" said Eton in encouragement. Joy kept it up and keep rising off the ground.

"This isn't so bad...Woah, woah!" yelled Joy as her concentration broke. That was something she would need to work on to sustain prolonged flight. However, she didn't have the experience to know how to recover and started falling back to the ground. Eton ran over and positioned himself to catch her.

"I've got you!" he yelled as Joy fell right on top of him. It wasn't exactly a clean landing, and Eton fell right on his back, making his wings ache a bit. This was precisely the reason why Misterians didn't sleep on beds.

However, that wasn't the thing that immediately caught Eton's attention.

'Why does my head feel hard to lift? And why can't I breathe?' thought Eton before he finally focused his eyes forward. However, his eyes widened as they looked straight into a bright pair of blue and brown eyes that were as shocked as his own, with a pair of lips smashed against his own lips.

It was a total coincidence. Joy's fail, and Eton's ungraceful catch, had positioned them in such a way that their lips happened to smash against each other on the way down. A truly eventfull, and odd, way for both Eton and Joy to experience their first kiss.

And it wasn't going to be leaving their memories anytime soon, given what happened next.

"HAHAHAHAHAHAHA! Wow, what a sight!" yelled a male voice, that sounded as filled with laughter as humanly possible. Eton and Joy immediately separated from each other, blushes still evident on their faces. They looked off the ledge to see none other than Ewol clutching his ribs and rolling around in middair, laughing all the while.

'Of all people, why did he have to see it?' wondered Eton with a sigh, as Ewol controlled himself briefly and landed next to them. He still couldn't help chuckling though.

"Wow Eton! I knew you wouldn't be able to ignore the grace and majesty of Misterian women, but I didn't think it would happen this quickly! Well done dude!" he yelled, giving Eton a pat on the back for a "good job" so to speak. Eton sighed again. Ewol then turned to Joy, who was more than a little scared at the moment.

"I must say, new girl, that you're pretty lucky. To kiss the prince of our fair kingdom must be a wonderful experience" said Ewol, still smiling.

"Well...I..." stammered Joy, unable to find any words. Ewol continued chuckling and wrapped his arms around both of their shoulders.

"I'm happy for the both of you. Just remember than you can't mate until you come of age. Anything prior is extremely frowned upon" said Ewol, almost seriously. This time, all color drained from Eton and Joy's faces at what Ewol was insinuating.

"Ewol, there's no time for that!" said Eton, trying to stop this conversation. Ewol just raised a hand chuckled again.

"I know, you've got more things to teach the new girl. Best of luck to you both. Now, sir and ma'am, if you'll excuse me" said Ewol, as he flipped into the air and flew off, leaving a couple of confused Misterians as to what just happened.
11431111221111111111111122221221111111.title: Joy's First Lesson

114311112211111111111111222212211111111.content:
Eton sighed, seeing Ewol fly away. "Half the kingdom will know by the end of the day." he muttered, having an idea of Ewol's personality. "Don't be surprised if we get a few awkward stares as the day goes on."

Joy sighed as well. "As my father once said, a lie is merely another person's truth." she said. "It will be easier for us to call it an accidental kiss than to flatly deny it ever happened." she then gave Eton a shy smile, still blushing, as she took his hand. "Thank you for catching me... again."

Eton returned the shy smile, also blushing as he gave her hand a gentle squeeze. "You're welcome." he then cleared his throat and added, "Are you ready for another flying lesson?"

Joy nodded and Eton again went over the basics as he was taught, adding a few notes of his own that he had learned from his own experiences. "Try to open your wings into the wind." he instructed her. "Just not so much that you can't control your own direction, only let the wind pick you up then flap your wings to give direction and speed so to maintain some control."

Joy tried as Eton said and was surprised by how much better it worked. "How do I land?" she asked, flying in circles around Eton.

Eton instructed her and she managed to land, although clumsily, onto her feet. "I think I'm getting the hang of this."

"This is only the basics." said Eton. "I'm still learning myself." he then blushed anew. "Do you still want to go to the market?"

"We won't be able to avoid the rumors, no matter where we go." replied Joy, blushing as well. "I say we go and dispel any ill thought ideas your friend has spread to others."

Eton nodded in agreement and took off with Joy, holding her hand to support her, as they flew towards the market. It took them several minutes to reach the landmass holding the market. However, on the way there, Joy was smiling, looking at the many wonders Skyaira had to offer. She was breathtaken by the natural purity of the air, the lush green forests and beautiful landscapes. Only her smile flattened as they reached the market, figuring by then, word had spread that the young prince had found a possible love interest. Both Eton and Joy blushed as a concerned Lea approached them first. "I heard from Ewol that you two were spotted on the ground kissing." she said, almost accusing.

"An accidental kiss." said Eton, blushing brightly with Joy. "She's just learning to fly and she fell on top of me, trying to land."

Lea's eyes widened as she visualized the incident then giggled. "That must have been a shock to you both." she said, grinning. "I wish I was there to witness it."

Eton sighed and Lea placed a hand onto his shoulder. Seeing this, Joy felt a twinge of jealousy but didn't know why. "Ewol is known to slightly exaggerate the facts when is comes to things he witnesses." said Lea. "You and your friend will be often questioned but few will come to their own conclusions."

Lea then turned to Joy. "I see by your eyes that you were also rebirthed. What's your story?"

Joy's face invented a new shade of red as she bowed her head slightly, her wings giving away her fear and uncertainty. "I-I'm here by-by accident." she replied, nervously. "It-It's a bit com-complicated."

Suddenly, Lea gasped, her wings turning a shade of blue and pink. "I've heard stories of a human kid being mistaken for a Misterian visiting Earth." she said with an air of surprise and sadness. "She must have been the victim of mistaken identity and rebirthed before anyone caught the error."

Joy, not yet ready to tell the truth, slowly nodded. "Something like that." she said, vainly holding back a few tears.

Lea immediately hugged Joy, surprising her. "Welcome to Skyaira." she whispered. "Want some help shopping?"

Joy smiled as Lea released her and nodded. "I could use all the help and friends I can get." she replied.

Lea giggled, taking Joy's hand. "We can help Eton with his fashion while we shop for yours." she said, pulling her along. "I'll show you that our world is a wonderful place to live."

"Wow, that's a switch, she's usually so shy." thought Eton.

"I caught that." said Lea, causing Eton to blush and Joy to giggle. "You're the one who told me to open up more, remember?"

"Oh, yeah, I did." said Eton, shyly smiling as he followed.

Lea giggled with Joy. "Boys..." they said in unison before giggling more.

As Lea escorted Joy into the market area, she wondered why she made a statement about boys when she used to be one herself. However, remembering that others could pick up on her thoughts, decided not to dwell on it. The market place, Eton noticed, looked much like a flea market on Earth with all of the booths open to the outside with only an awning protecting their products should it rain. There were nearly endless booths, all selling anything from food to clothing to weapons and more. "I could spend all day, just looking around." he whispered.

"Stay close, Eton." called Lea. "As a prince, you can have all our purchases charged to the palace."

"I don't think Myrrh would like that." said Eton, wincing.

"It's alright" said Myrrh, walking up behind him. "I was told of your new friend's arrival by queen Minerva. Help her all you can but have her back at the palace before sunset, understand?"

Eton nodded then ran to catch up with Lea and Joy....
114311112211111111111111222212211111111.title: Aftermath

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Eton was not too keen on Myrrh escorting him, Lea, and Joy through the market place but he did not complain either as no one else approached them about the accidental kiss, though he knew he'd hear more about it later. Joy was looking all around, wide eyed with wonder, at the dozens of open areas with carts and tables, all filled with items for sale. She wanted to run ahead and explore, if only to see all that the market had to offer. fortunately, Myrrh had a firm grip on her hand. she giggled, sensing her eagerness. "Easy, little one." she said, gently. "We have plenty of time."

Eton was a little more controlled, having the mind of an adult but the kid in him had been peeking out more and more the passed few days and he felt the same urge to run about and explore. Myrrh, knowing this, had a firm grip on his hand as well. She smiled, happy to see her new son rediscovering his childhood and laughed as she felt him trying to move ahead to explore. "there is a lot to see in each shop, Eton.' she told him. "Don't be in such a rush."

Lea, although mostly shy, pointed out a few of the shops as they passed them, telling Joy and Eton what they had sold there. "That's a scent shop.' she said, turning to Joy. "They sell fragrances for both boys an girls to make them smell nice." she smiled. "Certain scents have a calming effect on one and others while other scents are used to attract a..."

"I think they get the idea, Lea." said Myrrh as both Eton and Joy blushed slightly.

"What's that shop?' asked Joy, pointing.

"Oh, that's a clothing shop." replied Myrrh. "Would you like to start there?"

Joy eagerly nodded and the four walked into that area where they were greeted by a young woman who politely smiled at them. "Princess Myrrh, it's an honor to see you in my shop." she said, with a bow. "You as well, prince Eton. I am Faith, how can I help you?"

"This is Joy, a visitor to our world." said Myrrh, nodding to the smiling girl, holding her hand. "Due to some unforeseen problems, she will be staying with us for a while and needs a wardrobe. Also, my son, Eton needs more clothing as well."

Faith looked at Joy and smiled, though she was concerned by her rough skin. "I will be happy to help you." she said. "What of your other friend?"

"I'm just along for moral support." replied Lea, her wings turning slightly pink.

"If you see something you like, let me know.' said Myrrh. "I don't mind."

Lea smiled, shyly. "Thank you."

With that, Faith and Lea helped Joy try on a number of outfits, including a black leotard with a matching skirt and a red sash. It was the closet to what she had worn as a boy in Kraken, it made her smile. "I like this outfit." she said. "The black shoes are a nice touch."

"It looks good on you." said Lea, smiling. "Only that is a dance outfit, not really used for everyday wear."

Joy pouted but became curious as Lea then showed her a flattering white dress that seemed to shimmer in the light. "Try this next, okay?' she said.

"But there's no place for my wings." protested Joy. "How would I wear it?"

"Just try it on." Faith urged lightly. "You might be surprised."

Sighing, Joy stepped behind the changing blind and slipped into the dress. To her surprise and delight, her wigs moved right through the fabric as if it were not there and fit her perfectly! Looking at her reflection on her side of the blind, Joy smiled then stepped out, showing off her new look. Eton's jaw dropped, seeing how beautiful she looked while Lea and Myrrh smiled. "Well,, we have Eton's approval." said Myrrh, giggling. "How do you like the dress, Joy?"

"I love it." said joy, smiling. "Only, how can it fit without any room for my wings?"

"It's made of enchanted cloth.' giggled Lea.

"The fabric is a little more expensive than normal cloth but it gives girls a more grown up look." said Myrrh. "Women have energy wings, they go right through any cloth material. The enchanted cloth gives girls that experience."

Joy smiled. "I'll wear this today." she said, blushing.

Myrrh smiled as they then moved on to pushing Eton to try on some clothing as well. while Eton and Joy were busy at the market, Minerva finished speaking to the healers who reported their findings from Joy's medical examination.

"What did you find?" demanded Minerva.

A woman stepped forward. "Queen Minerva, we fear that Joy's form is quickly locking, meaning she will be trapped as Misterian girl for life."

"How much time do we have before her form locks Completely?" asked Minerva, alarmed.

The woman shook her head and replied...

"It might just be too late"
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: A day of shopping.

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Meanwhile, as Minerva was forced to contemplate Joy's ever growing situation, Pallas, who was disguised as the human girl Paula, was happening problems of her own.

*****Previous Day*****

"Are you alright, Nicole?" asked Paula. She had just taken the initiative of using small magic to try and heal Nicole. It surprised Paula to see Nicoles mind be the dartk maelstrom that it was. With that in mind, she had taken small magic in her hands and gently rubbed Nicole's back, saying that she was just trying to calm her down and that it was something she read out of a book.

To Paula's happiness, Nicole showed some improvement over the next hour, smiling a bit more and having fun with her new friend. However, it didn't last for too long, so Paula repeated it a few more times over the day. She knew that she was pushing the limits Minerva gave her when she sent her to the surface, but she eagerly wanted Nicole healed. As she did this, she noticed two lumps on Nicole's back where her wings were supposed to be. Nicole explained that they were bone spurs from when she was in an accident as a baby. That's what her doctor said anyway.

Anyway, something else grabbed Paula's attention. The magic flowing through Nicole's body seemed to be spiraling rapidly, and Nicole almost seemed sick to her stomach once after one of Paula's sessions. Paula had began to worry if her healing was negatively affecting Nicole's body.

Nicole claimed that she was fine. Paula didn't believe her though. In that moment, she asked Nicole if she wanted to come over to her house sometime. Nicole said that she would talk to her parents about it.

Later that day, Nicole called Paula and said that they were ok with Paula and her "mother" coming over to pick Nicole up to go to her house. This was, of course, after the parents did speak a bit with the Misterian woman who was posing as Paula's mother.

*****Current Day*****

"Do you think this will work?" asked Paula to Irene, her "mother". Irene shrugged.

"We'll see, won't we?" she replied simply. Paula didn't say another word after that. The two arrived in their car and walked up to the Wilson home. Irene rang the doorbell and waited for someone to come. When the door opened, it was not Nicole or the parents, but rather her brother, Trevor.

"Who is..." he started before his eyes landed on Paula. Trevor's cheeks redddened as his mouth dropped slightly as he looked at Paula.

'Wow, she's cute' thought Trevor before shaking his head. Luckily, Paula wasn't listening to mental thoughts at the moment. However, Irene was and giggled slightly at the thought of it.

"Hello, may we come in?" asked Irene. Trevor nodded and let them in, closing the door behind them. Soon enough, Nicole came up and walked to Paula, wondering what they would do at her house. The parents said their hellos as well and wished them to have a good day. Howver, their mother caught Trevor looking at Paula with a look she remembered from when she and her husband were little kids.

"Hey Trevor, would you like to go with them?" suggested their mother.

"Are you sure?" asked Trevor. Irene then spoke up.

"Why not? I'm sure Paula would like to get to know Nicole's brother as well" said Irene. Paula was a little disturbed at this change of events but she went with it anyway.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Down to the Surface

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Paula was not comfortable having to be in a room alone with Trevor as she found her own heart pounding when he came near. It was a perfectly normal reaction for a young girl, being close to a handsome young man but she knew it would never be. "Irene did this on purpose." she thought, giving Trevor a weak smile. "She knew I'd have to be alone with this guy." "Um... so, Trevor." she said, aloud. "Do you have any hobbies?"

"I like planes and the feeling of being in flight." said Trevor. "I guess its something our family all has in common. Nicole dreams to be able to fly without a plane, maybe dad will take her hang gliding when she gets older as he did with James." he chuckled, then a sad look then fell upon his face. "I really miss him."

"Was he your older brother?" asked Paula, even though she already knew. "What was he like?"

Trevor smiled. "You would have loved him." he said. "He always had a way of making a person feel calm..."

As Trevor talked to Paula, Irene had talked to Nicole while she helped her with snacks. "Paula said you had a problem with your shoulders." she said, politely. "My a niece went through the same thing, may I take a look?"

Blushing, Nicole nodded and turned around, lifting her blouse. Irene placed her hand onto Nicole's shoulders to hear her giggle. "Hey!, that tickles!" she said, shivering slightly. "What are you doing?"

"Sorry, Nicole." said Irene, smiling. "I'm trying to be gentle."

Little did Nicole know it was the use of Irene's magic that was tickling her as she did a quick but careful medical examination. After a few minutes of giggling and light protests from Nicole, Irene smiled. "Okay, I'm done." she said. "Your bone spurs will likely grind down, just as my niece's did, you'll be fine."

"Poor girl." thought Irene, taking up a tray of snacks. "She is going to have a hard decision to make by her next birthday as she is..."
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Check-up

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
"So Nicole really dreams about flying high in the air?" asked Paula, showing clear interest. "Was she always like this?"

Trevor nodded. "For as long as I've known her." he replied, smiling. "thank you for bringing her back to us."

Paula looked at Trevor, genuinely surprised. "What do you mean?"

"The news of James' death hit all of us hard, especially Nicole." replied Trevor with a sigh. "She rarely spoke a word and barely ate anything, plus she was becoming more irritable at school." he then smiled again. "Since you can to her school, Nicole is starting to turn around. She's eating more, talking more and now she's even giggling again so... thank you."

Trevor unexpectedly leaned forward and planted a light kiss onto Paula's cheek, causing her to blush brightly. She could almost hear her heart racing as a small grin formed onto her face. "Um... you're welcome." she said, quietly.

"Wow, she's really cute when she blushes." thought Trevor.

This time, Paula heard his thought and blushed even more before leaning over and kissing Trevor on his cheek. This caused him to blush as well, making Paula giggle as she smiled at him. "You look cute when you blush." she said, without thinking.

"Um... thank you." said Trevor. "You look cute, no matter what you do."

It was then Paula realized her mistake and could almost hear Minerva's lecture. "Oh... he has a crush on me and I think I just accepted it!" she thought, desperately thinking of a way to mend the situation.

Just then, Nicole walked into the room with Irene who saw them both blushing. Irene, who had been listening in, so to speak, merely smiled while Nicole seemed slightly disappointed. "What did we miss?" she asked.

"Nothing." replied Paula and Trevor in unison, still blushing.

"Well, snacks are ready." said Irene, placing the tray down. "I need to have a word with Paula for a second.

she then quickly pulled Paula out of earshot and had her sit down. "It's bad, I'm afraid. Nicole is coming of age a lot sooner than normal, which means she will have the ability to summon her new wings." said Irene, serious. "I can slow the process down but i can't stop it without making her completely human and that will break dozens of our laws."

Paula moaned sightly. "What can we do?"
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Growing up too fast.

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Back in Skyaira, Minerva frowned at the view screen, showing her Paula talking to Trevor. To say she was annoyed with Paula for using magic on Nicole was an understatement but she had other matters to attend to and turned back to the healers. "Anya, are you certain that your findings are correct?" she asked.

"I'm afraid so, queen Minerva." replied Anya, the woman who had examined Joy. "As the Gaian was transformed by both alien technology and our magic, there is no safe way to restore her to her original form." wincing, she added, "We fear that any attempt will cost her life."

Minerva sighed, tears forming. "That child came here in all innocence." she whispered. "How do I tell her she's been orphaned?"

"Gently." replied another woman with long blond hair and blue eyes. "The harder question is, how do you tell her biological parents that their son is 'dead'?"

"Diplomacy I can handle, Aphrodite." said Minerva, firmly. "Dealing with a distraught child is another matter."

"Who shall we inform first, Minerva." asked Anya. "This is a very delicate matter."

"I am aware of that, thank you." said Minerva with a sigh. "I have noticed that Joy seemed to like Etoile, I will have her break the news to Joy while I contact the Gaian Tribunal so they may inform Moro." she shook her head. "You are dismissed."

The healers bowed and left Minerva's chambers as she gave the command for Etoile to be summoned. She arrived minutes later and was immediately briefed as to Joy's fate. "I need you to break the news to Joy." said Minerva. "I have the more difficult task of informing her parents through their Tribunal."

Etoile sighed. "I doubt Joy will adapt as quickly as Eton, she was once a boy." she said. "I will do my best."

"As you always do" said Minerva. She then dismissed her and activated the video link to Kraken...
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Joy's Diagnostic

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Leaving Minerva's chambers, Etoile wondered where to start searching for Joy. She remembered them going out to the market but that was quite a while ago, they would be back by now. Then, she wondered if Joy might have gone to Myrrh's chambers as she had formed a friendship with Eton. "That boy certainly has a way of finding women." giggling, she thought.

Deciding to try there first, Etoile walked through the maze of halls to Myrrh's chambers and touched the call stone. It was a small half stone on the wall, that, when touched, sends a cheerful tone into the room, indicating there was a visitor outside. Etoile remembered Eton calling it a 'door bell'. It was a quaint name to her mind and she pondered over using it. Then Myrrh answered the door and looked at her surprised.

"Good day, Etoile." she said, happily. "What brings you to my chambers?'

"Somber news, I'm afraid." replied Etoile. "Is Joy with you?'

"They are taking a nap.' replied Myrrh, her face and wings showing concern. "Why, what is this somber news you bring?"

"I must tell Joy in person." replied Etoile, firmly. "It concerns her fate."

Myrrh's wings turned completely blue. "She's not..." she began. "Her parents...?"

Etoile shook her head. "Her transformation is locking and there is nothing we can do to stop it." she whispered. "Sending her home the way she came would mean certain death." she gulped as her own wings turned blue. "Joy is an orphan among us as she was transformed, not rebirthed."

"Oh, so unfortunate" whispered Myrrh, her face downcast as she said that. "Please enter, I'll take you to her."

Etoile walked into Myrrh's chambers with her heart in her throat as she greatly disliked delivering sad or troubling news. Only, upon entering Eton's sleep quarters, the two saw Joy giving Eton a kiss on the lips as he slept.

"What is this?" asked Etoile, more than a bit surprised.

*****A few minutes ago******

Unknown to Myrrh or Etoile, as they spoke, Joy had been awake for a while, watching Eton sleep on his love seat like bed. She could almost hear her own heart beating as she thought about their accidental kiss earlier that day.

"I-If an accidental kiss felt the way it did to me..." whispered Joy, "what would a real kiss feel like?"

Realizing what she was saying, Joy's wings turned bright pink, as she blushed, turning away from Eton. "Wha-What am I saying!?" she whispered to herself. "This is crazy!"

She turned back to Eton and felt the same urge to kiss him that she had felt before and wondered if she had not taken advantage of that fall to kiss him in the first place without even knowing it. The thought was frightening but she was raised to believe anything is possible.

"If I kiss him and he wakes up, how would he react?" asked Joy to herself. "Would he embrace the kiss or push me away in rejection?"

Being only ten years old, Coy was nervous about kissing any girl. Only, now that she is a girl, she feels more nervous about kissing a guy and nearly left the sleeping quarters all together. However, the urges were getting stronger and Joy somehow knew she would go crazy if she did not discover the answer to the question that was plaguing her. What would a real kiss feel like.

"May-Maybe if I'm gentle, he won't even feel it." whispered Joy, hopeful.

With her wings still a bright pink, Joy approached Eton and carefully placed a light kiss onto his lips. The energy she got from that little peck, gave her goosebumps and she nearly giggled out loud. Only she stopped herself and, without thinking, kissed Eton again, unaware the Myrrh and Etoile had entered the room.

*****Present Time*****

"Guess she's exploring her femininity" said Myrrh, just as susrprised, but holding back a small laugh. Then, both of their attentions went to the two young angels as Eton started to stir.

Then, Eton opened his eyes and was surprised to see Joy, again, kissing him on the lips. Only this time, it was not an accident and, for some strange reason, he liked it and began to sleepily kiss back. This brought forth a surge of magic power, which only Myrrh and Etoile could sesne as Joy's wings turned a bright white, showing her extreme happiness. Myrrh smiled, seeing Joy's rough skin turn soft and smooth but it was a sad smile as she also sensed Joy's new form locking. She was now a Misterian girl for life.

"I apologize for interrupting this touching scene." said Etoile, causing both Eton and Joy to break the kiss, blushing. "I have some rather unpleasant news for our visitor, Joy."

"What kind of news?" asked Eton. Etoile first turned to Eton.

"First, you need to go, Eton. This needs to be private" said Etoile. Eton was kind of confused but he got an assuring smile from Myrrh. He smiled slightly and walked out of the room, looking for something to do while he waited.

"Now, as for you..." started Etoile, as a slightly worried look graced Joy's face.

"What... What is it?" asked Joy, her wings turning a pink and green color. "Is something wrong with the teleporter?" she gave a small grin. "I don't mind staying here a little longer."

"I'm afraid that its not the teleporter, Joy." said Etoile, gently. "Your transformed state has locked itself... permanently." she sighed. "You are a Misterian, now and forever. If we try to send you home the way you came, you will die."

Joy's jaw dropped as if she had been hit with an incredible force as tears slowly overflowed her eyes and ran down her now smooth skin. Her wings turned a bright blue before she fell to her knees, sobbing silently, burying her face into her hands. "Mommy... Daddy!"

"They're still your mom and dad." said Etoile, knelling down to hug her. "At least your parents know where you are."

"What am I to do!?" wailed joy, through her hands. "Who will care for me!?"

"I will care for you." said Etoile. "I lost my family just as suddenly as you had lost yours." she knelled down to Joy's level. "We can set up a link so you can talk to your true parents from time to time. Will you allow me to be your guardian?"

For a moment, Joy did not answer but she had also stopped crying as if the question threw her off guard. Soon, she lowered her hands and looked up at Etoile with questioning eyes. "You- You're not replacing mommy?" she asked, confused and frightened.

"Your mom is in the city of Kraken." corrected Etoile. "I wish to be your guardian here." she then gave Joy a shy smile, blushing slightly. "However, If you later want to call me 'mommy', I won't argue."

Joy blushed as well as Etoile slowly released her from her hug. "Where do... we live, Etoile?" she asked.

Etoile sighed as if she had been holding her breath. "Like you, I am visiting here from another city." she replied. "But now that I have a child to look after, I just may remain here a while."

Joy hugged Etoile, crying slightly as Etoilie gently rocked her in her arms until she fell asleep. "Welcome to your new home, Joy." she whispered.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: "Sealed" with a Kiss

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Inside her chambers, Minerva let out a frustrated moan as the video link to Kraken went black. "Those people are worse than children!" she muttered, covering the video screen. "It was their technology that caused this incident not our 'mysterious powers'." she rolled her eyes at the notion. "Now they are sending an envoy to discuss the incident in length. I need a drink to ease my mind."

Then, the Earth link view screen gave a chiming sound as Paula's face appeared onto the screen. she winced, seeing Minerva's impatient glare. "Um... Greetings, my queen.' she said, nervously. "I see I have caught you at a bad time, I will contact you later."

"No, no, your timing is perfect... Paula." replied Minerva, sarcastically. "I allowed you magical powers as a human for emergencies only! You are not a healer and yet you used your magic to try to repair Nicole's body!"

"I was successful, Minerva." countered Paula, defending herself. "Nicole is physically and mentally getting better."

"Due to human medicine and your mere presence as a friend." corrected Minerva, annoyed. "Your magic has triggered an early coming of age in Nicole that will soon lead her to the realization that she is not truly human and a difficult decision that will effect the rest of her life!" Minerva sighed, feeling a headache coming on. "At this moment, I am too annoyed and too drained to think of a proper punishment for you so, until I say otherwise, you are remaining on Earth as a human child!"

Paula tried to protest but Minerva severed the link and summoned her guards, who came immediately. "We will be receiving guests from Kraken before the day is over, please see to it that we are ready for anything." she told them.

The guards bowed respectively and left her chambers...

*****On the Surface*****

Paula brought her hand up to cover her mouth as a look of shock remained on her face. It wasn't an official punishment since Minerva was too annoyed at the time. However, Paula knew that it was only a matter of days (or perhaps hours) until Minerva contacted her again and layed down a fierce punishment.

"What will she do to me?" Paula wondered in slight fear. Would she be put in prison for her trespass? Didn't seem likely. However, there was a good possibility that Paula might be stripped of her magic and identity for some time, making her nothing more than a normal human girl.

Paula felt conflicted by such a thought. Skyaira was her one and only home, a place she never wanted to leave. However, her daughter was here on the surface, along with a boy that she was slowly admitting that she was crushing on. Trevor reminded her so much of her fallen mate.

"What a mess" muttered Paula, a feeling of hopelessness in her voice.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Paula calls Minerva (bad timing)

choices: Adra and Sam meet prince Eton.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Two mots, or hours, later, Taurus looked out at the landing area that had been set aside for Gaian shuttles to greet the envoy from Kraken. He had dealt with the Gaians before and knew how to approach them. That and the fact he was the Misterian envoy to Olympia, made him the perfect choice to greet the Gaian envoy. Taurus smiled, seeing the shuttle taking a scenic route over Skyaira, knowing that the new princess of Olympia and a recently absorbed human from Kraken was aboard. "I guess I can't blame Moro for giving them the grand tour." he muttered.

Five minutes later, the shuttle landed with Moro and the new Gaian emerging first, wearing the odd helmets that allow them to breath freely. Behind them was the new princess of Olympia who immediately rose her hands to shield her eyes from the sun.

"Are you alright?" asked the man, concerned.

“I’ll be fine, just letting my eyes adjust.” Slowly stepping out of the shuttle, the princess said. “I’ve been living underwater for the past two weeks, I forgot how bright sunlight can be.”

Taking my hand, the man said, “Come on, I’ll help you.”

With Sam’s help, the two joined up with Moro as Taurus exited the observation room and approached them. Turning to the door, the princess seemed surprised. he smiled as he heard her say, “Hera was right. They do look like angels.”

Taurus fought the urge to chuckle as he reached them, his wings politely tucked behind his shoulders.

“Welcome back to Skyaira, Moro.” Extending his hand, he said, “I only wish it were under better circumstances.”

“Me too, Taurus.” Gesturing to Sam and Adra, Moro said, “Let me introduce Sam and Adra, Princess of Olympia.”

After greeting Sam, Taurus turned to Adra. “It’s an honor to meet you, Princess.” Smiling, Taurus said, “I’m the Misterian envoy to Olympia.”

Nodding, Adra said, “The pleasure is all mine.”

Once the pleasantries were finished, we followed Taurus into the building. “Moro, let me say that I’m terribly sorry for what’s happened to your son.”

“Thank you, Taurus.” Pausing, Moro said, “Is my…daughter well?”

“She seems to be adjusting. In fact,” turning to Moro, Taurus said, “I understand she’s developed a friendship with the Crown Prince, Eton.”

“Co-Joy was always one to make friends easily.”

The three walking through the building, until they stopped outside a closed door. “Your daughter is inside with her guardian Etoile; I’ll give you some privacy.”

“Thank you.” Turning to Sam and Adra, Moro said, “I’d like for you both to be here; Co-Joy has bonded with both of you.”

Glancing at Adra, Sam said, “Okay Moro.”

With that, Moro turned and opened the door. We’d no sooner walked inside when I heard an excited voice scream, “DADDY!!”

Looking in the direction of the voice, Adra saw a young girl running towards Moro. As she got closer, Adra recognized the face, realizing that it was Coy. “She makes a cute girl.”

Coy, or Joy as she was now called, looked very different from the young Gaian Adra had met days earlier. Instead of his olive green skin, Joy now had smooth tan skin with a nice head of shoulder length brown hair. To Adra's surprise, it seemed as if she’d gained muscle as well; along with two different colored eyes.

All watched with a sense of happiness and sorrow as Joy jumped into Moro’s arms; her wings wrapping snuggly around her father, shining white.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: The Arrival

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Allowing Moro some privacy, Taurus led Adra and Sam out of the chambers to visit the crown prince Eton. After they were gone with the door sealed, Moro turned to Joy, tears forming in his blue eyes. "My heart screams in agony to leave you here, away from your mother and I." he said, fighting not to sob. "However, your mother and I celebrate, knowing that you will outlive us by a thousand years."

Joy's wings turned a slight shade of blue as her lips quivered. "Why can't you stay?" she asked. "Mom can come here too, the air is thin enough, you have shuttles..."

Moro shook his head, tears now flowing. "We are too set in our ways, Joy." he said, softly. "We would poison this place and that would make us no better than our arrogant ancestors who destroyed their own home world."

Joy began to cry, her wings dropping slightly as they turned a deep shade of blue, matching Moro's eyes. "Please..." she begged. "You can learn, you can change..."

Moro sighed. "You can learn, you can change." he said, catching one of Joy's tears. "You have done what we had always thought impossible for us, Joy... you achieved far much more than anyone else of our kind could."

Before Moro could go on, Joy raised her hand.

"You're not going to give me a sappy speech, are you?" she asked, smiling as she did.

"I was going to say something along the lines of you being the first..." Moro started, surprised at the reaction.

Joy then started giggling, replying, "Really, daddy? Can you leave me a communication screen?"

"Well, so much for that" muttered Moro, before smiling as well. "Very well" he said. Right after that, Etoile jumped into the conversation.

"Forgive me for intruding." she said. "Queen Minerva is ready to speak with you, Moro."

Moro nodded. "Thank you, Etoile." he said, rising to his feet. "I entrust you to raise Joy as your own. Treat her as you see fit. I assume I can trust you with that?"

"Of course" replied Etoile, not missing a beat.

With that said, he left the chamber to meet with Taurus who escorted him away to meet Minerva....
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Moro and Joy's reunion.

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Some minutes later, Eton was sitting in one of the bigger rooms, situated with a long table for larger amounts of guests. He had been told to wait here for two other people to arrive. Supposedly, they had once been human like him.

"Wonder what they're like" wondered Eton. He wasn't particularly happy waiting for them. He just wanted to see what all the fuss was about. Soon enough, the doors opened and he focused his attention on the guests. As he was told, it was a male Gaian and a female Aquarian.

'Wierd' thought Eton, but he kept those thoughts to himself. Tauras, who was also with them, bowed and introduced them.

“Prince Eton, may I present Adra from Olympia and Sam from Kraken."

“Please.” Politely, Eton said, “Have a seat.”

“Greetings, Prince Eton. We were told you were once human.” said the aqurian girl, Adra.

“That’s correct; I was told the same about you two as well.” Pausing, Eton said, “How about we tell our stories of how we got this way?

“That sounds like a good idea.” Chuckling, Adra said, “Who wants to go first?”

Looking at Adra, a smirk on his face, Sam said, “Ladies first.”


Adra composed herself before starting, “I was originally Paul Thomas; just your typical 22 year old guy. I was a junior in college, dating a girl named Carly Kimble. I’d hoped to marry her after we graduated but she dumped me for another girl.”

“Ouch. Tough break" said Sam, wincing.

“Yeah. “Since it was Spring Break, I rented a beach house on the Keys with some friends. Everyone, including my best friend Andy, thought I could use the time to relax.” she continued.

Looking at Adra, Eton said, “If you were a guy, how’d you end up a girl?”

“One morning I decided to go for a walk; when I heard a cry for help.”

Turning to me, Sam said, “A mermaid, right?”

“It was my sister, Hera. She’s always been curious about humans, but this time she got too close to shore and was spotted by some bank robbers.” confirmed Hera.

“I heard about that on the radio; right before I left with my father and girlfriend.” Turning to me, Sam said, “Police said they found the money, but no robbers. They said something about signs of foul play…blood on the ground.”

“That was my blood; I got shot in the stomach after luring the robbers away from Hera.” Pausing Adra continued, “She used some magic to turn the robbers into a flock of seagulls before taking me to Olympia, where she rebirthed me into who I am now.”

'Thank god I at least retained my gender' smirked Eton. He was getting better as hiding his thoughts from others, as Adra apparently didn't hear him.

Smiling, Sam said, “Wow. I’m guessing you’ve had quite the adventure since then, right?”

“You could say that.” Giggling, Adra continued, “Now it’s your turn, Sam.”
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Meeting the Others

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
'What in the world could his story be?' thought Eton with a bit of sternness. He didn't want to think ill of Sam, being formerly human and all. However, based on what others had told him about Gaians, he needed to keep his guard up at all times. He still felt like throwing up at times when he heard about their absorption rituals.

“My real name is Samuel Bane; but everyone calls me Sam.” Yawning, Sam said, “I’m 22 years old and I was a test pilot for my dad’s research company. We explored the secrets and mysteries of the oceans."

“I think I’ve heard of that company.” Surprised, Adra said, “Is your father Thomas Bane?”

“Yup.” Nodding, Sam said, “We were working on a submersible to investigate the bottom of the Puerto Rico Trench; to figure out what caused a mysterious impact about 50 years ago.”

Looking at Sam, Eton said, “What happened?”

Chuckling, Sam said, “I solved the mystery, and it changed my life.”

Adra's eyes widened and she replied, “The arrival of the Gaians!”

"I promised my girlfriend, Megan Stone, that I'd come back." Fighting tears, Sam said. "It didn’t quite work out that way; since I can never see her again.”

Megan Stone rang a bell in my mind. Looking at Sam, Adra said, “Is Megan 21 years old, with blue eyes and strawberry blond hair?”

“Ye-Yeah.” Surprised, Sam looked at Adra and said, “Why?"

“I know her, Sam; she’s my best friend’s cousin.” Pausing, Adra said, “What happened in the trench?”

“I was following the trench wall down, and I accidentally sent a small yacht deeper into the trench.” Frowning, Sam said, “I followed it down; only to discover that it had landed on a mermaid."

“A mermaid?” just then Adra remembered the Gaian’s ability to transmutate. "Oh, I see."

“I felt responsible; so I used the torch and grabbing claw to cut away at the mast. While I did that, small cracks started appearing in the windows.” Shivering, Sam said, “I’d just freed her when...”

Adra started tearing up, imagining what happened next. “You don't have to go on if it’s hurtful to remember."

'Here comes the waterworks' thought Eton. He was never into this kind of stuff, even when he was 21 years old.

“That’s just it; I don’t remember what happened. One minute the walls are cracking; then the next thing I know I’m on a table with Valdam looking at me.” Sighing, Sam said, “I was now a Gaian, and I’ve been going non-stop ever since."

“Wow.” Letting out a low whistle, Adra said, “I thought my transition was tough."

Chuckling, Sam said, “I would’ve freaked if I’d become a Gaian female."

"That goes double for me" smirked Eton, getting a slightly stern look from Adra.

Giving Sam a mocking hurt look, Adra said, “What's wrong with being female?"

"Nothing." waving his hands in defense, Sam replied. "It's just that..,"

“Relax, Sam.” Giggling, I said, “I'm only joking."

"It'd be more trouble than its worth" smirked Eton again.

"You want me to slap you?" asked a stern Adra, good-heartedly but a bit annoyed.

"Doubt you can" retorted Eton. Adra closed her eyes and composed herself, making Eton laugh to himself.

Sam sighed, giving Adra a patient smile as they turned to Eton. After all, it was his turn now.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Another story

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Composing himself, Eton looked towards Sam and Adra. “I was James Walker, a 21 year old living in Los Angeles.” Chuckling, he said, “I’ve always dreamed of flying; which is ironic now that I think of it.”

“We know what you mean.” Gesturing to Sam, Adra said, “Sam and I had a love for the ocean.”

“I was in college, hoping to get my pilot’s license after graduation.” Pausing, Eton said, “It was Spring Break and I was walking home when I heard a noise in a nearby alley. I thought it was a fight, or a mugging, so I ran to see what was going on." pausing, Eton said, "Peering around the corner, I saw three men attacking a young woman. Looking at her, I was surprised to see that she had wings, like an angel.”

“So you charged in?” smiling, Sam said, “That’s what I would’ve done.”

“A young woman was being attacked; any decent guy would’ve done the same. I took them on and eventually took down two of them.” Pausing, Eton said, “After I knocked them out, a black shadow floated out of their mouths and hissed at me before vanishing.”

“That sounds creepy, I wonder who they are?” Adra remarked, as Eton continued his story.

“I was ready to fight the last man when,” Eton’s wings turning a slight pink, he said, “He shot me with a revolver.”

“What happened next?”

“I thought I was going to die as my vision blurred; when I suddenly heard a female voice barking orders.” Sighing, Eton said, “The next thing I know I’m a young Misterian boy in the care Myrrh, the woman that I’d saved.”

"Forgive me if it's personal. But," curious, Adra said, "Why don't you call Myrrh your mom?"

"Because she's not my mom, she's my guardian."

"Oh; it's different for me." pausing, Adra said, "I was reborn, making me Hera's younger sister."

"I was reborn as well, making me her biological son." pausing, Eton said, "It was random at best; which is why I became a young Misterian boy. I simply don't want to call her 'mom'. There's only one mom out there who gave birth to me."

"You really think that?" asked Sam.

"Yes. I think even Myrrh knows that, and she accepts it. I appreciate what she's doing and I'm grateful. I just don't think I can have that sort of relationsbip with her" said Eton, resolutely.

"Sounds fair" said Sam.

"Good" said Eton, closing his eyes and nodding. Adra stared at Eton and and walked over to him. Without warning, she gave him a small slap on the head.

"Ow! What the heck was that for?!" shouted Eton.

"Would you stop being so serious? Lighten up a bit. You're kind of moody, you know that?" said Adra in a matter-of-fact tone. Eton glared at Adra. After seeing her smirk at him, he smirked himself.

"I'm not taking that laying down" said Eton. With that, he immediately jumped from his seat, pursueing Adra in laps around the room.

"Ha ha, just try and catch me!" shouted Adra.

"Well, your legs are longer and I can't really fly with such little space!" shouted Eton right back, both of them laughing the whole way.

Sam shook his head, smiling at the two of them.

"Kids" he muttered good-heartedly.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Eton's tale told

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
After everyone was all finished telling their stories, they all talked about everything they’d been through since then. Adra just finished talking about her relationship with Apollo, and I could tell Eton was shocked.

Looking at Adra, Eton said, “Are you really in a relationship already?”

“Yeah, I am.” Pausing, Adra said, “Why?”

“Don’t you think that’s a bit fast?” pausing, Eton said, “You’ve only been a mermaid for what, 2 weeks?”

“I’ll admit I was confused by my feelings at first; but Apollo and I do love each other.”

“I’m not saying you don’t love him.” Sighing, Eton said, “I’m just saying I think you moved too fast.”

Looking at Eton, Sam said, “Didn’t you ever act that like as a teenager?”

“Not really." pausing, Eton said, "I was never...really sociable as a teenager."

"Oh."

Looking Eton and Adra, Sam said, “What else should…”

Sam stopped mid-sentence, worrying Adra as she looked at him. “Sam, what’s wrong?”

Looking at Adra, Sam said, “Something’s coming.”
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Something in the Air

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Eton and Adra looked around, getting unnerved when they saw Sam’s eyes change color. Eton then said, “I don’t hear anything.”

“Me neither.” Whispering, Adra said, “Sam, are you sure?”

Sam didn’t answer, as he suddenly stepped back. Looking at him, Eton and Adra shivered as they saw his eyes turn blood red. “Look out!” lunging at an unseen target, Sam yelled, “Stay back!”

A part of Adra thought Sam was just showing off, throwing punches at the air, until a creature appeared in front of him. It was taller than they were, muscular with reddish skin and black wings. Looking at it, Adra realized it reminded her of the demons from the stories she used to read.

She screamed in terror as she backed off, with Eton standing in front of me brandishing a small sword that he kept with him. He still wasn't that good with it, having had limited practice with Etoile.

In an attempt to be brave, Eton shouted out, "Just s-stay behind m-me!". It was clear though that Eton was somewhat spooked by this encounter. It was the first time since his encounter with those three men that he was facing a real demon.

Nevertheless, Adra was touched by Eton’s bravery; although she wondered if he was a match for the creature. Meanwhile the creature slashed Sam’s arm with a large knife, causing Sam to scream in pain.
