Adra watched in awe, wishing she still had the strength she'd had as a man, as Sam slammed his fist into the creatures face.

“Does this thing ever give up?”

Her question was answered as the creature demon roared and started punching Sam with all its might. It occurred to Adra and Eton that the creature was trying to get past Sam to come after Eton and me; but Sam wouldn’t let it.

Sam and the creature fought for a few moments; until Sam was able to grab the creature and slam it onto the table. As the creature stood up, they watched as it punched Sam in the jaw; leaving him dazed.

Fearing for Sam’s safety, Adra said, “Sam! Get out of there!”

Sam ignored her pleas, striking blow after blow on the creature until it fell unconscious to the floor. Looking at it, wheezing, Sam said, “Do yourself a favor, and stay down!"

As that happened, a trio of guards entered the room. While the others took the creature into custody, one ran over to Adra and Eton and Eton. Eton was exhausted and had fallen to the ground. The look of his face was a mixture of fear and disbelief; fear of what he had just witnessed, and disbelief of how he had basically done nothing but stand there in front of Adra. What was all that training he done for? He had been trying to be stronger to better defend himself and others. Yet, he could do nothing while a complete stranger did all the work.

"Are you injured!?” asked the guard in concern.

"I'm fine." Eton said, "Sam defended us but I was ready in case he needed me." He tried putting on the bravest face possible but the guard could see what he was truly thinking about.

While the guard tended to Eton, Adra turned to Sam; only to see him stumble to floor. “Sam!?” running over, she grabbed his limp body and yelled, “Sam! Sam!!"
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Attack!!

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
It was not long before Moro had been summoned and entered the room with queen Minerva close behind. "How could a demon have gotten this far into the palace without detection!?" demanded Minerva. "Where were my guards!?"

Moro took one look at the creature and shook his head. "Gargoyle." anger in his voice, he muttered. "I thought he was killed ages ago!"

"Who?" asked Eton, sheathing his sword.

"This is not a demon but a criminal Gaian." turning to Minerva, Moro said. "He was once known as Pandora, a brilliant female scientist who was obsessed with improving our transmutation techniques." he sighed. "Only the tribunal saw her ambition as madness and banished her."

Gulping, Adra asked, "What happened to make her look like... that?"

"She continued her insane experiments in private." sighing, Moro replied. "She ultimately became a twisted and evil man, resembling the form you would see as a demon." turning to Eton, he said, "I do not know how he got to Earth but he has our technology so he can become invisible so long as his concentration holds up. That said, as he is not a demon, you could not sense him coming."

"That makes sense." nodding, Eton said. "I did not sense him coming but I did sense he was after Adra, that's why I drew my sword, in case he got passed you.

"Why would he be after me!?" startled, Adra asked.

"If what Moro is saying is true, this Gargoyle wishes to expand on his transmutation ability." explaining, Eton said. "He already has wings so I assume he can fly..."

"But he can't be underwater for long." turning pale, Adra said.

"You will have no further worries regarding this one, he has committed a crime on Misterian land, we will deal with him." sternly, Minerva said. "In the mean time, I strongly suggest you tend to your fallen friend and quickly take him back to Kraken or Olympia." sighing, she added, "Sadly, we have no facilities to tend to an injured Gaian."

Moro looked over Sam's injuries and quickly took him into his arms. "Olympia is closer." quickly, he said. "I can help him but we must be quick, the poison on Gargoyle's sword is known to have very cruel effects."

Not wanting to find out what those effects were, Adra nodded and followed him out of the palace to the shuttle with Minerva, Eton, and a number of guards following. "Safe journey, Adra and Moro." said Minerva, politely. "Farewell."

"Not what I would call a pleasant visit." jumping into the tank, Adra muttered. "Will Sam be alright?"

Moro pulled some sort of bed with a medical station out from the wall and placed Sam onto the bed. "It's hard to tell." strapping Sam in, he said. "It depends upon how much poison got into his veins and how strong his immune system is."

Without another word, Moro ran to the controls and piloted the shuttle away from the landing pad before making its way down towards the ocean waters.

"Well, that was....interesting" said Eton. Minerva turned to him.

"Has your opinion on the Gaians changed at all?" inquired Minerva.

"Well, that's a little complicated. Sam was formerly human, so I don't know if he counts. Moro seems credible enough though. I suppose I probably would need to meet more of them to have a better understanding" said Eton.

"Good attitude" said Minerva. Then, she added, "Now, why don't you go find one of your friends. I have more business to take care of."

"Sheesh, more and more business. I'm glad I don't have your job" sneered Eton.

"Watch it, you might have it eventually" smirked Minerva right back at him.

"Ha ha, I'll pass, thank you very much!" laughed Eton. He honestly couldn't imagine himself as a future ruler of Skyaira. It wasn't quite his style.

*****In a corridor in the castle*****

"Well, that was fun" said Joy with a smile as she walked down a corridor of the castle. She was another level of happiness now. She finally got to meet her father, who accepted who she was now, and she was now in very capable hands. What could possibly bring her down now?

The answer came just a few seconds later.

"I couldn't agree more.....Gaian" said a feminine voice from the shadows. Joy jumped about 5 feet in the air and looked around, startled that someone was following her. She didn't have to look far. From behind her, walked a Misterian female about her age. A very familar girl who wore her dark brown hair in a ponytail.

"K-Karis!"
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Aftermath of the battle

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
"Guess it was just like I thought. I figured that you couldn't have been human before" said Karis.

Joy flinched as the young girl apparoached her. Joy knew that Karis was a very serious and often violent individual. Not only that, she didn't take well to liers or traitors of any kind. Her unnatural violet eyes bore into Joy, like she was seeing in her soul or something. It was truly frightening.

"H-How did you know?! I-I was sure nobody knew!" stammered Joy, slowly backing away from Karis. Karis smirked in return.

"Something seemed off from you from the beginning. I can tell certain things about a person from the tone of their voice. Yours always seemed unsure when you brought up your "human" life. Not only that, we've had humans reborn before and they've always looked like us. Your darker skin from the beginning was a dead giveaway to me that you weren't who you were saying you were. Most others will pass it off as something from a human life. However, I'm more perceptive than that" explained Karis.

Joy looked downcast. Her secret was out, and she didn't know what to do. She knew how others viewed her race, so she kept it hidden for as long as she could.

"Not only that, to finally get my answers, I eavesdropped on your conversation with your dear daddy" smirked Karis, making Joy look up in surprise again.

"Y-You w-were there?! N-Nobody sensed anything!" wondered Joy.

"I'm just good at stealth. Queen Minerva probably felt me but I guess she didn't have a problem with me knowing. She probably figured that people would know eventually" said Karis. She then took a deep breath before going further, "Now that that's settled, what to do with you?"

Joy gulped as she felt her back against the stone wall. The dark-haired Misterian had her cornered! Joy closed her eyes and braced herself for whatever Karis had planned.

It surprised her when she simply felt a small bop on her head. She opened her eyes to see Karis standing in front of her, a blank and unreadable expression on her face.

"However, I've noticed that, aside from your lying, you seem to be a genuine good person. That's why I never said anything earlier. If you had done anything to make yourself seem like a threat to me or my friends, I would have smashed your face in" said Karis, tightening her fist in front of Joy to get her point across.

"That being said, you haven't done anything wrong, so I guess we're cool" said Karis, a small smile on her face, but the prior threat still lingering on her face. Joy gathered her courage and spoke up.

"I-I assure you, I mean nobody any harm! I just want to be accepted and make friends!" said Joy, as convincingly as she could. Karis' expression didn't change.

"Like I said, we're cool. However, it's not my reaction you should be worried about" said Karis.

"What do you mean?" asked Joy.

"Eton and the others are the ones you should worry about. I don't know about Ewol and Hal and such, but I'm sure Eton's opinion will mean a lot to you. If I were you, I wouldn't draw this out much longer. His opinion is a little less negative after seeing your dad. You might want to take advantage of this" warned Karis.

Joy lowered her head in thought. What was she to do?
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Knowing the truth

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
"All right, let's go find him now" said Joy, resolutely.

"Good choice" said Karis as she accompanied Joy down the corridor, walking off in search of Eton. Likely, after thw fiasco with the meeting, he was out looking for others to hang out with.

*****Outside the palace*****

"So, how was it?" asked Ewol.

"It was ok. Certainly some wierd characters. One of them has only been female for about 2 weeks and is already mated with someone" said Eton.

"Yikes, so glad I don't have those feelings. Thankfully, we Misterians don't have those emotional problems that Aquarians have" stated Ewol.

"True" replied Eton. Right now, Eton was joined by Lea and Hal, in addition to Ewol. He was currently telling them of the events back in the castle. He also told them about Moro and about how he seemed like a credible guy. The others took that with a grain of salt but accepted it anyway.

"Hey guys!" yelled Karis as she and Joy approached the gang. Joy was internally battling with herself. One part wanted to wait, while another wanted to talk now. However, it was pretty clear that she wan't to get it out of the way now. The group's reaction would only worsen with time.

"What's up Karis?" asked Hal, as the two girls approached.

"Not bad. Joy here has a little confession to make" said Joy. Joy blushed at Karis' statement but walked up anyway.

"Is this something most of us should leave for?" asked Ewol, thinking that Joy had a "private thought" about Eton that she wanted to tell him. Karis promptly bopped him on the head.

"It's not that, you idiot!" reprimanded Karis. Ewol sheepishly got up, rubbing his injured head. As amusing as the scene was, all eyes were on Joy now.

"So, what is it?" asked Eton. Joy fumbled with her words a bit before trying to get something coherent out.

"Well....you, um......know that Gaian guy from the palace?" asked Joy, trying to start this off on the right foot.

"You mean Moro? Yeah, I know him. Doesn't seem as bad as I figured he would be. Why?" asked Eton. Joy fumbled with her words even more, and some were starting to wonder if she was having mental troubles. Soon enough however, the words came out.

"H-He's.....my dad" spoke Joy. Her tone was very soft and hard to hear, but everyone heard it.

"SAY WHAT?!! YOUR DAD?!!" yelled Ewol, loud enough to almost break everyone's ear drums. Joy winced the accusation but nodded.

"Wait, so if you're serious, that would mean that you were..." started Hal, before everyone, including Eton, came to the same conclusion. Needless to say, the tension in the air rose as Ewol crossed his arms and glared at Joy, who took a step back in fear. Notably, the entire group seemed a little frustrated, including Eton.

"You better have a good explanation for this" threatened Hal. Joy gulped at the threat but she told them her story. She told them about how she ended up as a Misterian girl, leading to the revelation that she was once male as well.

"Hmm, well normally, I would smash something in right now" started Ewol, making Joy tremble that they were going to gang up on her. However, he visably toned it down. "However, like Karis said, you haven't shown us any reason to believe you're not a good person, so I'll let it slide as long as you're good. You play nice and we'll play nice" said Ewol, smiling a bit, although it still contained slight apprehension. After all, it wasn't easy to get over the shared hate of the Gaians.

"Ewol pretty much said everything I would have said" said Eton, smiling a bit as well. Joy sighed in relief as the group accepted her revelation far better than she imagined.

"Thank you" she said in gratitude. While the rest of the group gave small smiled to her, Eton turned away and placed a head on his face.

"What's wrong?" asked Karis.

"I think I need therapy. I can't believe my first kiss was with someone that was male just a couple days ago. Know anyone good with memory erasing?" asked Eton, mostly serious.

Needless to say, Ewol and Hal broke out in laughter, while Karis and Lea just giggled. Joy massively blushed.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: No more secrets

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
A week passed by relatively quickly in Skyaira.

After Joy'd confession, a barrage of new questions began to arose. Karis brought up that Joy would have to more quickly learn the ways of Misterians. After all, hitting someone in the back of the head was NOT the best way to meet an angel. In addition to learning how to act as a girl, Joy had her work cut out for her.

In addition, Eton had told them of the gargoyle incident. Everyone was shocked as how someone so twisted could be around, even for a Gaian.

"Hopefully, that guy is properly punished" stated Hal.

"Relax, I'm sure Minerva will take care of it" said Eton.

"Hard to believe it used to be a regular female and is now some twisted guy" said Lea.

"Technology can be just as frightening as it is intriguing" stated Hal, to everyone's agreement.

Anyway, they heard not much from what the fate the Gargoyle man endured at the castle dungeons. Eton didn't really want to know what kind of punishment Minerva was enacting on it.

That aside, the week passed by with the group trying to get Joy more accustomed to their ways. Lea was mostly put in charge of instructing Joy when Etoile was busy. Speaking of which, Joy moved into Etoile's house near the castle. Things were going lovely for her so far.

Meanwhile, Eton continued to train harder with the sword. He couldn't take what happened before lying down. He had to get stronger. The fact that he was a kid now was no excuse. He had to be better than that. So, he continued his training with Etoile and on his free time as well, not quite paying attention much in school, which drew some disappointment from Myrrh.

Also, during the week, Karis approached Etoile with the intention of asking her to take her as an apprentice as well. Etoile wasn't sure about taking two students, but she was sure that Eton and Karis would learn better by competing with each other. So, she accepted her proposal.

With the Gaian meeting behind him, it was time for more stories Skyaira to begin.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: A week later

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
"Phew, what a workout!" sighed Eton as he plopped down on a seat and opened up his lunch. He had just gotton out from an hour in the training hall. Man, was he starving!

"You looked pretty good in there" said a female voice from behind him. Eton smiled as he turned around to see Karis behind him, holding a lunch of her own. She walked over to Eton's seat.

"Mind if I join you?" she asked sincerely.

"Sure, why not" replied Eton, allowing Karis to take a seat next to him. She sat down and began to open her own lunch.

"So, you saw me in there?" asked Eton.

"Yeah, you've gotton better. Most kids are still too freaked out to last so long in the hall" said Karis.

"Well, I have seen more things than they have. Although. I've noticed you don't fear it as well" said Eton.

"Well, I better. If I want to be Flightleader someday" stated Karis in a matter-of-fact tone.

"Flightleader?" asked Eton.

"Oh, I guess no one told you yet. The Flightleader is the leader of the Valkyries. You could almost say that the Flightleader is the Number 2 woman in Skyaira, the highest ranking general so to speak. I want to be that strong one day. So, I'm going to be the youngest Flightleader ever!" said Karis, her excitement showing in the brightness of her wings, making Eton laugh.

"Ha ha, I see. Well, you certainly have the drive for it. So, who's the current Flightleader?" asked Eton.

"Her name is Sigrun. She's by far one of the most talented warriors in the world. She's the ultimate ideal for female fighters. She commands with grace and strength" said Karis, in an admiring tone.

"Sounds like quite a woman. Have you met her?" asked Eton. His question seemed to catch her off guard, as she stumbled over her next words.

"Um....yes....I guess" said Karis, looking down.

"What's wrong?" asked Eton.

"Oh, nothing" said Karis, a smile returning to her face. Eton didn't buy it but he let it go.

"Anyway, that's not the reason I wanted to talk to you. I found something very cool off the coast of Skyaira. I was thinking that you'd like to see it. It's only visable at night so we'd have to go then" said Karis.

"At night? Wouldn't that be dangerous?" asked Eton.

"We'll be fine. We're both strong enough to take on anything" said Karis, giving Eton a pat on the shoulder. He somewhat agreed with her. Whatever Karis was planning, he was interested for sure.

"All right, let's do it. However, if we get caught, I'm blaming you" smirked Eton.

"Fine. Just know that you're going to get it from me if you do" retorted Karis. Both of stared at each other in the face for a few seconds before erupting in laughter. After they somewhat calmed down, they ate the rest of their lunch in peace.

Eton was still apprehensive about this, but he was confident that could handle it.

"So, how's training Joy going?" asked Eton.

"Going well, sort of. Apparently, Gaians greet each other by slapping their heads. Unfortunately, she did that with Ewol, and he nearly strangled her. It was kind of funny actually" laughed Karis, while Eton sheepishly grinned.

"Anyway, at least she's finalyl starting school. Old habits will be hard to break. Also, I told her that you used to be a 22 year old human. She looked disgusted at that revelation" Karis continued to laugh.

"Well, if that's the case, perhaps Ewol's prediction about the two of us getting together might not come true" said Eton.

"Well, it certainly won't if you both keep thinking about the circumstances of who you used to be. Maybe it'll be easier later on in your lives" said Karis.

"Who knows. Things stick around in my head for quite some time" laughed Eton, causing Karis to laugh with him.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Karis' Idea

choices: Wrong place at the wrong time
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Night soon fell upon Skyaira. Everyone was already in bed, with it being past midnight and all. Eton remembered where Karis had said to meet her, and stealthily climbed through his window and out into the cold night air. Even in a warmer climate like Skyaira, nights were pretty cold. Luckily, Misterians had their own versions of winter gear so it was easy to bundle up.

Since Eton was more adept at flying now, he flew away from his room in the castle, descending down to the mainland where Karis was waiting. Soon enough, he found her waiting near an edge of land. With slight differences, Eton thought she looked like a skier girl.

"You got out fine?" asked Karis.

"Yep, all clear. A bit easier than I thought it would be. Aren't there archangels and valkyries that have night watches and such?" asked Eton.

"Yes. However, most Misterians aren't crazy enough to fly at night at this time of year. It's especially cold during the spring. Anyway, we should be good though. Just stay with me and we'll be fine. I've gone there many times" said Karis.

"If you say so" said Eton. With that, both of them took off from the ground, flying into the dark clouds. However, unfortunately, they had neglected to know what a storm was brewing in that night. A rather violent one at that.

"Hold my hand so we don't get lost" said Karis, offering her gloved hand to Eton. Eton told it gratefully. He still hadn't mastered flying so it was a good precaution. As he took Karis' hand, it reminded him often of when he was really a kid with Nate and Erin. Erin always liked to hold hands with Eton when he was still James. It was her way of making sure nobody ever got lost. Eton felt touched by this moment.

However, he shook out of it when Karis started tapping his shoulder.

"There, there!! Look!" shouted Karis, redirecting Eton's eyes to where she wanted. Needless to say, it was a beautiful sight. It was an aurora borealis, one that somehow made it's way to where Skyaira generally was. However, seeing it from a Misterian's view, the starry background only added to the majesty of it all. Truely, it was beautfiul.

"Wow Karis, that's amazing! Where did you find such a spot?" asked Eton.

"I found it while flying around at night a few months ago. It's kind of like my own secret view. Pretty huh?" asked Karis.

"Yeah" muttered Eton. He looked to his right and his eyes widened again. The lights of the aurora seemed to reflect off of Karis as well, adding a sense of grand sereneness to her. Eton's face blushed at the sight, but he quickly shook his head.

'No need for that now! I've already got enough issues on that topic! he mentally reprimanded himself.

"Did you say something?" asked Karis, picking up on his mental thoughts but not entirely sure what he said.

"Oh, it's nothing" he quickly denied. Karis decided to let it go after that.

Too bad the gentle moment between the two would soon be violently interrupted.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: That Night

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
As the two of them admired the scenery, Karis spoke up. "Well, I think we should head back. Everyone will probably realize our absense before too long."

"Good point" said Eton. Just as they turned around however, the scenery began to darken to a level that Eton had never witnessed. Everything was becomign pitch black, and very little light could be seen.

"What's happening?" asked Eton, beginning to worry. However, Karis was even more worried.

"Oh no! I forget to check the weather report for tonight!" she yelled out.

"What do you mean?!" yelled Eton right back.

"Apparently, there's a storm coming tonight. And it looks to be a rather violent one, given the darkness. Not many can take this kind of storm! If we don't get back in a hurry, the storm will eat us alive, figuratively speaking!" yelled Karis, extreme worry evident on her face.

"Well, let's go!" yelled Eton as they grabbed hands again and tried to find their way back. However, soon enough, huge bolts of lightning stuck, and heavy rain began to pour. The rain hampered their progress, making their wings feel heavier than normal.

"Just hold on tight!" yelled Eton as he tried to press forward. His wings were a bit stronger than Karis' were so he tried the most to push them forward. However, the rain soon became the smallest of their worries as the wind also began picking up.

The winds were almost tornado-like, given their altitude. Eton's wings were strong but no where near enough to take tornado-force winds. Struggling to keep their hands together, the two began getting tossed and turned by the ragin winds and rain.

"AHHHHHHHHHHHH!!" yelled Eton as he stuggled to hold on to Karis' hand. If they got separated now, who knows where they would end up. Looking at Karis, he saw the most frightened face he had ever seen on any girl. Her face had vastly paled by now, almost making her look a ghost. Eton figured that they would probably BE ghosts soon unless they escaped.

It was no use though. They weren't nearly strong enough to resist the storm's wrath.

Struggling to stay together, Eton felt a pair of arms surround his body. He opened his eyes wide enough to see Karis holding onto his body for dear life!

"Please, don't let me go!" she yelled, barrying her face into his shoulder. Eton could swear he saw tears streaming down Karis' pale face, although it could just be the rain. At that moment, he embraced her as well. They couldn't decide were to go right now. Their fate was at the mercy of the winds and rain.

The two of them continued tossing and turning at the winds, the rain coming down hard and large bolts of lightning barely missing their bodies. It was fair to say they both thought they were going to die that night.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: The Storm

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
As both Eton and Karis had their eyes closed, neither could really see what was going on. Neither of them noticed a small figure moving at fast speeds towards them.

'Of all times, such recklessness' thought the unidentified figured as it flew towards the couple, streaking through the howling winds as if it was but a minor obstacle.

The figure flew up to Eton and Karis, embracing the two of them. The couple felt a couple of strong arms embrace them, but they were both too frightened to open their eyes. Sensing this, the figure gripped them tightly and manuevered their way away from the storm, getting back to the safer haven that was Skyaira.

*****A few minutes later*****

Soon enough, Eton and Karis could barely heard the howling winds and rain, and they both slowly opened their eyes. They saw the dark storm in the distance, but they were clearly in a safe area now. After getting their senses back, they looked around. They were safely back in Skyaira.

"You know, the hugging is very touching, but I think you can both let go now" spoke a feminien voice. Eton and Karis looked at each other finally, seeing them both still tangled up from when they were clinging to each other for dear life. With massive blushes on both of their faces, they separated, to the slight amusment of their savior.

"Well, not quite the way you want to date a man, won't you agree?" spoke the voice. Eton and Karis turned their heads to the user of the voice. While Karis' face paled in horror, Eton's jaw dropped. Before them was a stunningly beautiful woman, clad in armor befitting a valkyrie. However, her armor was pale, and glistened in the moonlight, as if it was made of a different quality from the normal valkyrie armor. Her long dark brown hair framed her face and flowed down her back. A sowrd was fastened at her waist and she wore mint green clothes underneath the armor. Her eyes were a fascinating violet.

"Are you the one who saved us?" asked Eton. The woman gave a small smile and nodded gently.

"Yes, I am. I'm glad that I happened to be on night watch tonight. Not many can sense a couple of Misterian kids during a thunderstorm of that magnitude" she explained.

"I see. Well, thank you very much ma'am. What's your name?" asked Eton, trying to be as polite as possible. The woman smiled again.

"I am Sigrun" said the woman. Eton's eyes widened at her words. Sigrun?! As in the Flightleader of the valkyries?!

"Y-You're the leader of the valyries?! I'm so sorry you had to concern yourself with our trouble" said Eton, politely. Sigrun smiled yet again.

"It's no problem, Prince Eton. Consider it a good learning experience. Making sure others are safe is part of my duty after all" said Sigrun. However, at that moment, her face and eyes became stern as she directed her gaze to Karis. Karis' face, if possible, paled even more than before.

"Karis!" yelled Sigrun, startling Karis. "I believe I've told you many times about being fully prepared before doing something reckless. What you did tonight almost got you both killed. Where would Skyaira be the prince of all people died because of you?!"

"I-I'm so sorry ma'am!" pleaded Karis, barely able to face eye contact with the woman. Sigrun's gaze became even more stern.

"You do realize what this means, right? You better be prepared for the consequences of doing such reckless things that endanger both yourself and your friends. I thought I taught you far better than that" stated Sigrun, your stern gaze never wavering.

"Yes, ma'am" said Karis again.

"Karis" said Sigrun, drawing out the name as if she wanted something specific from her. Karis' head dropped even lower in shame.

"U-Understood................mother" said Karis after a long pause.

If Eton's eyes could possibly get any bigger, they just did.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Saved at the last minute

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
"SAY WHAT?!!!!" yelled Eton, his voice echoing around. Karis almost had to cover her ears.

"Prince Eton, please tone it down. We don't want to wake the whole city up" said Sigrun, a small smile on her face. Still surprised, Eton turned to Karis.

"The Flightleader is your mom?" asked Eton, as calmly as he could.

"Y-Yes" replied Karis. Sigrun smirked.

"Oh, so she never told you. Well, she doesn't seem happy to ever talk about it" said Sigrun, lightly chuckling to herself.

"M-Mom! It's not like that!" replied Karis with an indignant look. Sigrun chuckled a bit more before her face became stern again.

"Well, that's enough of that. You both need to be in bed. Karis, we're also going to have a talk, yes?" said Sigrun, asking a question she already knew the answer to.

"Yes, mother" said Karis, pretty much accepting what was going to happen to her.

Without another word, the three of them split off to their respective homes.

*****The Next Day*****

"Karis!" yelled Eton as he ran across the land to where Karis was standing. After going to bed, Eton decided that he wanted to inquire further about Karis and learn more about her. The fact that her own mother was the Flightleader and he never figured that out showed him just how little about her he knew. He was commited to changing that.

"Oh, hello Eton! Nice day isn't it?" asked Karis with a smile. Eton smiled and looked at her. Her clothing today was a little more casual than normal. Her lilac top was shaped like a t-shirt (with the upper part of the back exposed for her wings) and she wore simple thin tan shorts and boots. She honestly looked....cute, to Eton's slight embaressment.

"It is wonderful. May we talk?" asked Eton. Karis' smile wavered a bit, but she nodded. She pretty much expected him to say that. After agreeing, the two walked to a nearby ledge and sat down, allowing their legs to swing over the edge. After living here for a little more than 2 weeks, Eton no longer really feared falling.

"So, I guess the secret's out" said Karis, likely referring to her mother.

"Yeah, I never would have guessed that your mom was the Flightleader. That's pretty cool, Karis!" said Eton, trying to cheer her up. Karis gave Eton a small smile and then looked down at the clouds.

"It kind of is. I'm not really sure though" said Karis. Eton looked at her with an incredulous look.

"Why is that? It must be pretty cool to have a close family member so well respected" said Eton. Karis looked straight at him.

"Yes, it is. However, that also means higher expectations are placed on the offspring of such a well respected person" sighed Karis. Eton was confused for a second before a light bulb went of in his head and he understood. She was talking about herself.

"I see" said Eton.

"My mother is the strongest female warrior here. Because of that, everyone expects me to be the best fighter in school. The problem is that I'm not the best. And when you're not the best, with such expectation, you get picked on a lot" said Karis, closing her eyes and allowing her memories to roam. Eton's memory awareness had been improving and he could see the images Karis wanted to show him.

Her life was pretty rough. Everyone had placed high expectations on her from pretty much the time she would walk and talk. Trying to live up to those expectations created a hard and serious exterior on the outside, but on the inside, there lived a scared individual who was quite frightened of other people's perception of her.

"I always try to shove aside my doubts, thinking that everything will just turn out alright. But, whenever I think I'm on the right track, I always seem to fall short. I'm good in many subjects, but I'm not the best" she said, allowing her head to rest on her hands. "Sometimes, I hate myself for it, because I can't just be myself."

Eton felt incredible sympathy for Karis. He had no idea what he would do if people placed those kinds of expectations on him.

"So, when you told me that you wanted to be the youngest Flightleader ever?" asked Eton. Karis sighed and looked at him.

"Well, I do want to be Flightleader some day, but I just don't know if I'll ever be good enough" she said as she closed her eyes again. Eton could see her eyes twitching slightly, as if she was trying to withhold tears.

What surprised Eton even more was how open Karis was being with him. He barely knew anything about her before this conversation.

"Karis, if I may ask, why are you telling me all this? I've barely known you" said Eton, with a tone of sadness. He was dissappointed that he couldn't do more to comfort her. However, as he looked at Karis, he could see a ghost of a smile on her face.

"Because I trust you. You're a good person, Eton. I've seen the things you've done and I would trust you with my life if I needed to" said Karis. Eton was surprised once again by her words. Yet, he was also warmed that someone had so much trust in him. In some ways, Karis kind of reminded him of Erin.

"You're really the first person who has really bothered to listen to me" said Karis, looking down again and trying to keep her composure. Eton decided right there that he wanted to help her, to allow her to know that she had someone supporting her. With that in mind, he gently hugged her. Karis gasped in surprise as her head rested on his right shoulder.

"I thank you for trusting me this much Karis. I assure you that I will be there to help you. After all, you've been a great help in showing me how to live here. It's the least I could do" he said. Karis buried her face into Eton's shoulder, hoping to hide the massive blush on her face. Despite that, she smiled, a couple tears flowing her face.

"Thank you" said Karis, her arms gently wrapping around Eton's torso as the two enjoyed a peaceful embrace. If anyone had been watching, it would have been one of most touching scenes between friends you would have ever seen.

After slowly separating, they got up from their seating position and looked out over the ledge, just looking at the clouds. As they did, Karis turned and, with a sweet smile, placed a small peck on Eton's check, causing both of them to blush.

'Way to go man. Your sappy nature just got you into a deeper hole!' Eton mentally repimanded himself. Then again, when he turned to see Karis giving him her usual bright smile, part of him thought it was worth it.

"So, you want to go do something?" asked Eton, wanting to go do something else. Karis' face dropped.

"Sorry. I can't" said Karis.

"Why not?" asked Eton. As he asked that, a sheepish smile appeared on Karis' face.

"In human terms, my mom grounded me" she stated. After a couple seconds to let it sink in, the two friends broke out in laughter, enjoying the happy moments between them.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: The Flightleader's Daughter

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
After Eton bid farewell to Karis, he decided on taking another walk through the mainland. Supposedly, Karis wasn't allowed to do certain things while she was grounded. Her earlier conversation with Eton was probably the most he would hear of her for the next week.

"So, what should I do now?" asked Eton to himself. Suddenly, he heard a loud screech, which immediately caused him to cover his ears. It had to have been one of the msot disturbing screams he had ever heard.

"What the devil was that?!" wondered Eton out loud. It almost sounded like a baby's cry, if it weren't for the really loud part. Eton decided to investigate and follow where he heard the cry. Eventually, he started hearing voices.

"Please calm down Luna! It's ok. I'm here for you!" pleaded a young male voice. Eton rounded up the hill and spotted two young figures. One was a male, probably around 7 years old with brown hair and eyes of the same color. In his arms, he was trying to cradle an infant, who Eton assumed was the source of the cry.

"Is there something I can help you with?" offered Eton as he approached the couple. The boy turned to look at Eton and jumped a bit.

"Oh, you're Prince Eton, aren't you? N-No need to worry about me! I can take care of this!" pleaded the boy. Eton chuckled a bit at the boy's actions.

"No need to be so formal about it. I'd prefer it if you adressed me as you normall would. So, what's your name?" asked Eton.

"Oh, I'm Alain. I'm seven years old" introduced Alain.

"Pleasure. So, who's the kid?" asked Eton, smiling while looking at the infant in Alain's arms. The infant shared Alain's hair and eye color, and seemed to be squirming quite a bit.

"This is my little sister, Luna. She's only 5 months old. She's generally very quiet, but she has a hell of a scream, which you might already know" Alain laughed sheepishly.

"Heh heh, I see. She's a cutie" remakred Eton.

"Yeah, she looks a lot like Mom. I have to take care of her often. Dad is always on business trips to other cities and Mom works in the market all day, so it's really just me" said Alain, to which Eton nodded.

Suddenly, Luna squirmed out of Alain's arms. Eton attempted to catch her and keep her from falling. However, it wasn't necessary as Luna was softly flying in the air. She wasn't doing a lot of moving but she was easily floating in the air.

"Woah! She can fly already?!" asked Eton in surprise. Myrrh had told him that Misterians generally take a year to become strong enough to fly on their own. The fact that an infant of only 5 months was doing this was remarkable.

"Yeah, she's a natural. She's probably the only one who can fly at her age" said Alain, as he reached out for Luna. However, Luna suddenly swerved to the right, giggling to herself.

"Not this again! Come back here! Mom will kill me if you're hovering around when she gets back!" yelled Alain, taking to the air himself to try and catch Luna. Eton chuckled at the scene. What a lovely sibling relationship.

"Well, it was great talking to you, Eton! Let's do this again sometime! You know, when Luna isn't driving me batty!" yelled Alain as he went after Luna. Eton waved good bye to his new friend.

"Guess there are many more things I need to see and learn" muttered Eton to himself. He was fine with that though. After all, he had all the time in the world to learn it all
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Meeting Alain

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Needless to say, things had been interesting in Skyaira over the past couple of weeks.

Eton felt even more comfortable in Skyaira, having gotton down all the customs. There weren't many so it wasn't exactly hard. He practiced daily with his sword, hoping to get better. He still hadn't asked Etoile for more sword practice since she was probably too busy with Joy.

Speaking of which, Joy had pretty much merged into Misterian society. After the incident in which she hit Ewol in the back of the head, she didn't take long to take note of the Misterian traditions. Word spread quickly about her being a former Gaian, but most were actually able to accept her, given that she was one of them now.

Adding to this, training Joy in Misterian customs was part of Kari's two-week grounding. Today was the day she was finally off her punishment. During this week, Eton offered to help Karis is teaching Joy the customs of Skyaira. Needless to say, Eton and Karis began to bond closer during this time. When he first met her, Eton didn't see much more than a warrior girl. Now, he had gotten to know Karis the girl. Ewol often smirked when he saw them together. He could see the seeds of romance beginning in them both. Of course, given how hopeless they all were, they would probably need some pushes in the right direction.

"Karis!" yelled Eton as he glided onto the mainland, having gotten even better at flying, although he was not a master yet. Karis waved and greeted him, wearing her casual clothing.

"Hello Eton. I'm so glad to finally be off my punishment" said Karis, sheepishly giggling.

"Yeah, me too. What have you been doing today so far?" asked Eton.

"Well, I finally got to ask Etoile if I could train under her. She said yes" said Karis, beaming. Eton's jaw dropped but he beamed as well.

"Oh, so you're going to train with me now? Cool" said Eton.

"Yes, it is. Joy has also integrated into our society quickly. I don't think I have to show her much anymore. She almost acts like a proper Misterian now" said Karis.

"What makes you say that?" asked Eton.

"I'm hearing some of the guys are quite taken with her. That wouldn't be happening if they still thought of her as a Gaian" said Karis, giggling at the thought of it.

"Ain't that nice. As if she doesn't have enough on her mind" said Eton. After that, they both heard voices from a ways away. It was Ewol, Hal, Lea, and Joy waiting for them.

"What's up guys?" asked Eton as they all gathered together.

"Something cool. We're going to explore something no one has done before" said Ewol. Everyone turned their eyes to him, wondering what he meant.

"What are you talking about?" asked Hal.

"Follow me and you'll find out. It's not too far off the coast of the mainland, but there's alot of cloud cover where it is. It's still not too hard to find though. I happened to come across it a few days ago" said Ewol.

"Really? Well, lead the way" said Joy with a bit of a smirk.

"Gladly" said Ewol as he raced forward and flew into the air after jumping off the edge. Everyone want to see just what hehad discovered so they all followed after him.

Instinctively, Karis gently held on to Eton's hand, just to make sure he didn't fall. He smiled in gratitude.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: 2 Weeks Later

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
It was morning and Joy met Karis, making her way to school. It was her first day, taking a week to grow accustomed to being a Misterian girl, and she wanted to make a good first impression on the other kids. Upon seeing Karis, she rose her hand to greet her but Karis stopped her. "No, no, Joy." she said, firmly but kindly. "Remember, we talked about that."

"Oh yeah." said Joy, blushing. "Old habits are hard to break, I guess."

Karis sighed. "I know you mean well, Joy." she said. "Still, you have to learn that we do things much differently here."

"I know." sighing, Joy said. "I am trying."

"You're doing a lot better than last week." said Karis, comforting her. "Ewol wanted to strangle you when you 'greeted' him the day after that attack." she giggled. "Don't worry, I told him it was for him laughing at you when you fell onto Eton."

"Karis, I'm nervous." said Joy, suddenly. "News of where I am from has had to have spread by now..."

"You'll be fine, Joy." said Karis. "Just remember that we greet each other like the humans. A simple "hello" will do. Slap someoen and they'll get the wrong impression. I'm sure there are a lot of crazy things you are used to, we will help you learn our ways."

"Thanks, Karis." said Joy. "You're a good friend."

"I'll stay a good friend as long as you do the same." replied Karis, seriously. "Friends do not keep secrets from each other, no matter what." she paused, then added. "On that note, you should know that Eton used to be human man around 22 years old."

"He was human man?" asked Joy, surprised. her face hardened. "And you're preaching about not keeping secrets?"

"Hey, easy!" warned Karis, sternly. "It's something we just don't think about, okay? Don't take it personally!" she sighed, trying to see Joy's side. "Look, I'm sorry we didn't tell you earlier, consider us even on that point."

Joy sighed, then nodded. "Fair enough." she said. "It's just that I kissed a guy who was once more than twice my age." she made a face. "Ewww!"

Karis laughed as they continued to walk. "It's all a matter of perspective, I guess." she said. "We'll treat you right, don't worry about it. Just try to remember that you are the new kid here, even Eton had some troubles."

Joy managed a small grin. "I'll try."
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Joy's training begins

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
As Etoile led Joy to the school for her first day, she giggled, seeing Joy's eyes wide with childish wonder as she looked at everything around her. "I wonder if Eton acted like this on his first day." she thought, privately.

As they drew closer, Joy gasped upon seeing the school, her eyes growing even wider. "It- It's beautiful!" she whispered.

http://www.sanacionysalud.com/uploads/sk...

Karis, who had accompanied them, laughed. "That's your new school." she said, smiling. "But this is only school, wait until I show you some of the other sites... if you behave yourself, that is."

"I'll be good." replied Joy, quickly. "You show me around after school?"

Etoile smiled. "We'll see." she said.

Upon landing, Joy was greeted by Runi, who had changed his gender and clothes to look like his sister, Runa. "Hi, there!" he said, smiling. "I'm Runa."

Joy took 'her' hand and giggled. "Hello... Runa." she said, blushing. "Sorry but Runa is a strange name for a boy."

Runi immediately changed back, including his clothing, stunned. "How did you know I was really Runi?" he demanded, almost pouting. It was his favorite game to trick the new kid in school.

Joy blushed even more. "Gaians have to ability to change their bodies, we call it transmutation." she replied. "Even as a Misterian, I can sense when someone has changed recently."

Runi blushed brightly as the real Runa came up, giggling. "It looks like we're going to have to work a lot harder to fool this one, bro." she said, amused. "It's a pleasure to meet you, Joy." she paused. "Is it true?... You used to be, well..."

Joy nodded. "I was once a Gaian boy named Coy." said Joy to Runi and Runa's gasps. "I was accidentally sent through a teleporter machine they were still working on and became a Misterian girl." she sobbed slightly. "Only it was a one way trip, I can never return. If I try, it will... kill me."

Runa's wings turned a shade of blue, feeling sorry for the girl before her. "Oh, Joy." she said. "What of your parents?"

Joy shook her head. "Th- They ga- gave m- me-e up." she said, her wings a full blue color. "Etoile ado- adopted me."

"They gave you up?" asked Ewol, his wings turning a slight shade of red. "What!?"

"Joy's parents had no choice." said Etoile, comforting her new daughter. "They could not live here as their ideals would poison our society but Joy is young enough to learn a new way of living, if you give her a chance."

"We already promised her that chance." said Karis, nodding to Joy. "She's off to a good start."

Etoile nodded. "Well, I can see you are in good hands, Joy." she said. "Try not to worry and have a good first day."

With that, she flew off, leaving Joy on the floating island with her new classmates. "I'll try, mo... Etoile." whispered Joy.

"Not comfortable calling her 'mom'?" asked Karis. "Give it time."

Joy nodded then followed the others into the school where she was introduced to her class as a child 'rescued' from the city of Kraken, making her tear up slightly. Only she discovered why it was worded that way quickly.

"Where you a prisoner there?" asked one student.

"No, I was born there." replied Joy. "It's really a spaceship, as far as I understand it." she sighed. "There's not as much room to play there as there is here."

"Were you happy there?" asked another student.

"It was all I knew." replied Joy. "I had ever left the city until I had a misunderstanding with my dad." she sobbed slightly. "I thought he was going to banish me..."

"Banish you!?" came a chorus of concerned voices. "What!?!"

"Monsters!" said Runa, her wings showing anger.

"No no! It wasn't like that!" said Joy, defensively.

She quickly told her story. "My dad was talking about the probe that pulled the humans in, not me." she said, completing her tale. "When I returned home, dad showed me the teleporter. That was when my life change forever."

Suddenly Karis rose to her feet. "Joy is still used to the Gaian way of doing things." she said to everyone. "Apparently, their way of greeting each other is a slap to the back of the head."

A few giggles rose from the class, even Ewol chuckled. "I got a taste of that greeting." blushing, he said. "Those Gaians are a rough type of people."

"I- I want to learn your ways." said Joy, nervously. "I ju- just need a little help."

"How do Gaians formerly greet each other, Joy?" curious, the teacher asked.

Joy blushed. "You don't want to know." she said. "It's a lot different from what you do."

Please, show me." pressed the teacher. "I promise I won't get mad."

Joy was clearly hesitant but she summoned Karis with her finger. She came and Joy whispered in her ear. "Formal greetings, boy to boy, is a smack to the front of the head." she explained, quietly. "Girl to girl, they... cup each others'... chests and boy to girl is a slap on the rump." pausing, she added, "The harder the slap, the more personal the 'hello'."

Karis blushed brightly then whispered back, "Don't you dare try any of those greetings here, we'll teach you the proper way of doing it."

Joy nodded then watched as Karis whispered to the teacher, who also blushed brightly. "Well, I think we will be starting the day by demonstrating how Misterians greet and treat each other." she said, politely. "Karis, would you mind showing Joy the proper formal greeting?"

Karis nodded. "Yes, ma'am." she replied.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Joy's first day of school.

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
My first day of school was very good for me as I learned how Misterians greet each other and was able to meet my classmates by practicing the greetings. Everyone had a good time as I told them my stories of my formor home. They apparently see living in tight quarters in a city-sized spaceship as not a good thing. I grew up dealing with it so I guess I never thought of it that way.

There was a massive storm that night. I had never seen one before so I was on the ledge, watching it. The electricity lighting the sky, the heavy clapping sounds afterwards were terrifying and exciting all at the same time. I was tempted to fly out in it but Etoile cautioned me not to as a storm is best viewed from a distance. I remembered what Eton and Karis told me when they went out and got caught in a storm. I certainly did not want that happening to me. I did not sleep well that night but at least I was well entertained.

It's been a week since then and I believe I have become more accustomed to my new body and new world. Both Eton and Karis were a very big help, explaining everything I need to know to lead a normal life in Skyaira. All my friends are nice, but kind of wierd. Especially Ewol. He's such a clown, at least what's what Eton called him. I feel accepted as one of their own and am treated well....

Joy looked up from her journal and sighed, smiling. "What a week it's been. A little hectic at times but still good" she said as she glanced out the window, seeing the sun shining overhead. Living in such sunlight took a little getting used to for Joy, but her new body was easily able to adapt to it. She had laughed when Eton said humans needed certain materials to withstand such extreme sunlight.

What does Joy do next?
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: The way of the Misterians

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
Joy, deciding she needed to keep a little something of her old world, sought out Etoile. She had learned enough flying to travel from one floating island to the next but Etoile still wanted her to fly with someone so this was her first solo flight. "This is a bit scary." she muttered, trying not to look down. "Only I have to fly on my own sometime."

Joy found Etoile minutes later at the training hall where she taught young Misterians the art of combat. There, she was training Eton in the art of sword fighting with wooden blades. They stopped as Etoile slapped Eton in the side with her toy sword. "Watch your left side, Eton." she warned, sternly. "Had I been holding a steel blade, you would have been seriously hurt."

"Yes, Etoile." blushing brightly, Eton said.

Joy politely cleared her throat and the two turned to her, surprised. "Joy, how did you get here?" asked Etoile.

"I flew here." replied Joy, nervously. "I need to talk to you."

"It could have waited, young lady." scolded Etoile. "Although I am proud you were able to fly here on your own, you still don't fully know your way around, you could have gotten lost." she sighed. "What did you need to talk about?"

"I wish to request training in combat." replied Joy, to Etoile and Eton's surprise. "Gaians are trained in combat from the age of two... I am seven so I have five years of fighting training."

"You forget that Gains become stronger with pain." said Etoile. "This is not so with Misterians, of which you now are."

She then turned to Eton, as if considering something, then suddenly smiled. "What?" asked Eton, curious.

"If you can hold your own against Eton, using practice swords, I will train you." said Etoile, still smiling. "If you fail, I will not train you until I feel you are ready, understood?"

Joy nodded and Etoile handed her a wooden practice sword. "Each slap to the side, under the arm, is a point." explained Etoile. "A slap to the head is a 'kill' shot. The first to make ten points or one kill shot will win." she giggled then declared, "You may begin!"

Eton rose his sword with Joy raising her own in defense as the practice duel began....

Did Joy win?
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: Talk to Etoile

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
After twenty minutes of practice dueling, of which Joy scored six points, Eton scored his tenth point. Joy moaned, disappointed with her loss. "Only four points off." she muttered.

"You have some good moves, Joy." said Etoile, comforting her daughter. "Only you lack in strength and speed, something very necessary for areal combat." she sighed, touching Joy's shoulder. "I'm sorry, you are not ready."

Joy bowed her head, tearfully but Eton walked up to her, smiling. "Etoile said you are not ready but she did not say you will never be ready." he said, surprising her. "Give yourself some time." he then chuckled. "Also, you're ten not seven."

Joy blushed brightly. "I- I know." she stammered. "I was nervous, okay?"

"Another reason you are not yet ready." said Etoile, kindly. "You must leave all your fears behind you when you face a demon in the air or on the floating islands."

"Speaking of which, what are we going to do with that Pandora?" asked Eton.

Etoile sighed. "That is not up to me." she replied. "However, I do know that Minerva had closed our boarders until we can discover how Pandora got to the palace without detection."

After a moment, Joy said, "Maybe it was that strange island that came during the storm."

Now it was Eton and Etoile's turn to be surprised. "What strange island?" asked Eton.

"When I was watching the storm, I saw a strange island appear in the distance." said Joy. "I watched it drift passed, near the palace then vanish again." he paused, thinking. "It came again this morning."

Etoile looked at Joy for a moment, puzzled then her eyes widened slightly as she whispered, "The ghost island."

"The what?" asked Eton.

"It's an island that only a select few can see." explained Etoile. "It allows one to move to all of the Misterian cities in the world only it became lost when...they arrived."

"They?" asked Joy. she then teared up. "The Gaians."

"You were not born when they came, you are not to blame." said Etoile, firmly but kindly. "You see, there was a ship before the Kraken and Leviathan..." she sighed, sadly. "It's really not a story you should hear."

"Were people hurt?" asked Joy, now shaking.

Etoile stepped forward and touched Joy's head. "Forget this day." she said.

Joy felt herself becoming sleepy then crumbled to the floor, fast asleep. "Do not mention this day to her, Eton." ordered Etoile, serious. "It will not do her well to know what her former people had inadvertently caused when they arrived on Earth."

"What happened?" asked Eton, curious.

Etoile sighed. "A scout ship came to us and landed onto the ghost island." she explained. "Only they could not breath our air and quickly died. Their ship is still there, its cloaking device keeping the island invisible to us."

"So the island was not lost by anything malicious." said Eton.

"No, it wasn't." said Etoile. "Only because we lost access to it, a city fell to a demon attack as they had no where to run, that was the ghost island's purpose."

"We lost a city?" asked Eton.

"It was a long time ago, long you or Joy were born." said Etoile.
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: No, but Eton is exhausted.

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
"The city was called Arcadia." said Etoile, beginning her story. "It was a gem among the other cities with powers of both science and magic. The demons wanted the city as there were rumors of a device that would allow them to become solid in this world."

"The demons are not solid in this world?" asked Eton, confused.

"They can only partially enter this world as smoke and energy." explained Etoile. "When you saved princess Myrrh, did you not see a 'hissing' shadow come out of the men you knocked out?"

Eton shivered at the memory then nodded. "Yeah, I did." he replied. "Did they get this device?"

"The device never existed." said Etoile with a sigh. "It was merely a story to frighten curious children from exploring internal halls of the city as the libraries within contained all the knowledge of mankind." pausing, she added, "Mankind is learning but we fear they will destroy each other before they reach our level of awareness."

"Why did you store the knowledge of mankind there?" asked Eton.

"That is another story, young one." said Etoile, sternly. "In those days, we welcomed all who were able to reach our world, hence we have so many Misterians who were former humans." she frowned. "That all changed when... they came to our world."

"They arrived with their ship cloaked, came out and died as they could not breathe our air." said Eton.

"That's official word." said Etoile, sadly. "They remained alive for a short while as the air here is thinner but it was too cold for them and when the demons attacked, they tried to help with their scout ship." she sighed. "It was their intention to give cover fire, attacking hoard while their ship was cloaked."

"What happened?" asked Eton, almost whispering.

They took a hit and crashed onto the ghost island, making it cloaked as well." replied Etoile. "Everyone managed to get out of the city alive but they were teleported to the city of Martius, renamed New Arcadia."

"I never heard of that one." wincing, Eton said.

Etoile smiled. "Misterians have cities over more than just Earth, Eton." she said. "What humans know about Mars so far is all a myth. Its just as green and alive as Earth only humans are not yet responsible enough to know this."

"Thus the reason it was told no one escaped the city." said Eton, tearing up. "But- But then saying the Gaians caused this is a lie."

"That is why I removed this day from Joy's memory." said Etoile. "Only a select few know the truth about the other planets and, if I hear you breath a single word of this conversation to anyone, I will remove it from your mind as well."

With that, Etoile took Joy into her arms and walked away with Eton quickly following. "The other planets are as alive as Earth!?" he thought, surprised. "That's incredible!"
1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.title: story of a lost city.

1143111122111111111111112222122111111111.content:
That night, Joy was unable to sleep. She sensed something was missing, unaware it was a piece of her memory, and sat by the window, staring out at an oncoming storm. "I wonder if this storm will be as strong as the last one that came." she whispered, intrigued. "I want to learn more about them."

Then, the ghost island appeared again. "Oh, hello there." said Joy, smiling. "Did you come to see the storm too?" she giggled, knowing islands could not talk back, but paused as she heard or thought she heard a familiar noise. "Is that...?"

She listened and the sound came again over the distant thunder, causing her to gasp. "That's an emergency beacon!" Joy recognized it from the emergency drill that brought on her being teleported to Skyaira. "Could there be a Gaian ship on that little island?"

The sound came yet again but it was silenced as the island vanished from sight. Knowing that it was going to appear again, Joy knotted her jaws in decision. "The island appears every hour during a storm." she mussed. "If I go to the island, I should be back before anyone notices I had left."

Joy had no time to scramble around for things she might need as the island was only visible for a few minutes each time so, when it appeared again, she jumped out the window with her wings a bright yellow and green color, soaring to the island as fast as she could carry herself. "I had sworn to help all in need." she thought. "An emergency beacon means someone needs help."

Unknown to Joy, Eton was walking passed her chambers at that moment and heard her yell something about an emergency, causing him to be concerned. He hurried in, to Etoile's surprise, and saw Joy flying towards the ghost island from her chamber window. "Joy, stop!" he yelled.

Either Joy did not hear him or she ignored him completely as she kept flying. Eton moaned, frustrated, there was no time to sound any alarm. He quickly flew after her in the hopes of stopping her before she is taken by the island or the storm. He did not know which would be worse and he did not want to find out.

Etoile wanted to fly out after them both but knew she would not have the strength to carry them so she made a desperate mental call to her fellow Valkyrie and prayed they would arrive in time. She turned back to the window and turned pale as she saw Eton and Joy reach the island just before...

11431111222.content:
After what seemed like hours of her parents talking about James' death, Nicole told her mother that she was not feeling well. She complained of being too cold and wanted to use a blanket.

"Nicole, it is not cold enough to need a blanket," responded her mother.

"But mommy, I need it," whined Nicole.

"You may use if for a few minutes then take it off. Let me carry you upstairs," answered her mother.

Within a few minutes, Nicole was in her bed wrapped in her favorite blue blanket. Her mother kissed her on the forehead and departed from the room. Nicole started to get the feeling she had when she had a hunch that things weren't what they seemed. She knew that her brother wasn't dead. He couldn't be. How could he be found in the exact alley where she was?

That meant...."Oh no..."she thought, "please don't tell me the big bad people have my brother!"

This frightened poor Nicole so much that she began to get extremely cold with chills throughout her body. When she was a Misterian, she had always gotten these urges and drastic isymptoms whenever she feared something that she believed was true. Pallas, her mother, would always worry about her health. Minerva would reassure her saying that Aria would do great things one day. She would be able to control certain situations to avoid a possibly horrific outcome.

However, right now, Nicole was not good for much. After all, she didn't even remember her time as a Misterian due to the trauma inflicted on her when her wings were torn off by demons. She was coughing and felt like she was about to throw up. At the time, Ellen walked into her room, saying,

"Mom told me you weren't feeling well. I wanted to see if you were ok...Oh my gosh, Nicole!"yelled Ellen. Nicole appeared to be uncontrollably shaking and having a seizure. Ellen immediately called her mom who soon entered into the room to treat Nicole.

'Oh no. I don't want to have to lose another sibling. Please not her too' begged Ellen in her thoughts. Out of nowhere, Nicole snapped out of it as if to answer Ellen and say that she would be alright. Her mother was relieved by this.She then proceeded to tell Ellen to keep an eye on Nicole as she called 911.

Back in Skyaira, Minerva watched this whole scene take place. She felt terrible about what was going on with the child. She had already contacted Pallas about her daughter who said that she would arrive as soon as she can. Minerva wanted to send a telepathic message to Nicole and say that she will be alright, but Minerva knew she would get in huge trouble. All of a sudden, she received a message from Nicole in her mind that said James might be caught by the "big bad people". Minerva knew Nicole referred to demons with this strange nickname, but she was shocked that Nicole was capable of sending a telepathic message to her. However, when she looked down at Nicole, the girl appeared to not have been aware that she sent the message at all.

'If she doesn't even realize what she is doing sending me messages...Aria might be in more danger than I had thought' thought Minerva to herself.

114311112221.content:
"Enter." said Minerva, turning from her view screen.

Two doors opened with a rumble and an anxious Pallas entered with the doors closing behind her. "I received word from the Valkyrie that my daughter, Aria is alive!" she said, hurrying to Minerva. "Please, where is she!?"

"She is being raised by a human family at this time." replied Minerva, pointing to the view screen. "Ironically, it is the same family whose son saved my daughter from demons at the cost of his life." she sighed. "Myrrh begged me to rebirth him, he is now her son, Eton."

Pallas turned to the view screen in shock and began to cry. "That's my baby!" she sobbed. "Queen, Minerva, I beg you, allow me to collect my daughter!"

Minerva sadly shook her head. "Aria would not survive a day here without her wings but they are growing back." she said. "Only when Aria's wings fully grow back may you try. However, it must be on her own free will as her heart is with with the human family now."

Pallas started to protest but Minerva stopped her with a wave of her hand. "You know the law, Pallas!" she said, firmly. "We are forbidden to interfere with the humans lives. Aria has lived with that family long enough to be considered 'human', when to go to her and she refuses, you must leave her.... I'm sorry."

Pallas bowed her head, crying. "I... I'll do all I can to convince her." she sobbed.

"I pray you are successful, Pallas." said Minerva. "I will ensure Aria's safety until the time comes."

Crying but carrying a sliver of hope in her heart, Pallas left Minerva's chambers.

Meanwhile, on Earth, Nicole slept soundly on a hospital bed with mom at her side. As she slept, she dreamed about...
114311112221.title: Minerva hears a knock on the door. It is Pallas.

1143111122211.content:
As she slept, Nicole dreamed about her lost brother, James. The two of them had a strong bond with each other as they shared the same love and dream to fly. In her dream, she felt herself being lifted off the bed. She looked around and found her mom asleep, her hand lying limp on the bed. "Wha-What's happening?" asked Nicole.

"That's not fair, it took me over a week to learn how to fly!" said a familiar voice, whining.

Nicole looked around and soon spotted James but like he was when he was around ten. She knew this, having seen many childhood photos of him a few months ago. "James, is that you!? she asked. "What do you mean by 'flying'?"

James giggled then pointed to a mirror. Nicole looked and nearly screamed, seeing that she now had a pair of wings, which were flapping to keep her hovering above the bed. She turned back to James, jaw hanging, as he smiled and spread a strong pair of wings of his own. "Where you came from is where I have gone." he said.

"Where I... came from?" asked Nicole, confused.

"You will understand in time... Aria." said another voice. "Please... please remember me."

Nicole looked at the woman, thinking that she had seen her somewhere before. "Do I... know you?" she asked.

Before the woman could answer, Nicole fell, letting out a low scream and woke up on the floor with a startled mom still holding her hand. "Oh, my gosh!" she breathed. "Nicole! Are you okay, dear!?"

"Mommy....!" cried Nicole, holding her hands up.

Mom quickly but gently took Nicole into her arms and hit the call button. "A nurse is on the way, dear." she said, cooing her crying daughter. "Easy... easy..."

Meanwhile, high above, Pallas stood inside her chambers in her home, tears rolling down her face. She gently rubbed the sides of her head as if they ached. She could no longer maintain the link as Nicole's own untapped power resisted her. "Damn!" she cursed under her breath. "I hope my visit to Aria's mind at least sparked a few memories to jar loose."

Just then, the door to her chambers opened and Minerva entered without knocking. "This is what is like to enter anyone's mind without permission!" she scolded. "It's the same as entering a person's private space without being invited in!"

"I made the link while she was asleep." said Pallas, defending herself. "No conscious contact was made, it will be up to Nicole how to interpret 'the dream'."

Minerva sighed. "Well, technically, you are not breaking the law." she said with a sigh. "However, if you continue this link, I will be forced to make my judgment in favor of the human family as you are attempting to influence her future decision of what to become, human or Misterian."

With that one warning, Minerva walked out of her home while, back on Earth...

After writing his thoughts down, Trevor decided to go to bed for the night. He was of no use to anyone the way he was feeling and he thought, maybe, someone might answer.
