14.title: James the spirit walker.

15.content:
James had no idea how much time passed since he blacked out. He felt like he was floating in som dark abyss, where it seemed like all light was shunned. Quite frankly, he couldn't really tell if his eyes were open either. That's how dark it was.

"Where.....am....I?" he spoke slowly. This almost didn't feel real, and yet at the same time, it was very much real. It felt like a place where even time and space were all screwed up.

"That's one way to look at it." came a soft voice.

James instantly tried to look around, startled by the sudden voice. Again though, he couldn't tell where he was looking. However, as he continued to look, a small orb of light floated near him. It wasn't very bright, but it was enough for James to tell that he was actually looking at something.

"What do you mean?" he spoke again, a little bit faster than before. The orb of light slowly bobbled in the air.

"This place isn't really governed by temporal or spacial laws. That's how a mindscape works" spoke the orb again. After hearing it again, James thought that the voice sounded almost spiritual, like the voice of someone from another world or something. At the same time though, it sounded very familiar. Like he had just heard it recently.

Suddenly, the voice giggled, as if hearing something funny.

"No, I'm not a spirit. Trust me, I'm far from it. Think of me as someone who'll get you back on your feet soon enough" spoke the voice.

"How so? First of all, what's a mindscape? Second, how are you reading my mind? Third, who the hell are you?" spoke James, getting angrier by the second. He didn't like dodging around the subject like this. Once again, the voice laughed.

"So many questions. I can't really tell you everything right now. I don't have much time here. All I can say is that you went through a great ordeal just now, and I'll help you live again when the time comes" spoke the voice. James raised an eyebrow at that comment. Live again? Was he dead? He didn't feel like it.

"Trust me, you aren't dead. More like half-dead." spoke the voice. Before James could answer, the orb of light seemed to start flickering, like a lightbulb about to go out. "Crud, I'm out of time. Know this, you'll awaken soon enough. When you do, things will be different, but you'll always have help. See ya."

With that, the orb flickered out, leaving James back in darkness.

"Well that was bizarre" said James, wondering about what kind of trouble he was in now. However, he didn't have much time to think on it, as his mind began to cloud again, and he once again entered a deep slumber.
15.title: Out of body and out of mind

151.content:
James felt like he had an absolutely massive headache as he soon felt sunshine rain down on his face. He felt like he had been trapped in that wierd black void for months. Maybe even years. That's how long it felt. Slowly but surely, his consiousness seemed to reenter his body. As he did, he heard some wierd things.

"Hey, I think she's waking up!"

"Fae, don't hurt her. She'll be pretty delicate after such an ordeal"

"Oh poo! I wanna see her right away!"

The voices were pretty loud. However, you soon felt whatever soft thing you were laying on suddenly get impacted, like someone jumping on it.

"Honestly Fae. Can't you be a little more responsible?"

"It's not that bad. See, she's waking up."

James had no idea who they were talking about. Surely, it wasn't about him. Slowly, his eyes began to flutter open, still somewhat blinded by the radiant sunshine. Soon enough, you blinked enough to see a small figure sitting on your face, with a face contorted in excitement and wonder.

It looked like a little girl, or perhaps a young teen. She was fairly small, not really into puberty yet. She had dark hair like the angel girl from earlier, although it was really short and very messy, like it hadn't been combed in a long time. She wore a violet short-sleeved dress that reached her thighs, a white long-sleeved shirt underneath it. A dark purple vest with some elegant characters adorned her chest and kept the dress close to her body. Her bright eyes were alight in excitement.

"She's awake!" screeched the girl, making James wince a bit.

"Fae, that's enough. Calm down and let me show her what she looks like now" came another voice. James slowly turned his head and saw the girl from earlier, although he didn't see her wings. She slowly approached him, a small mirror in her hands.

"I'm sorry, but it all we could do" she said somberly. She brought the mirror up, showing James his appearance.

It wasn't long before he screamed.
151.title: Sudden Awakening

1512.content:
James couldn't be more shocked at his appearance.

The face in the mirror could hardly be seen as masculine. The face was soft, with radiant blue eyes. His hair was the same dark brown, but was now down to his shoulders and appeared a bit more black than normal. James just gasped at the sight and looked down. He saw a slightly curvaceous figure wearing a plain long-sleeved shirt with shorts of the same color. Two noticable lumps adorned his chest.

"What the hell?!" he, or rather she, screamed. The girl holding the mirror had to close her ears for that time.

"That was quite a screech, although I guess it was to be expected." sighed the girl.

"W-What is going on? And who are you anyway?" asked James.

"My name's Myrrh. Pleasure to meet you." said Myrrh, her demeanor turning a 180. "And long story short, you saved my life from those Shadorians, and now you're the same as me."

James just raised an eyebrow at her, not having a clue as to what she just said. "Could you say that again in english?" he asked plainly.

Myrrh shrugged and was about to elaborate, until.....

"You're pretty miss!" said the little girl from before, who jumped on the bed again, bouncing James a bit.

"Uh, and you are?" asked James.

"My name's Fae! It means "fairy", so don't forget it!" exclaimed the little girl. James was completely confused right now.

"Fae, we're talking right now. Why don't you go play?" suggested Myrrh.

"I don't wanna! I have a right to see my new cousin!" said Fae.

If possible, James' eyes got even wider.

"Wait, cousin? What in the world are you talking about?" he asked, very much upset about this.

"Well, as I was getting to before I was interupted.." started Myrrh, pointing a glare at Fae. "I was attacked by those Shadorians, who are those demons you saw. You saved me from getting killed, but nearly got yourself killed in the the process. The only way we could save you was by using our power of rebirth on you. However, the results of it are very random, so that's why you became like this."

James just sat there dumbfounded. "So you turned me into a girl?" he asked.

"Unintentionally, yes. Like I said, the results are random. If we didn't do it, you'd be dead right now." said Myrrh.

James sat there, trying to compose his next question. "So what did this girl mean by "cousin" exactly?" he asked next.

"Pull your shirt down and look at your right shoulder." said Myrrh. James did as told, looking at said shoulder, pulling the neckline down far enough. Once again, he was surprised, as there was a mark there. It looked like a circle, surrounded by some elaborate markings.

"That is the Mark of the Exalt, and only members of our royal family have them. I as well, and so does Fae, or some odd reason." said Myrrh.

"Hey!" remarked Fae.

James looked at both of them and saw what they meant. Fae had a similar mark on her forehead, but he couldn't see Myrrh's.

"Mine is above my left breast, and I don't feel like showing it right now." she smirked, making Jame blush a bit at the thought. Then, another thought came.

"Royal?" he asked.

"Yes, royal. I'm the princess of Skyaira, and next in line as of right now. Fae here is from a branched family line, but got the mark anyway." said Myrrh, getting another remark from Fae.

"So, you're saying I'm part of it too?" asked James.

"More or less." said Myrrh.
1512.title: Explanations

15121.content:
Myrhh continued to explain things to James, who was still a bit confused and rattled. It was then that she pointed something out.

"By the way" Myrhh said, holding Jame's new girl hand. "You might want to take a look at your hand".

"What" asked James as he looked at his hand. In it was Something she didn't expect to see. James was startled as he saw a glowing ball of light energy in his hand. It glowed a bright white color. "Wha-What is this" James said scared, looking at his girl hand. "It is light, formed into a sphere of energy and conjured by your body" Myrhh said.

James was at a loss for words. He tried shaking his hand to shake the light away, but it just grew stronger as he became more nervous. "Stop James, you must control your emotions to wisp that light sphere away". James got a hold of him, or probably now herself. He breathed deeply trying to calm down. In his mind he tried to focus the light sphere away. The light obeyed and disappeared. James was calm for a moment, trying to collect himself. Immediately afterwards he asked Myrhh "wha-what the heck is going on? How did I do that" he asked in his new girl voice.

Myrhh looked with a bit of sadness at James, but it soon changed to a content look. "I didn't wish for you to find out so soon but, you have a great power within you James" she said. James raised an eyebrow before asking "a great...power"? Myrhh responded calmly by saying "yes". "You have a powerful energy resonating within you" she said. "You see during the rebirthing process we were repairing your body, but we found something unexpected. During the process an energy ignited within your body. It changed you. Your eyes became a bright blue and while it isn't certain, this energy was probably partially responsible for transforming you into a girl. We don't know what this energy was, but we theorize it was your good intention of saving my life that manifested itself into light energy that burns within your body during your rebirth into a mysterian. It was a rare finding for even us Mysterians".

James was overwhelmed by this new discovery. Myrhh saw his sad face and comforted him by saying. "You should be happy James. That light energy is a gift. In fact you're one of the very few Mysterians that have ever been granted such a power,and probably the only one who can control light". James sat still overwhelmed, but calmed himself and simply looked up at Myrhh. Myrhh could see into his eyes. James was unaware of this, but his eyes glowed during brief moments, changing from blue to yellow and back.

"So, this power, it burns within me and I can make these...light balls" he asked again to be sure. Myrhh giggled and happily responded "yes, and you can do so much more with light than you know" she said. "But you have to learn and train" Myrhh said.

"Alright then" James said, accepting this situation as much as he could. He couldn't believe it. First he was a girl, then he found out he had some sort of superpower. In his own short way, he said that the whole situation was him having an "off day". "It may seem hard to take in, but I promise you that this will be the beginning of a new life for you" Myrhh said.

James simply nodded in agreement. "Good, now the next matter is deciding your name. It should be something to reflect your new form and species, hmmm" Myrhh thought. After a moment she brainstormed a perfect name for James' new angelic, girl form. "Ah, I know" she said.

James looked on in anticipation of what name she thought, though he really preferred his own name although he knew he wasn't a "he" anymore.

"Your name will be" Myrhh said...
15121.title: Angel girl light manipulator

153.content:
James woke up, feeling the warmth of the rising sun on his face. He moaned and allowed his eyes to flicker open, only to remember his experience in the alley. Fearful, he bolted up right and began to examine himself. To his relief, he was unharmed but, to his confusion, he was wearing only his boxers. "Where am I?" whispering, the asked.

He looked around to find himself in a barren bedroom. Across from the bed he was in was a dresser in the corner with a small television and radio resting on top. To the right of it was a door to a small washroom with a shower and, on the other wall was a door, he presumed to be the only way out. Behind him was a small window, allowing a small summer breeze. Looking at all, James recognized it at his family's summer home in the country. "How did I get here?" groggily, James muttered. "Last I knew I was in the city."

James rolled out of the bed and spotted a note on the nightstand, next to his cellphone and a set of car keys. Curious, he took the note and opened it up. It was a typed message that stated... 'You are healed but not completely, we left you here to rest. A rental car is outside, return home when you feel ready. If you change, you will know what to do. -Myrrh.'

"What the..." confused, James asked, reading the cryptic message. "Who the hell is this Myrrh?"

Then he again thought of the incident ion the alley and began to wonder. "How surreal can it get?" bemused, he asked. "Was it all a dream? It felt real and... this note...."

James paused to scratch his back, feeling a bad itch coming on and decided to take a shower so to tackle this new mystery with a refreshed mind and body. "There has to be a logical explanation to all of this." striping down, he said to himself. "Maybe my college buddies playing a prank on me."

Unknown to him, as he stepped into the shower, two hard lumps had formed just under his shoulder blades....
153.title: Awaken to a mystery.

1531.content:
James felt better after his shower but the itch on his back was still there. It was not a bad itch but it was still a bit annoying as he could not quite reach it. He sighed, wondering if he should call his family so they don't worry. He moved to pick up his cellphone only to jump as it rang. Seeing it was his mom, Natalie, he answered. "Hello."

"James, where are you!?" panic in her voice, Natalie asked. "We've been searching for you for hours!"

"I'm at our summer home, outside of town." wincing, James replied. "Only I'm not sure how I got here."

"What do you mean you don't know how you got there!?!" her panic rising, Natalie asked.

"I saw three men jumping a girl in an alley." smartly not mentioning her wings, James replied. "I tried to help but didn't see the fourth guy. They jumped me before other people arrived to help." pausing, he added, "One of the guys clobbered me, I passed out and ended up here."

"Are you alright!?" worry in her voice, Natalie asked. "Never mind, I'm coming to get you, just hang in there."

With that, she ended the call before James felt a surge of pain in his back where he was itching. This was followed by a strange sound, like pealing off a latex glove after washing dishes. He reached back to scratch it only to feel...
1531.title: continue.

15313.content:
To say James was startled would have been an understatement, feeling someone's hand gripping his own. Although he was still feeling weak, he spun around to find himself facing the winged girl he had saved the other day. She had a somewhat sad expression on her face as she smiled at him. "Thank you for saving my life, James Walker." releasing his hand, she said. "I am truly sorry you were shot in the process but, as you can see, we repaired the damage."

What do you mean by we?" fearful and curious, James asked. "I seem to remember others charging onto the scene..."

"I am princess Myrrh of Skyaira." placing a light finger onto James' lip, she said. "My mother, Queen Minerva and I had a disagreement and I fled to Earth to find some peace." pausing, she added, "Only, I found Shadorians."

"Sha- Sado.." struggling with the name, James asked. "Who?"

"Sadorians." giggling slightly, Myrrh said. "You call them demons."

"So what do 'we' call you?" curious, James asked. "Angels?"

"Not in the sense you are thinking." with a thin smile, Myrrh said. "We are called Misterians or citizens of the mist."

"So, what brings you back to me?" looking at Myrrh, James asked. "What do you want?"

"The reason I am here is because you are going through the 'unknown change'." sadly, she explained. "Our healing methods are a little more advanced but they were really not meant for use on a human."

"The 'unknown change'?" feeling unnerved, James asked. "What is that, exactly?"

"As I said, our healing methods were really not meant for humans but I insisted it be tried anyway as you saved my life." looking regretful, Myrrh said. "The same process we used to heal your body is changing your body to that of a Misterian but, as it changes you right down to your very DNA..." she paused. "You could come out of the change much younger or even as a member of the opposite gender, hence its called the unknown change."

James became very worried. "How long before I'm completely changed?" almost whispering, he asked. "Can I be changed back to my old self?"

"I don't know but my mother might." wincing, Myrrh replied. "I need you to allow me to accelerate the change so I can take you to Skyaira and meet my mother." tearing up, she added. "Please, I am in stormy clouds as it is."

James figured Myrrh meant 'stormy clouds' to say 'in hot water' or in huge trouble. Only he was not so sure he wanted the changes to be accelerated as there was no telling if, once done, the changes were or were not permanent.

What is James to do?
15313.title: someone's hand.

choices: Complete, he is a teenage Misterian boy.
James becomes a teenage Misterian girl.
153131.content:
James looked at Myrrh and thought back to the incident in the warehouse. As he looked into her tear filling eyes, he knew that he would have done the same thing if he had to do it again. James had saved Myrrh because it was the right thing to do and she had saved his for the same reason. Finally, he smiled and offered his hand. "Let's meet your mother and straighten this all out." softly, he said. "I saved you at a risk and you did the same."

Myrrh, obviously grateful, smiled then took James' hand. "This won't hurt a bit." he wings glowing slightly, she said. "It will, however, feel a little strange."

James nodded then paused as he felt a pressure in his back. As Myrrh had promised, there was no pain but it did indeed feel strange. The pressure continued as he then felt an odd weight building before he spotted something moving out of the corner of his eye. "What..."

Myrrh pointed to a full length mirror and James turned to it to find that he now had a large pair of wings, like her own but his seemed more rigid. It was like comparing the soft feathers of a sparrow and the firm feathers of an eagle. Throwing Myrrh a curious look, she smiled. "Men in out world have stronger wings but the women have magic, its a firm balance."

"I see...." turning back to the mirror, James said. "Wait, I'm still changing..."

"Don't be afraid." almost whispering, Myrrh said. "The changes will end soon."

James continued to watch as the changes continued and soon he found himself shrinking to that of a teenager. "Well, at least I'm not becoming too young." muttering, he said.

Does James finish changing or continue to change?
153131.title: Allow it.

1531312.content:
To James' disappointment, his wings became softer as two lumps began to form on his chest. He continued to watch as his hair increased in length, turning a lighter color, and his shoulders became more rounded. "Oh man..." he whimpered, his voice rising. "I'm becoming a girl."

James winced, feeling his body shifting inside as he felt something entering his nether regions before his, or rather, her hips widened slightly. The two lumps on his chest increased in size, finally stopping at what seemed to have been B cup breasts, causing James to moan again. Within minutes, the changes were complete and James blushed brightly, seeing a beautiful winged girl staring back at him in the mirror with no top on. "Well, this is awkward." surprised by her new voice, she said. "I need to find something to wear."

"Just wrap yourself in a blanket." giving James a sad smile, Myrrh said. "You just got your wings, they will not be strong enough to carry you for a while."

Reluctantly, James wrapped herself in a blanket and Myrrh led her out of the cabin where she took to the air, carrying James in her arms. "Just relax and enjoy the ride." soothingly, Myrrh said. "I'll take you to the palace where we will find you something suitable to wear before taking you before the queen."

James nodded and try to be still as Myrrh took her higher and higher into the clouds. "This is so surreal." looking around, she thought. "I always wanted to fly like a bird but this is not quite how I imagined it."

As the minutes ticked by, James gasped as she saw what could only be described as a floating island in the distance. "Am I dreaming?" almost whispering, she asked herself.

Myrrh giggled. "No, James." softly, she said. "You are not dreaming. That is one of many floating islands that make up the Skyaira kingdom."

"What keeps them in the air?" curious, James asked. "Why haven't anyone seen them before this?"

Myrrh laughed. "The islands have their own gravitational pull, allowing them to float." amused, she explained. "Why no one else can see them is simple, Skyaira and the other Misterian cities hover over where no humans live."

James looked at Myrrh, confused. "Huh?"

Again Myrrh giggled. "The island you see ahead is a moving island." smiling, she said. "I used it to flee to your city and to take you to that cabin we left a few minutes ago."

Upon reaching the island, Myrrh landed near a strange arrangement of crystals. She placed James down then began to work with them. "These crystals, when moved in a certain order, will make the island disappear from here and reappear where ever you want." pushing and pulling on the crystals, she said. "Hang on now..."

There was a rush and James found himself again in Myrrh's arms. He looked around in awe; he was in the middle of a huge forest, facing a castle that was resting on a gigantic tree stump!

http://pseudowitch.deviantart.com/art/Sk...

"Welcome, James, to Skyaira." with a hint of pride, Myrrh said. "Ahead of you is Skyaira castle."

"It's beautiful." whispering, James said.
1531312.title: Flight to Skyaira.

15313121.content:
Upon landing at the front gates of the castle, Myrrh gently placed James onto her feet then faced two male guards who had immediately placed a hand onto the hilt of their swords. The two appeared to be twins with longish blond hair and piercing blue eyes. James did not know why but she blushed seeing them.

"Be at peace." calmly, Myrrh said. "This is the one known as James, who had saved my life. He has chosen the change and is now a female member of our people."

The two guards relaxed before bowing to James. "Bright blessings to you." the first guard said. "I am Julius and this is Gemini, we welcome you to Skyaira."

"Your mother is waiting for you in the throne room, Myrrh." calmly, Gemini. "I suggest you do not keep her waiting."

Myrrh nodded and the doors were opened for them. "We walk from here." motioning James to follow, she said.

James walked behind Myrrh, still holding the blanket around her but gasped, the blanket falling to the floor as she saw the main hall. It was made of marble floors with massive pillars that had lush trees standing among them. It was a beautiful sight to behold. "Wow..."

http://pseudowitch.deviantart.com/art/Ma...

"All the halls are decorated this way to remind us of nature's role in our lives." smiling, Myrrh said. "Without nature, we can not exist, we respect it for that reason."

James nodded then took up the blanket and continued to follow Myrrh down another hall into an exquisite throne room. It was the same style as the other halls only James did not recognize a single tree. They were all huge with towering trunks that looked as if they could swallow a car. In the very center of the room was a huge throne that seemed to have been carved out of the trunk with a tall and slender woman sitting on it. She was a spitting image of Myrrh only with sapphire blue eyes that seemed to look right through her. The woman smiled at her and Myrrh as they entered and rose to greet them. "My dear daughter, you have returned." hugging Myrrh, she said. "May I assume this is the brave man who had rescued you?"

"He, or rather, she is, mother." as the woman released her, Myrrh replied. "May I introduce James of Earth. He willingly took the serum of change and is now a female Misterian." she then turned to James. "Allow me to introduce you to my mother, queen Minerva."

"Bright welcoming, James." hugging James, Minerva said. "I hope you find your new life here as rewarding as you found being a human on Earth." she released her then added. "I am in your debt."

"Thank you, your majesty." bowing, James replied. "May I ask what is to become of me?"

"Well, first thing is first." wincing, Minerva said. "You may not return to your family until you learn how to fly and to disguise yourself as one of the human race. It will not happen over night so have patience."

"Where am I to live here?" sighing, James asked. "What am I to do?"

"Well, I am tempted to adopt you as my daughter but outsiders must prove themselves." serious, Minerva replied. "You will be living with a common family where the people will observe you and determine if you are worthy to be adopted into the royal family."

"Being the queen here is not like as it is or even was on Earth." calmly, Myrrh said. "My mother does rule over everyone but the people, as one, can demand her to step down for the next in line or even a new ruler."

"It is important that I follow my own laws." serious, Minerva added. "If I did not, I would not be viewed as a fair ruler."

"So how is it decided where I will live?" curious, James asked.

"A family has already been selected." motioning for a family of Misterians to enter, Minerva said. "They agreed to look after you for the time being."
15313121.title: Meeting the queen.

153131211.content:
"I am Amadeus, a humble farmer." with a slight bow, a towering man said. "It is a pleasure to meet you; I will be your foster father for the time being."

Amadeus was powerfully built with short sand colored hair and blue eyes. Standing next to him was a tall and slender woman with long brown hair and brown eyes. "I am Annette, his mate." politely, she said. "I am pleased to meet you, young James." she then smiled. "We may have to find a more suitable name for you."

James blushed at that. "I really haven't given it much thought." honestly, she said.

A low giggled reached James' ears and she turned to face a short and slender young girl who looked to be no older than twelve in human years. "I am Janna." smiling, she said. "Welcome to the family."

"Thank you... Janna." politely, James said.

"Perhaps you would like the name Anastasia." still smiling, Janna said.

"Why that name?" curious, James asked.

Janna shrugged. "Why not?"

James giggled, causing Amadeus and Annette to smile. "I think Anastasia is a fine name." with a nod, Amadeus said. "We could call you Ana for short."

James shrugged. "Why not?" smiling slightly, she asked.

Anna giggled. "I can't wait for you to meet my friends." excited, she said. "We can have a lot of fun together."

"After chores." smiling, Annette said.

James, now Anastasia smiled.
153131211.title: Meeting your foster family.

1531312111.content:
"You may take your foster daughter home." kindly, Minerva said. "I expect you will make her feel welcome in our kingdom and help her learn to make use of her wings."

"I am certain she will love it here." smiling, Annette said. "I shall begin her flying lessons first light tomorrow."

With that, Amadeus offered his hands. "As you can not fly on your own as of yet, I shall carry you." kindly, he said. "Do not feel embarrassed, everyone here must learn to fly."

Ana nodded and allowed Amadeus to take her hands and he took off, easily lifting you off the floor. "We are off to our home in the farm lands." flying out of the castle, he said. "Blessed day, your majesty."

"Blessed day." Minerva called back as Annette and Anna followed. "Be well."

The flight to the farm lands took Anna over much of the kingdom, which was a spectacular view to behold. "Everything here looks much like early Earth." smiling, she said.

"We have technology here as well." with a chuckle, Amadeus said. "Unlike humans, we work with nature instead of against it."

"That sounds great." smiling, Ana said. "Only how do you deal with predators?"

"No world is perfect, Ana." sighing, Amadeus replied. "We have ways to deal with the predatory animals here but we do nothing to harm them as they are a part of the delicate natural balance."

"The biggest predator is much like your wolf." flying close, Annette said. "We use cold blasts of air and water to detour them from coming too close to our livestock."

Amadeus chuckled. "No animal likes a sudden cold shower."

Ana giggled at that.
1531312111.title: continue.

15313121111.content:
Amadeus took me away from the castle, through the giant trees to a vast clearing where Ana I saw animals she had thought were nothing more than make believe such as winged horses, dragons, and even winged pigs. Seeing them made me giggle. "I was always told I would meet life other than mankind when pigs fly."

Amadeus laughed. "Well pigs fly here." amused, he said. "Only we call them airboars."

"I wonder if people on Earth ever saw them." curious, Ana said.

"It's unlikely, Ana." kindly, Amadeus. "I'd say its a mere coincidence that humans came up with the idea of 'flying pigs', not knowing our world existed high above them." he then smiled, pointed to a passing dragon. "The dragons have been living here and on Earth for centuries; that legend is true."

Ana smiled back, fascinated and wondered if she would later see one up close. She looked back down and saw that they were slowly descending into another large forest passed the clearing. "We are almost home." happily, Anna said. "You are going to love it there."

We all soon came to a landing on a open patio that extended out from a huge tree house that rested on the huge branches of two of the giant trees. "Welcome to our home." as Ana was released, Annette said. "Your first lesson is how to fold your wings when not in flight."

"How do I do that?" curious, Ana asked.

"It's easy!" giggling, Anna said. "Watch!"

Ana turned to see Anna fold her wings onto themselves until they are but a long flat piece tucked between her shoulder blades. "I- I don't know if I can do that." wincing, Ana said.

"Turn to me, Ana." firmly but kindly, Annette said. "You must first learn how to move your wings. Its like using a new muscle, it will not be easy the first few times."

After nearly an hour of failed attempts, Ana managed to fold her wings to a long narrow group of feathers between her shoulder blades and Annette rewarded her with a warm hug. "Very good, Anastasia." smiling, she said. "You learn quickly."

She then released her and motioned her to walk inside. "Would you like a quick tour before midday meal?"

Ana smiled and nodded.
15313121111.title: Anastasia's new home.

153131211111.content:
Upon entering the house, Ana immediately noticed that all of the furniture was made of living plants, rooted into large pots, resting on the floor. The couch was a series of large bushes with impressively large leaves and flowers, weaved together with a strange sort of vine that was rooted in its own large pot in the center of the four bushes. The table was four strange small trees whose trunks and branches turned and intertwined with each other with the top sanded down to a flat surface. The chairs were all carefully pruned bushes that had been shaped and used for sitting. "Wow, I would have loved to have furniture like this on Earth." whispering you said.

"They could, if they just give it a try." serious, Annette said. "Why don't you try the group chair."

"You mean the couch?" motioning to the row of bushes, Ana asked.

"Is that what you call it on Earth?" bemused, Annette asked. "Interesting."

Ana walked to the 'group chair' and sat down in the middle. It was surprisingly comfortable. She laid down onto it and stretched out, amazed by how soft it was. "I think I'm going to like it here." a dreamy smile forming on her face, she said. "It's so quiet and peaceful."

"Oh, there are times of excitement here too." bemused, Amadeus replied. "For now, I'm just glad you feel comfortable here." he then chuckled then asked. "Would you like to take a nap there or see the rest of the house?"

Ana blushed slightly then reluctantly sat up. "Sorry." softly, she said. "It was just so comfortable."

"Just wait until you see your bed." smiling, Anna said.

What part of the house do you see next?
153131211111.title: Touring the house.

1531312111112.content:
As Ana stood up, she caught a whiff of fresh baked bread. "I'm curious about the kitchen." turning to where the smell was coming from, she said. "I think I smell bread baking."

"You're smelling my fresh baked yeast loaf." smiling Annette said. "Would you like to try a slice?"

"Yes, please." smiling, Ana said.

Annette giggled then lead you into her kitchen. It was unlike anything Ana had ever seen. The oven was made of stone with a flat top and an iron door in front. On the top of the oven was four circular indents with a circle of curious stones in it and a smaller circle of candles on the middle of it. Annette smiled, seeing your curious expression. "These are called dragon stones." pointing to the rocks, she said. "They become very hot when a small heat source is introduced. We use them for cooking and baking."

"That's incredible." amazed, Ana said. "We have nothing like that on Earth."

"Actually, you do." serious, Amadeus said. "You just have not discovered them yet."

"There are literally thousands of undiscovered minerals and creatures on your world." touching Ana's shoulder, Annette said. "Some unknown to us, some unknown to humans, and the rest unknown to both of us."

With that, she stepped back and took up a long wooden spatula before opening the oven with a heavy cloth like a pot holder. Watching from the side, Ana could see the dragon stones glowing inside. They were placed in rock indents all around the inside of the oven for even baking. On the bottom of the oven, Ana noticed, was a large single candle. Annette slid the long wooden spatula in and used it to pull out a pan with the yeast loaf and set it on a wooden plate on a stone counter. Once done, she put the spatula back on its large hook and took up what looked like a candle snuffer and put out the candle before closing the oven door.

"The spatula is made of cinder wood from a cinder tree." placing the pot holder aside, Annette said. "They are really stone outcroppings that resemble thin tree trunks." she smiled, adding, "They are cut and formed with special tools to make things like the spatula and the hot plate I put the yeast loaf on."

"This is amazing." awestruck, Ana said. "Those dragon stones would save my people, err, humans millions in electricity and gas per year."

"Millions of what?" curious, Annette asked. "That silly paper they call money?" she giggled. "What a way to run a world. It's invites greed into everyone's lives."

Ana sighed. "I can't argue with that." she said.

"Everything we need comes from the world around us." smiling, Amadeus said. "If we need something fixed or built by someone else, we call upon a neighbor and they call upon us."

"Of course, way of doing things is perfect but it works for us." calmly, Annette added. "Now, please wash your hands while I slice you a piece of yeast loaf."

Ana walked over to what looked like a stone sink and looked about, curious. "Um... Where do you get the water from?"

Anna laughed as she approached then pointed to two petals on the floor. "They're right under your nose, silly sister." amused, she said. "The right is cold water and the left is hot water." she then pointed to a green bar of soap. "That's the soap."

"I know that much, thank you." blushing slightly, Ana replied.

"Just hold down the petal until you are done using it." smiling, Annette said. "Its designed that way to prevent accidental spread of germs."

Ana pushed down the hot water petal the took up the soap and washed her hands before placing the soap back and rinsing. Once done, Anna gave her a towel she used to dry her hands. "Put it in the 'to wash' basket." pointing to a panel door in the wall, she said.

Ana pushed the panel open and dropped the towel down a wooden chute then turned to find Annette holding out a wooden plate with a slice of the yeast loaf. "Please, enjoy." she said.
1531312111112.title: Seeing the kitchen.

15313121111121.content:
Taking the wooden plate, Ana sat down on a comfortable 'bush seat'. It was a small bush, growing out of a large pot, that had been pruned into the shape of a chair. Next to it was another table, like the one in the living room where she placed the plate down and took the yeast loaf into her hands. The first bite made her smile as it was a bit on the sweet side but not overly so. "It's really good." after swallowing, she said. "It has a bit of a sweet taste to it."

"I'm glad you like it." smiling, Annette said. "That one slice will expand in your stomach, making you feel satisfied for a little while."

"Really?" curious, Ana asked. she smiled. "Then I better not ask for seconds if I want room for dinner."

Annette laughed. "You learn quickly, Anastasia." amused, she said. "All of our food is filled with nutrients and they all expand so no one needs fear hunger as food is always plentiful." she then winked. "Those who over eat, learn quickly that its not a good idea."

"What do you have to drink?" curious, Ana asked. "I'm a little parched."

"Why not try a fruit nectar drink?" pointing to what looked like a stone pillar, Ann suggested. "They are in the cool box."

"Cool box?" raising an eyebrow, Ana asked. "You mean like a refrigerator?"

"A what?" tilting her head, Ann asked.

Amadeus chuckled, leading Ana to the stone pillar, and pulled on a wooden handle, opening a steel door that Ana did not notice before. Ana was immediately hit with a cold breeze as she saw a number of bottles, sealed with wooden corks, inside on wooden shelves along with carefully wrapped food. "It is like a refrigerator." smiling, she said. "That's so cool."

Amadeus smiled. "The cool box is kept cold by a series of special gems that become extremely cold when introduced to a small amount of heat." patiently, he explained. "They are mined out of ground under what you call Antarctica."

"Wow..." awestruck, Ana said. "That's incredible."

Amadeus then took one of the bottles out of the cool box and closed the door before handing the bottle to Ana. "This is Strawberry nectar." smiling, he said. "It's made from both the fruit and the flower of the bush they grow upon."

Ana pulled the cork out and drew a sip from the bottle. Her eyes widened as the taste hit her; it was unlike anything she had tasted before. "It's delicious!" smiling, she said. "Do you make this here?"

"No, Anastasia." giggling, Annette replied. "We get these at the swap stores."

Ana sighed. "Swap stores?" she asked.

"I know this is a lot to take in, dear." soothingly, Annette said. "We'll help you learn everything but right now, I think we should continue with the tour."

Ana nodded, smiling.

Where do they go next?
15313121111121.title: continue.

153131211111211.content:
Upon entering what would be her bedroom, the first thing Ana saw was her bed. Like the group chair in the living room, it was a series of large bushes with impressively large leaves and flowers, weaved together with a strange sort of vine that was rooted in its own large pot in the center of the four bushes. The only difference was that these bushes were larger, forming her bed rather than a couch. Also, there were two strange plants at the foot of the bed with huge leaves bowing over the bushes that looked as if they could serve as blankets.

"This is called a sleep shrub." motioning to the bed, Amadeus said.

"On Earth, we simply call it a bed." to everyone's surprise, Ana said. "You know, as a flower bed."

Anna giggled. "That is easier to say." smiling, she said.

Annette smiled. "It is what it is, regardless of the name." amused, she pointed out. "Why not see if you think its comfortable?"

Ann sat onto the 'sleep shrub', or bed and smiled. "It seems very comfortable." she laid down onto it and stretched her legs. "Its very comfortable."

It seemed like a dream, Ann was laying down on top of a group of bushes like some fairy in a child's story book, it was surreal. Her adopted parents laughed as a sigh escaped my lips. "She is going to adapt well here." whispering, Annette said.

"It's been a long day for her, let us allow her to sleep." ushering everyone out, Amadeus said. "We'll finish the tour when she wakes up."

As everyone left the room Amadeus tickled the top of the doorway. A number of vines fell from the ceiling and weaved themselves together to form a solid door. "Wow..." sleepily, she whispered. "This place is endlessly wondrous."

With that, she fell asleep...
153131211111211.title: Ana's bedroom.

1531312111112111.content:
Later that afternoon, Ana woke up with a strong urge to use the bathroom. She got off of the sleep shrub and looked around to find that she was alone in her room. She turned one way and found what looked like a dresser and a vanity but that was not what she needed. Looking in the other direction, she found a doorway to what looked like a bathroom and hurried through to find what only could be described as a huge pitcher plant. It was a cucumber shaped carnivorous plant with an open top that lured insects in with a sweet scent. Once the insect lands to investigate, it hits the slippery insides and falls into its digestive juices.

"This is what they use as a toilet!?" worried, she asked herself.

Ana sighed and decided she had better at least try or have an accident. Cautiously, she sat down onto the plant, which surprisingly took her weight, and did her business. Once she was done, she stood up off the plant then turned to what she recognized as a sink. Remembering the foot petals in the kitchen, Ana found similar ones at the sink and washed her hands with some soap then walked back into her room to the dresser. It was made up of two plants that had their branches interwoven into each other, forming holes for drawers that were made of a curious colored bark. She opened one drawer and found a number of panties of which she took one and quickly changed out of her drawers she had warn earlier.

"That's a bit more comfortable." blushing slightly, she muttered. "Maybe I should change into a whole new outfit for the rest of the day."

Opening the other drawers, Ana found a knee length skirt and a blouse to wear. Once dressed, she turned to the closed door and tickled it as Amadeus did. The vines separated and rose to clear the doorway for her to pass. "This place is too much." giggling, she said.

Upon walking back down to the first floor of the house, Ana was greeted by Annette. "Did you sleep well, Anastasia?" smiling, she asked.

Ana nodded. "The toilet will take some getting used to." blushing she said.

"Toilet?" turning her head slightly, Annette asked.

"Where you go pee..." still blushing, Ana said.

Annette giggled. "Is that what you call it?" amused, she asked. "That is a waste plant, it eats waste."

"It doesn't eat... people, does it?" wincing, Ana asked.

Annette laughed. "No, dear child." giggling, she said. "It only eats waste." she then pointed at me, adding, "Just don't try to feed it your leftovers unless you want to clean up the mess later; waste plants can only digest waste, nothing more."

"Yes, ma'am." quickly, Ana said.

Annette smiled. "I think its time to start your flying lessons." firmly but kindly, she said. "Are you ready to start, Anastasia?"

"I have to learn sometime." shrugging, Ana replied.

"Very well, follow me."

Ana followed Annette out a doorway in the rear of the house where she found a large open space between the trees with a huge net about a hundred feet below them. "This is a flight training clearing." calmly, Annette explained. "Here you will learn how to fly."
1531312111112111.title: later on...

15313121111121111.content:
"It's just you and me, Anastasia." kindly, Annette said. "We all went through this training at an earlier age so there is nothing to be embarrassed about it you fall a few times."

"What- What do I have to do?" nervous, Ana asked.

Annette smiled. "Just open your wings and try to fly across the net to the other platform." simply, she replied. "It will take a few tries."

At first, it was difficult and Ana fell a number of times into the net. Fortunately, Annette did not laugh or even giggle. She only smiled and encouraged me to try again. On her tenth attempt, Ana managed to fly all the way across. "I did it!" excited, she yelled.

Annette giggled then applauded. "Well done, Anastasia." smiling, she said. "Now do it again a few times to give you some practice and then we will take a break."

Ana flew back and forth, flapping her wings or just soaring across. She giggled as she climbed a little higher each time before Annette called her back. "How did I do?" smiling, Ana asked.

"You did well, Anastasia." touching Ana's shoulder, she replied. "Right now, its time to take a break."

"What will we be doing next?" curious, Ana asked.

Annette smiled and replied....
15313121111121111.title: Ana learns quickly.

153131211111211111.content:
"Shopping?" Curious, Ana asked. "What do we use for money?"

Annette smiled, turning to a small bag at her waist. The bag had various pockets, each sealed with something similar to Velcro only it looked like a type of moss. She opened one of the pockets and produced a small number of seeds.

"All of the flowers we harvest for nectar produces seeds." Simply, she explained. "We exchange these seeds for what ever we may need."

"Couldn't everyone just grow what they need?" Confused, Ana asked.

Annette shook her head. "The soil would not be able to support all of the various plants we would need." Calmly, she said. "A man who grows furniture needs seeds to make more inventory. However, no one will buy a seedless group chair as it produces a fruit that people can eat."

Ana giggled then listened as Annette continued. "Those who sell items like group chairs ask for seeds to grow more in return for the finished product. They will, however, accept other seeds to buy straight nectar from us but its for adults only."

"Why?"

Annette smiled. "Straight nectar is what humans call alcohol. We mix the nectar of several different flowers to make drinks safe for the young."

"So one 'alcohol' deadens the effect of another?"

"In a way." Annette looked up at the sun then turned back to Ana. "We had better hurry, its almost flutter hour."

"Almost what?"

Annette took Ana's hand and hurried her along top the edge of their home and pointed out at a large flock of Misterians flying about in a frenzy. Ana gasped at the controlled chaos. "It looks like rush hour back on Earth."

"That's one way to look at it." Smiling, Annette stated. "Do you think you can keep up without getting lost in the frenzy?"

"I- I'll try." Uncertain, Ana said.

With that, the two flew off into the mix of flying people. Does Ana make it to market?
153131211111211111.title: We are going shopping.

info.brief_description: James Walker finds himself among the fabled Misterian race of angels after a heroic act.
info.description:
Hello everyone! I am back with my newest interactive! In this story, my own original character, James Walker, is back! Only, in this life, he is set to embark on a grand adventure through a new world which he must embrace.

If any of you have any questions about the story, characters, or nature of the angel race, please feel free to ask me questions and I'll be happy to answer. I have an outline prepared for this story (work in progress currently).

Here are the rules as usual:

1. Keep it PG-13!
2. You can have sex, but not descriptive and try not to have too much. In other words, no blowjobs or stuff like that!
3. Keep language PG-13 and also keep it tame (like not cursing every sentence)
4. Keep the story going and no killing the characters.
5. Try to make it a good length if possible.
6. Have fun with it and let's add to this new world together!

Story:

James Walker is an ordinary 21-year old living in Los Angeles, California. Since birth, he has dreamt of flying one day, which inspires him to one day become a pilot. To help achieve this, he is currenly attending college with his friends. Currently, it is summer break and he's completed his sophmore year of college. However, a chance meeting changes those plans as an act of heroism on his part forces him to live among the fabled Misterian race of angels. Now, in a new form, James must adapt to his new life, while freely embracing the freedom of flight.

Characters:

1. James Walker- 21 years old, short strawberry-blonde hair, blue eyes, currently attends college nearby with friends.
2. Myrrh: A princess of the Misterians. Looks like an older teen but is about 485 years old. Strong-willed and compassion. Often acts stubborn though, which often leads to trouble for her.
3. Erin Wilson: 21-years old and friend of James, harbors a crush on him from when they first met in Kindergarden. She is also Nate's twin sister.
4. Nate Wilson: 21-years old. James' best friend and twin brother of Erin. A good-natured rogue so to speak. Always bending the rules just a bit. Knows of Erin's crush on James and often teases her for it.
More charaters to come likely.
